d0phiOcDJW7IGibwXtNMqg.review_text: Yo ho, yo ho, a pirate's life for me!  Smuggler's Cove is a tight little space that really makes you feel like you are sailing away on the seven seas.  The drinks are carefully and exquisitely prepared with great attention to detail.  I especially like the re-creation of famous drinks from the days of yore at Trader Vics.    I had the Navy Grog and it was P-E-R-F-E-C-T-L-Y done; not too sweet and not too tart with just the right mix of tropical fruit juices, spices and rum.  It was fun watching the bartender prepare the various specialty rum drinks, which I think total over 80.  Especially entertaining was the flaming "Volcano" which we'll have to try the next time we visit.  As one of the early visitors to "Bourbon and Branch", which I thought was an over-hyped and pretentious joke, I'm not a big fan of these theme-based watering holes.  But Smuggler's Cove won me over and I will be back.  The place is comfortable, you can actually talk to other people without screaming and the staff seems to appreciate their customers.    I'd give Smuggler's Cove a "5" if it weren't for the fact that its greatest asset also appears to be its greatest liability; the complexity of its drinks.  These cocktails take time to build and that makes the drink-making pace a little slow.  I'm not sure how to overcome that and perhaps in the long-term it won't matter.  But I think if this place gets too crowded, it will be difficult for the bartenders to keep-up with the thirsty crowd.  Then again, given these libations aren't your typical fare, the extra wait is probably worth it.

LUb53R4GZBhcrheeSp-fhA.review_text: WOW what a crazy little place, looks straight like a pirate hangout, hella cool decor.  No music, just a straight bar, Got pretty crowded, but its def a spot to check out.

y5mYSq_r5WfXobkHvG22Hg.review_text: ARRRRR..... Love this place... great rum cocktails!  Look for the little icons to help you choose since there are a million options...  Theres an icon for popular drinks and strong drinks... So if you want to get your buzz on... go for the ones with the latter icon on them...  I think they have over 300 types rum! DAMN! All their ingredients are fresh and prepped that day... They put in a lot of work to make a great drink!

c9I2rg3wX1J4rmkTfNcYsQ.review_text: Went to this place the night before my birthday thinking it was gonna be awesome since I've heard amazing things about it. The  atmosphere and place is decked out greatly. But the drinks sound great on the menu but are brutal to drink. But that isn't the reason I won't be back. The reason I will NEVER return is their security guard at the door disgustingly presents himself. He comes to yell at my group when we are leaving and we said sorry it's my birthday we didn't mean to be loud. And let me quote his response "I don't give a sh** if it's your birthday" ouch man. We were honestly all in shock. It was totally unnecessary and so uncalled for.  Sad birthday :(

2rgzUE9BagBMWMFlcSKM8g.review_text: We were walking down the street and we see this black door.  My friend looks at us and says, "we're here" and opens this ominous door.  He shuffles us all through and the next thing I know I'm in...the Carribean?!?!  What the heck...so freaking awesome!  We ordered the Scorpion Bowl, and man that was the tastiest Scorpion Bowl ever.  My friend, who was visiting and celebrating the purchase of a new home, and I quickly got buzzed and happy.  The Scorpion Bowl is set on fire, they set some croutons on fire and hand it over to you.  My friend has celiac disease and told the wheat to "burn baby burn."  No bitterness there.  The guys also got some Cuba Libres and Mai Tais and enjoyed those as well. Overall, it was a lot of fun and we had a great time hanging out and being in this whole other world.  I was a little sad when we had to return back to reality.

xfO5UNKaPQiakpcYOrrQgQ.review_text: I came here on a Saturday night with a friend around 8pm, so there was no line. After a few drinks, we ended up here. The entrance to this place isn't well-marked, therefore, you have to look for a bouncer or have the exact address.   The entire place is pirate-themed and they have this rum drink that lights on fire when served to you (I forget what its called). The atmosphere is fun and I would definitely come here again with friends!

iYzbRy7B_Ho3NX-1rXvRLQ.review_text: In San Francisco, where bars and restaurants begin to seem similiar to one another, it is refreshing to see a place like Smuggler's Cove where having a drink can be a visual escape from our concrete surroundings.  You will be amazed at what they've accomplished with the former Jade space.  It is 100% true to the Tiki theme from the ceilings to the floor.  I visited on the opening night and while it took two waits ( 1 to get in, 1 to get a drink) to get a drink in my hand, the wait was worth finding my way to the bottom of the barrel (literally, the barrel drink).  The drink menu is primarily rum, but there are a few pages of other alcohol based cocktails.  For those looking for a hidden treasure in the Hayes Valley, pay Smuggler's Cove a visit.

qjBuaL6LapSDKpV7MIhrPQ.review_text: There's no other place like Smuggler's Cove! From the unsuspecting exterior, you can't tell that inside lies a three story tiki bar with a heavy resemblance to a pirate ship. They have a menu full of different types of STRONG cocktails with an emphasis on rum (of course). If you're with a group you have to get the obligatory drink to share that they light on fire! Similar to the scorpion (clam?) bowl at Tonic. Good place to start the night, so come early to avoid the line.  Though be warned, there are not too many options to go afterwards.

UnvwodJKxqXn6Bhhcm1Amg.review_text: Pirates of the Caribbean themed bar and drinks.  The drink menu was kind of long and hard to read in the dark, and it takes a while to make the drinks.  The service wasn't too friendly, but my drink was good. It wasn't crowded when I went on the early side Friday night.   My friend and I left after one drink because it just wasn't that fun in there, and the decor was kind of cheesy.

jyx1YqFeP1qKsmpWoGS1WQ.review_text: When they picked the theme, by god did they run with it.  Smuggler's Cove is by far the most unique bar I've been to in SF.  If you love rum and want to feel like a pirate, this is the place for you.  And the drinks, oh my, the drinks... The drinks taste amazing, and are ridiculously strong.  If you're going in a group, I recommend ordering the 4 person volcano.  It is literally on fire, and there's lots of flaming cinnamon.  It's just lovely.

CgKb22edkZoIqbOrDFnwtQ.review_text: Under the sea, your choice of sugary island liquor combination will sweep you and your crew away. No detail was spared in the decor. The staff are great and have patience for newcomers by finding out what speciality drink they'd like. All the drinks were great, especially the banana daiquiri and volcano (which comes with two bartenders to light it on fire and long straws for your crew to share in the icy tropical drink). All the drinks were strong!  Unfortunately most groups do not mix and socialize because of the 3 floors, tight areas, and "ooh and awe" of the inside. So come with your crew or casual date to spend quality time with them. Groups of 8 could come, and snag a table/seats.

UDE1cqNZpJcmPKNPy2U_Nw.review_text: This place was PACKED. A friend and I had to wait until two people left before we could get in (it was 7pm...so I guess after work crowd?). They have a plethora of drinks to choose from, with all types of rum. My friend and I decided to go with a "top notch volcano". It had pineapple juice, passion fruit juice, rum, and some other stuff with a lime lit on fire. It's big (enough for 4) but my friend and I had no problem finishing it ourselves.   The decor really reminds me of a tree house, since its 3 levels and each floor is pretty small. It's kind of like a tree house, pirate ship hybrid that only carries rum as cargo.

__Ksf1CCgaKdS3Gi5f6PcQ.review_text: 4 of us had a very good time there two weeks ago. We went as soon as it opened at 5pm so got to sit at the bar downstairs and had the full attention of Thomas,the bartender. Had various rum drinks including the Swedish Punsch made from Batavia Arrack which I've been wanting to hv for a long time and am glad,he agreed to make a 1/2 bowl for us! FYI,it's said to be the 1st ever punch made in the world and yep - it's  delishh! The other drinks we had were very good too. And they just recently was included in the Top 50 bars in the world by peer review mag-Drinks Intl.

lktvZdRSa1zqxYcaL0-Dsw.review_text: Smuggler's Cove is not the kind of place you should go if you have work the next day. That being said, it's the kind of place you want to go all the time, especially if you want to escape reality in a three level nautical, pirate, tiki wonderland. I am in favor of any and all excuses to drink copious amounts of alcohol served in a skull with fire coming out of it. Rum loving pyromaniacs, get ready to cry tears of happiness.   First things first, the place has a strict capacity policy, it can be a drag trying to get in here on a busy night. I wouldn't suggest it for groups and I also would make an effort to all arrive at the same time so no one gets stuck outside, waiting in line. The bouncers I've come across have been pretty chill and seem make it fair for everyone.   Second, leave your indecisive friends at home. They have a menu that makes Tolstoy seem like a breezy read. A paragraph per drink. I'd probably have to be carried out of here if I tried everything that caught my eye. The bartenders are pros and raise the bar in terms of the assembly, taste, and presentation. If I'm going to stray from my beloved whiskey and be in an ultra kitschy environment, I pray the drinks will do their job and taste like sweet ambrosia.   While it can be hard to actually get your cocktails in an expedient fashion, the highlights include the Volcano and Jamaican Planters Punch. Great value for what you get considering SF drink prices.   Third, they may have multiple floors and bars but it still only houses like 50 people and it gets particularly intimate especially on weekends. I don't mean intimate in the sexy sense of the word. I mean it in the pressed up against drunk strangers spilling sticky drinks on your open toe pumps kind of way. If you're trying to get loose at prime time, you might want to skip wearing that gorgeous white chiffon.   Fourth, the music is low enough to have a conversation so make this a destination for a first date. If the person ends up being boring, you'll be able to break the ice just by gawking at the decor. I mean, they even have a fountain. Worst come to worst, it's so dark that it's easy to make a clean exit.   *Insert inane pirate joke here*.

AUOb8U2Wa31Z2DThPpvAgg.review_text: When I found the door I swear I thought this was some kind of pirate cult.......the door is blacked out so be sure you know the exact address or you'll be wandering for days.   Smuggler's is definitely a diamond in the rough! Strong drinks with an array of rum choices. A little pricey in my opinion though (~$15/drink). Pirate decor decked out in the 3 story interior (on subgrade and other second floor). Seating is tough so my friends and I got snuffed sitting by the miniature waterfall downstairs. Lighting is horrible (makes it more authentically dingy?) so we had a tough time reading off the menu. It's actually fun watching the bartenders make the drinks but I wouldn't come back unless someone else wanted to see this place for the first time .   I recommend the sidewinder's fang for people who like fruity drinks and don't want that extra kick. If you order the puka punch you definitely get your money's worth in alcohol--a little stronger but still delicious. One of my friends ordered a zombie/dead man something and that tasted like death--basically a mixed drink that only tasted like rum+cinnamon which is cool if you're into that.

ogyPQrNjznVzfi8MVpRRpg.review_text: I had a fun time here. I've never been to a themed bar outside of Vegas (granted I don't go out much these days), but I really enjoyed this one. I liked the waterfall and the pirate ship feel. The drinks were also good and interesting. I'm tired of the same old cocktails, and enjoyed looking through the menu whilst waiting in line to decide exactly which one I wanted. The service getting a drink was on the very slow side, but it was packed so I understand there's only so much a bartender can do. I read some other posts who complained about how the bar was themed, but I think that's a strange thing to put in a review. It's a themed bar. If you don't like themed bars, don't go. Overall I had a good time and would recommend this place if you want to try something different from the average.

mpm9olv35gqQePUdQvK62g.review_text: I like it here. The drinks are good and stiff, the environment is fun. I keep reading about how awesome the staff is here, but they've been cold to me at best - it seems like they keep up with their regular, older clientele but don't want to cater to us young (but EXTREMELY sophisticated :) folk for drink recommendations and chit chat. I'll come back for proximity and especially with visiting friends, but I do not feel the warm vibe that others speak of.

PgvuHupXhfGMFjClJLV9Cw.review_text: Door man wouldn't let our group of 13 in. It was 7 pm on a Friday night and not at capacity. Because they wanted to maintain their exclusive reputation they wouldn't let us bring them revenue by buying drinks. We took our business elsewhere to Brass Tacks.

lrukUtbe3G2wiIR8t9E2vA.review_text: I appreciate the decorations and themed drinks, but I would never go back.  I hate waiting in line to get into bars, I hate getting pushed by people to get to a bartender and I hate being packed like a sardine in a basement!!!  This place is honestly an inside joke with some friends because we waited so long to get inside and it wasn't even cool.  I'm trying to understand why people like this place, and I've concluded it's probably the same people that go to Disneyland as adults -- which there is absolutely nothing wrong with that.  I'm just not one of those people so the pirate ship theme doesn't do it for me!

txirPsoKZneGl6nQjrSD9Q.review_text: HORRIBLE!!! my friends brought me to this establishment for my birthday. We luckily found a sit downstairs at the bar. Upon sitting, the older female bartender didn't greet us or anything. We had to ask for menus. She had the worse attitude ever. If you hate your job that much, don't make it miserable for others. We finally ordered some drinks. Which were good. And to our surprise, the bartender did take the time to let us know if we dropped the bowl our drink came in it would be $100 dollars. We were gonna order more drinks and invite more people but this bartender made it so miserable for us that we had to leave after only 30 mins. We went to BJ's and got the best customer service there!! Thanks BJ for saving my bday night :)

VrnuChlrlerRkcA3-QizrA.review_text: This is one of San Francisco's most unique bars! Great drink selection and makes me feel like I'm in Hawaii!

wT-mHNwxWaLhsHx4UEdyCg.review_text: A national treasure. Truly incredible. Can't wait to come back.

_jXd74oZFTB4V-p2mdiKdw.review_text: It's totally cool that there is a bar like a block from my apartment. I didn't know that it even existed until like a week ago, but it only opened up like 2 months ago, so I guess that's pretty reasonable. However, all of Yelp seems to know about it, so obviously they are much cooler than me.   But I digress. Having a bar so close totally enables my alcoholism. And it's both small and not too loud, which are definite pluses.  However, it's not a dive, which is a mild minus. The decor is actually pretty cool - it's pirate themed. I am a bad pirate aficionado, having only seen the second Pirates of the Caribbean, but not the first or third. I don't own a pirate hat, so I wasn't sure that I would get in, but the bouncer let me in with minimal heckling (actually, he was really cool).  Inside, there are three levels. There's kind of a balcony thing, which was occupied by a large party. Then there is a street level bar, and an underground bar. It's kind of cozy, but seems to work out pretty well. We found a seat no problem. They say on their website that capacity is 49, and considering how crowded it was by about 8 on a Thursday, I can imagine they hit it.  It seems like a lot of the drinks here are rum-based. I'm not all that into rum, so I ordered the house beer. It was pretty good, almost a lighter Guinness (I know, that's sacrilege). Came to $10 I think for two beers, so not too bad.  Overall, recommended. I will definitely come back.  Pirate-themed Haiku: --------------------------- Smugglers cove opens Pirates of Gough Street rejoice Be sure to bring coin

YVA6-PCbvDpNXHjoA4PNJw.review_text: We came in Sunday afternoon for a drink after a long day of shopping. Little did I know I was going to have the best drink of my life!! I forgot the name, but oh, dang! It was a grapefruit-rum-lime mix from Jamaica.  The bar is decorated like a smuggler's den, with boxes of "rum" and "sugar" to rest your drink on, and bright puffer-fish lights swinging between fish nets. Definitely coming back when I'm in a thirstier, more pirate-y disposition!!

JjryzIFXJj2lCRQot0X33w.review_text: I was really excited to try this place because of all the national acclamations it has received but it just didn't end up being my cup of tea. First off, it's veritably small even though it consists of 2 floors. You will somehow always be inadvertently bumping the person next to you. Though a little gimmicky, I did love the decor. I felt like I was on the Indiana Jones ride. On the weekends, plan to wait a good 20 min to get a drink. My drink was a little too sweet for my taste but maybe next time, I'll feel differently.

F9yf6eFZMyt0rPgjLFrHCw.review_text: Totally kooky and unabashedly kitchy, this place really makes you think you stumbled into the back door of a Disneyland ride.  But it's awesome--so incredibly freaking awesome.  Sometimes you don't want a dive bar, or a fancy cocktail bar with wood panels sourced from organic banyan trees.  Sometimes you wanna sip a crazy sweet, deadly alcoholic pink drink while surrounded by pirate swag.  Smuggler's isn't an everyday kind of bar, but when you're in the mood, it hits the spot.

WeOEn9Q4ojqYOUoZ7w0dQQ.review_text: Their drinks are fine, but honestly, most of the fancy blended drinks kinda taste the same; coconut this mixed with rum that.   And for the record I do  give major credit to the bartender that is on the first floor, he is phenomenal to watch and can make any drink in about 30 seconds.   My main complaint: The last time I went there. I had an open tab to buy drinks for my girlfriends. I bought 5 drinks, they wrote down 6. They corrected the mistake. But when I look at my bank account, they took out slightly more money than I gave them,not they price of the extra drink that never existed,  but a little bit more...  W.T.F.???

qSvD_eue22jv1ofDpT6YPA.review_text: Absolute best rum drinks I've had in my life.  They use fresh fruits and herbs and have an impressive selection of rum.  I can't speak much for the service at the busy times.  But, come for drinks after work and it is a chill, fun spot for some yummy tiki drinks.  I can honestly say I never knew how good rum could be until I tried their rum flights.  :)

EbbOIQ5oAamS9D_B_7cC7w.review_text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Smuggler's Cove yet. This may be the greatest Tiki bar in the world, and is definitely one of the best bars in the Bay Area and country.  SC is located in a residential neighborhood just north of Hayes Valley. It's an industrial, unassuming place on the outside. Inside it's a total tiki escape. The place is traditional tiki with no windows so a dark ambiance. There are small pools and water features. The walls are decorated with pirate paraphernalia. There are three levels, two different bars.  This is a small place. If you want a seat, get here early. They open at 5pm so I like to get there soon after. The place can get crowded and stuffy very quickly. On weekends, expect a line.  The bartenders make some classic and innovative tiki drinks. Get the Smuggler's Rum Barrel and you will not be disappointed. If you have a large party consider getting a bowl for maximum fun and drinking.  This place is seriously amazing and anyone visiting San Francisco should try this place.

Ic6-gs1_FjrWGx6JIr95Mw.review_text: I came to this bar to get to know a guy I met at another bar.  That sounds really trashy, but it really wasn't a trashy experience.  He recommended Smuggler's Cove, and this is a pretty cool bar.  We came on a weekday around seven or eight so there was no wait to get in.  The atmosphere here is worth every penny.  There isn't super loud music so you can actually talk to anyone you decide to come with.  It's a very cozy space, but don't let that deter you.  There are fun pirate decorations, and the three different levels are cool.  The vibe was chill, and I would totally come back.  I don't actually remember what I drank (I know.  This review isn't making me look good.).  It was a rum based drink, and I think it was around $18.  The drink was strong so you're definitely paying for the quality.  I would love to try a bunch of their other drinks in the future.  The bartenders were cool, but you will definitely wait a long time for drinks or to close your tab.  It's a tiny place.  Just expect to wait, and you'll be fine.

vUoqqRuTLorlp0yn-gNUSg.review_text: Drinks are delicious. Both mocktails and cocktails are great! Bouncer has a complex.

2r5SNxpO3Lm1BdVifBOeHA.review_text: What do you do when you are traveling in a big city and want to find a cool bar? You yelp, of corse! Yelp did not let me down here. The Smugglers Cove is a rad little tiki bar near the heart of San Francisco. What looks like nothing on the outside (I would have walked right past it if i hadn't had my GPS on) transforms to a tropical hideaway the moment you walk into the door.   Smugglers Cove features over 300 types of rum. The drink menu is quite large and extensive and is broken down into different categories. They have original rum drinks that the royal navy would drink (whilst hunting down pirates I hope), Prohibition Era Rum drinks, Caribbean Rum drinks, and modern day contemporary drinks. Everything is handcrafted with care. You can really tell that the bartenders have a passion for what they do, it really shows in the drinks they create. I didn't get to try anything that they light on fire, but I was very happy with my drinks. The Original Grog is AMAZING.  I cant wait to visit again on my next trip into San Francisco. It was one of the biggest highlights of my trip.

o-c8xWmr3XhoxlLykTAKXQ.review_text: I have been there a handful of times and have always enjoyed my time either with my bf or with a group of friends. The drinks there are solid and dangerously delicious. My personal favorites are hot buttered rum and pain killer #4. The volcano bowl is also a must for groups and it comes with fire theatrics. Albeit drinks are on the pricy side, the service, ambience, and revelry that go on there make them worth every nickel and dime you spend. It is crazy how sometimes it gets packed at the most random times (i.e., line starts to form around 6:10pm on a Saturday night) and some nights (week nights) it is nice and calm. Highly recommend!

XkVYiiB4Ms8pXn97bixBUQ.review_text: You would never guess from the outside that a pirate ship exploded inside! Went here last week and loved it! The decor is amazing and the bartender who was helping us was basically the fastest/ most accurate barkeep alive! Drinks are really good, only downfall is having a wait a while to get a drink because the place was very busy when I was there. Otherwise, cant wait to come back!

71Fg4T2MTjUmSE6K1ki25Q.review_text: Lots of delicious options with an overwhelming menu. A bit loud but people were nice. 20's crowd. The flaming drinks were cool, even if you weren't ordering one. The best drink appeared to be the Painkiller -- 3 ounces was pretty big. The pool of water was a nice touch.

1ArdBetF-pM3Y4eP1pgNPA.review_text: I went here for my birthday and loved every single cocktail I tried! First of all, the comment that it looks to be straight out of the Pirates of the Caribbean set is spot on...gotta love the skulls and petrified puffin fish hanging on the ceilings. The waterfall and pond with the back lights was also fun and made for a very laid back and tropical atmosphere. I ordered the Kona cocktail, a hot buttered rum, a volcano and a few others that I can't remember the names of now (I advise eating a large meal of carbs and/or melted cheese before hand in order to sop up all the rum that will be consumed...I made the mistake of going in on an empty stomach). Even in July, the hot buttered rum transported me to those cold winter days where you would sit by a fire drinking this classic rum cocktail. I loved it. Contrary to the butter laden rum drink, the Kona, on the other hand, was light and fruity. I loved the passion fruit and the flower that was placed in the glass as a decoration. For the volcano, you can't get much better than lighting a huge pot of alcohol on fire and having sparks fly everywhere. This was probably my favorite cold drink and I would order it again in a heart beat. The bar tender was amusingly sarcastic, which made for great conversation, and he really took his time preparing all the cocktails to perfection. All in all, a great experience and a nice way to celebrate any special occasion.

itXMelaTleEjLIFWCJtnwg.review_text: Mateys, I definitely recommend stowing away in this three-floor pirates' hideaway. Super-cute bar with plenty of pirate booty (and boot-ay...no Johnny Depp lookalikes, sadly, but hats off to all the hotties in SF). The menu is like a novella--waaay too many words for when you're on your third bar of the night. I selected Don's Original Grog for both its back-to-basics title and one-liner description. I think this place only has like a 50-person capacity, and it's new enough that it stays full. Good for them, but they should learn to keep a good crowd from affecting their service. I waited for-e-vah for my drink, and would have been considerably more annoyed had the bartender not at least excused himself with a cute "I've got a lot of drinks on deck" quip. Turns out, grog is not really my thing. Or more likely, rum is not really my thing (no thanks to a bad college experience involving the Capn' and elevated cage dancing). So for me, the best parts were the what's-hot-right-now vibe and the shipwrecked scenery.

Ziz1dBhYulEfv98sPj9NIw.review_text: For all the hype that surrounded this bar from friends and others, I did not find the experience to be all that special. After waiting literally an hour outside this establishment (an absolute must since they allow a very specific number of people in at a time... good for crowd control, bad for late-comers), I came in expecting to be whisked into a pseudo-paradise with inspired rum drinks and a liveliness and hustle to match.  When I entered, I turned to the right to see their "waterfall," which is really just a water trickle down some rocks, and a generally more relaxed atmosphere. We headed downstairs to the basement and all ordered different drinks. Their menu is expansive, and from the rum drinks I tried, they weren't bad, though none of them were particularly amazing. Part of this could be because it takes them about 15 minutes to make a drink at the bar, and after waiting outside for so long in the cold, I was expecting a bit more.  Some of the pros are that you won't feel claustrophobic while you are inside. Their crowd control does ensure that there are always a manageable number of people inside, and your group can very easily find seats. I think if I would have come here earlier, my experience would have been better, but when people hyped it up so much on the outside, it really wouldn't be able to meet my expectations.  So I think this is a perfectly fine bar. Their scorpion bowl drink looked really interesting too (they set that bad boy on fire!), but I think this is mainly a good place to bring friends to show them something new. Probably won't be a place I'll frequent or "dive" into on a weekly basis.

Fn5tCTyNNmvkUzfR_h3K2w.review_text: I get it, its a tiki bar, pirates theme, bla bla bla... kinda cool! kinda I am cool cos I go to Smugglers Cove... hehehe  Two main complaints:  EXTRA SMALL - ULTRA PACKED (it took forever to get our drinks) Drink Menu is kind of overwhelming, featuring over 70 drinks, it really makes it hard to pick- which is not the worst thing in the world. OVER PRICED - honestly an average of 14 p-drink? This is SF, lots of bars out there really doing mixology, smashing and squeezing fresh fruit in front of you for $10.  I can actually go back, but if I am going to end up spending an average of 15 per drink, I rather go to Rickhouse, Bourbon and Branch or Mr.Smiths and play with other spirits, because rum is not my favorite booze.  From 5 to 6 get $2 off every drink

fU0B5GazYlAVqQrEf7COrA.review_text: Whoa this place has a seriously intimidating drink menu. Luckily, the bartender was super helpful and knowledgable. He asked a few questions and suggested delicious drinks for me and my date. The lower level has a waterfall/pond thing that is pretty cool. I was there on a Monday night. It was fairly empty at 7:30 but by 9 had filled up. If i am craving fun rum concoctions, I will be a Smugglers Cove for sure.

FhTGJw8KrN4Ldak6GqvEXg.review_text: As if the rave reviews and award for Best Bay Area Bar weren't enough, it's safe to say that this place is amazing.  Just knowing where the entrance is is a treat.  As soon as I walked in I was transported to another world. A place so different from the one on the other side of the door yet, familiar. It was like being on The Pirates of the Carribean ride only, you didn't have to stay seated, you could stay on as long as you wanted and, BONUS, there were tasty, tropical drinks.  Of course, we ordered Pina Coladas and of course, they were DELICIOUS.  This is my new favorite bar.

eu4qYznVxXJqTbY23v8Lhw.review_text: Heavy on the kitsch....super expensive drinks....and a cramped floor plan.  I wanted to try it..and now I have.

mUN5xRP8CkrG5tLqqsb8mQ.review_text: A co-worker brought me here for the first time while in town for business, and honestly when he mentioned "pirate bar in San Francisco" I pictured a bad version of The Rain Forest Cafe, or dudes in assless chaps, eye patches and nothing else.  Fortunately the Smuggler's Cove doesn't fit either bill.  It reminds me of a late 60s era tiki lounge with a very impressive selection of drinks, chatty bartenders, and fun ambiance.  Honestly I can't take more than 1 or two mixed drinks, but their stuff is solid.  I ordered alot of the same drinks in Hawaii (Mai Tai, Zombie, etc, etc) and was disappointed that they didn't live up to Smuggler's Cove quality.

ZCabryqVuSd3kwqhyhGPDA.review_text: Upon walking in, this place seems quite strange, in a good way- wood paneling, pirate ship related things, a waterfall, and it is cozy. And the doorman was really friendly.   But the drinks are super expensive, and I don't know about everyone else, but it feels very unethical right now to pay $9 for a drink called "Port Au Prince", and the bartender making them was bitchy and uninspired, not at all helpful when I asked for suggestions. And the drinks are small.   And the crowd is totally marina/frat boy. As my husband commented- everyone had really "neat" haircuts. It felt a bit like a private frat party.   I doubt we'd go back.

4tmvlmzmDGhdmAK5_TXHKA.review_text: I went to a friend's birthday party here. She rented out the whole basement (for a large drink minimum, where she would have to pay the difference if it wasn't reached). We had food catered and brought homemade cupcakes - it's nice that they are fine with that but it'd be convenient if there was food there. She almost had trouble meeting the drink minimum despite there being a line at the bar for most of the night - perhaps they could bring another bartender on for events like this?  The drinks were great - different from the typical rum drinks I've had, and decently strong. I really enjoyed the Daiquiri #3 and the Daisy, but my friends who don't like rum had a much smaller menu to choose from and one complained of his bourbon drink being weak.  The atmosphere is great, the drinks are delicious (if somewhat on the pricey side - $9-13 per drink), and the bartender was really friendly and helpful when I asked for suggestions. I would totally go back, at least with some rum-loving friends, but I'm not sure I'd personally take the risk of renting it out and possibly having to pay up at the end.

mKrYQw7GNFjHzjyIsNrFvw.review_text: The #1 reason to come here: the drinks are delicious. Like really, really good. Sure, they take a few minutes to make, but it really didn't feel like we were waiting that much longer than in any other bar. And for abut $10 a drink, it's totally worth it -- I'm normally more of a wine girl and rarely like mixed drinks, but these were definitely worth making an exception.   The decor is also pretty sweet if you're into the pirate ship theme. Each floor has some unique twist on that theme, but all of them offer relatively limited seating options (but it's a small space in general, so what can you do?). Not really a problem to stand around, unless you want one of their punch bowls -- complete with a flashy fire show -- which requires some kind of tabletop (wooden, not the leather one by the pool) for them to serve it to you.   I thought it was kind of strange that there wasn't any music playing, so every room basically sounded like you're listening in on a bunch of random people's conversations because, well, that's what it was. None of the bartenders were too friendly, either, but they obviously know their rum and how to make some incredibly tasty drinks... good enough for me!

aD-rsDe2S0e7jTkYD6ULaQ.review_text: Great escape into a themed pirate world and huge menu of specialty drinks.  Eve award: best combination of Disneyland and a bar :-)  Highlights: - Immersive environment: right when you step in, you're transferred into another world. It's a bit dark and musty with 3 floors: entry area with stool seating at the small bar, seating up top, and main area down the metal stairs. There's a small pool of water and dark walls--you feel like you're actually in the underbelly of a pirate ship. Warning: you may not be able to suppress singing a little "yo ho yo ho, it's a pirate's life for me." ;-) - Menu: huge one given to you upon entry and lots of good stuff in there. Primarily rum, but there are other options if that's not your thing (though this would be the place to try). They have standards like mai tais and daiquiris to ones I've never heard of: mostly filled with different fruit juices and spices.  - Bowls: if you have a group it's fun to get one of these, see it be lit up, and drink through long straws. Note to get a more exciting fire show, you need to get the other bowl that's not the scorpion.   Lowlights: - Small place: can get crowded so come early if you want to grab a spot to sit - Drinks speed: since each is crafted with a large handful of ingredients, they can be a wait before you can take your first sip - Size: some drinks come in super small glasses and you get through them quickly in a few sips :-o  Had a great time here on a Friday night and I'll definitely be back.

ZAlbHJhQUSVqMTe32qkchw.review_text: Transport to an time of salt in yer nose and a sword ayn yer belt, scruf a'n yer face and a wench in yer arms.... then take that to the burlesque show and douse the flame out with a spot of gourmet rhum drink... but the flame keeps burst'in back alive. That be Smugglers Cove!

Oad_m8_6uBdZXy-DVNMJcQ.review_text: The line outside is worth the wait! It is intricately decorated and the drinks are delicious! One of the coolest themed bars I've been to!

G9J2uWRrPltfq2rHxSCC8A.review_text: Solid spot to go for a cool experience, at least once while living here, or to take guests that want to see / do something unique.  The interior is magical and very cool to see. Outside of the scorpion bowl there's really not much to rave about in terms of drink selection - just a lot of very strong rum drinks.

f6_KXMhmGTaOHxi0p6R_ng.review_text: -Pirates of the Caribbean style themed bar: Check  -Long list of clever mixed drinks: Check  -Great intention of making SF a rum city despite bourbons strangle hold on it: Check  -Free rum sample when you get in from waiting in the cold: Check  -Polite staff: Check  -15 people waiting forever to get drinks from the one downstairs bar tender because no one bar tender could do that job: Check  -Ridiculous printed t-shirts for the staff instead of themed costumes: Check  -Laminated chain-restaurant style menus in case you get so excited by the list of drinks... Well you get it: Check  -Odd mix of bar goers, from creepy "This is my local bar" guy to "I just got off work in my suit despite the fact that it's 9pm and thought it would be appropriate tiki bar attire" guy: Check.  -Incredibley loud thanks to the tight confins: Check.  As much as this bar has going for it, the odd misses stick out. Almost like they put so much time and effort into the decor that they were spent by the time they got to the details.  That and both times we've been the bar tender repeatedly asked, "Is that okay?" nervously after serving us.  It's like a doctor giving you a perscription and then nervously asking, "Is that okay?"  Questionable in my book.  I plan on giving it a few months before a head back, and I'm sure they'll be closer to 4 stars.

thY4tADfgZPJwySQmRkG9g.review_text: Expensive though it may be, there is just something about Smugglers Cove. Sure it may take you 20 minutes to get your drink on a Saturday night, and there is that damn line at the door that may make you have to leave because a majority of your friends aren't allowed to enter the premise, but the tasty cocktails, the decor, the ambiance, the cushy seating areas...these are all things that make it special enough to brave the crowds!   I am not exactly sure how much alcohol is in each of these drinks (for which the pirate style type map menu lists man), but this wasn't the main kicker for me. The drinks were, for the most part girly, but I liked them. I usually HATE drinks with any sweetness and there was something pure - aka not syrupy - about them. I was impressed.   I look forward to giving this joint another visit. Most likely, I will make sure someone else is buying the drinks though ;)

gAaEU38D4GaFqESHJ_AicA.review_text: I've gone to Smuggler's Cove three times on the insistence of numerous friends who all love it. I've tried, and yet despite my best efforts, I absolutely hate Smuggler's Cove.  Everything about its being is counter to what I want in a bar.   Overly sugar-y and artificial drinks?  Check Crowded, loud, and full of obnoxious screaming types? Check Decor that is reminiscent of Rainforest Cafe meets Circus Circus? Check  While I recognize there are a lot of people who love this place, it is decidedly not my style.

T4gJBo6jA9BbbwDZT8M-Fw.review_text: I discovered Smuggler's Cove a few months after it opened.  It used to be Jade Bar and then one day my boyfriend and I walked by and there was a green light on outside this bar.  Having no idea what was going on and how we didn't know a new bar had opened in our neighborhood, we walked in...and thank you Jesus we did!  I love this joint, I love the decor, and more importantly I love the drinks.  True, they are expensive; true they can sometimes take time; true, it is small but really, who the F*$%k cares!  The drinks list is extensive (albeit sometimes overwhelming so I've now resorted to flipping through pages and blindly picking one), the bouncers and bartenders know what they're doing and it's one of the most unique experiences in the city.  If you want a great first experience, go when they open at 5pm, sit at the bar and chat with the bartender.  They'll tell you everything you'd want to know about Rum and trust me, they have EVERY rum in the world.  And, you should come here if you don't like Rum, they have great drinks with all other liquors as well.   Arrrrrrr!

bV4m22UFyuNYC8vvQUgFwA.review_text: There are no big signs outside to let the neighborhood knows it exists.  It's definitely a local non-tourist kind of spot.  It is small and cozy inside with all kinds of awesome pirate-ship designs.  When they get busy and packed, the place isn't the best to be at because there's nowhere to even stand.  Their drinks are pretty strong.  I ordered "The Painkiller" (Light Version) that looked like it had girly fruity ingredients and even that was kind of strong.

FCBGcmYOvN9LVI3CwMQiKg.review_text: Maaaaaybe Im just a wuss. But holy goodness.. I was so miserable after drinking ONE drink.. So much sugar! I understand the theme here is tropical drinks. But wow! Definitely wont order that one again!  On the flip side- Very interesting bar. Obviously they get huge points for choosing a theme and totally selling out to it.  The crowd here seems to be.. guys after work.. and regulars.. and people trying it for the first time.. and people bringing out of town friends.  As mentioned in most reviews- the line can get pretty long. But I would recommend maybe doing a drink here before dinner- beat the crowd and maybe not feel too sick to go out afterwards?

BjnKGhst96DvmF6VGjDCOA.review_text: So much fun!!!! It's worth the wait; just get a couple of drinks beforehand at a different bar. Be sure to order the Volcano. They light the drink on fire and it's so amazing.

_don8EWxNsvRdjDJqWbw0w.review_text: I don't like rum, but I made an exception at Smugglers. I ordered three dots and a dash, it was delicious and STRONG. The bartenders were friendly and super nice, albeit busy. Really cool bar, interesting crowd and nice ambiance.   Started feeling slightly claustrophobic downstairs but the drinks helped. My friends arrived before me and the doorman wouldn't let me join them inside without waiting in line, so I was stuck in line by myself for 30 minutes. Bummer but the cove made up for the wait!

KKTPRu5jSM-gFAU5RoM7Bg.review_text: Ahoy, Matey!  Smuggler's Cove is located kind of in the middle of a housing area, and if it's not for the incredible long lines that it usually has, you'd probably miss it walking by. On the outside, there really isn't much decor. As soon as you step in though, it's pirate heaven!  Drinks are awesome, my best advice is to go with a few people and try as many drinks as possible. They have a huge selection and they even have a punch bowl style drink that is perfect for big groups.   If you are there just to hang out and enjoy the ambiance, you will have a decent time. But if you really enjoy rum and the Tiki culture, this is the place for you!  Drinks - 9/10 Prices - probably on the expensive side but hey, it's damn good! Ambiance - Its really dark, but the decor is very pirate-themed, including a tiny waterfall!

Ieg1z6bc94U_RfS-OGxQ_A.review_text: Yarrrrr.  Try the Pain Killer.  Love,  Pirate Katie

UVO0vrdc8Jfm00p7ixuf7A.review_text: Be warned your eyes wont adjust until a minute later- esp if youre going in while the sun is still up!  Fun staff !  Strong drinks. That's all ya need right?! Not just that, but there's the punch bowl too which they light on fire. A good show for a few seconds, for the cameras and amused faces.  three levels. tiny.  dont try going after 10pm, might never get in.  love it.

yYTIrIhEZPNToqf364N2qw.review_text: Great place to go with a group of friends and amazing service. Drinks are made so well. Definitely coming back. The one and only con is the wait to come in. Aside from that awesome, awesome place!

S1Yu4McDc-ecjMO5PgW2dQ.review_text: I love Smuggler's Cove.  So much, that I held my engagement party there.  The only thing I have come to dislike about this place is how packed it gets - and so quickly! It seems like no matter what day of the week I come here (and it's pretty frequently) there are few places to sit by 5:30pm!   Great drinks and great staff.  I have tried almost all of them - I love the shared bowls, coconut cream drinks and the GROG, especially!  I love that the place is hard for first-timers to find.  Also love the borderline-cheese factor in the decor.   My dream is that one of these nights I will see someone fall back into the pool.   Gawd, I love this place! I just can't say enough!

q2q0mZYs9c-iKU4pat31fQ.review_text: Ridiculous line on a sunday for an unlabeled building in the late afternoon.  Came here as part of a food tour and I have to say this was my favorite stop.  The drinks are amazing, and the staff incredibly knowable about their rum.  This place really represents the history of rum, and it really shows on their menu.

8fSaLfemE1G403PMJzfATw.review_text: Smuggler's Cove is a great tropical drink style bar. It has the decorations to make it feel as though you are in a ship. While the bar is fairly small there are three separate levels. You enter on the second floor which has it's own bar and some limited seating around the bar and the wall. Downstairs (where we spent most of our time) there is a rock wall that has water running down it, giving the whole sunken cave feel. BE AWARE though, the water does splash on part of the bench that runs along the fountain.  We came as everyone was finishing their happy hour drinks (about 6:30 on a Sunday) and it was busy! No seating was available for the first half hour that we were there, but then at 7 everything suddenly opened, it was easier to get drinks, seats and more comfortable.  The bartender was extremely nice, he had been there since the opening of the bar over four years ago. All of the drinks that we had were awesome but the tops:  Don's Own Grog - A mixture of many different ingredients including: ground spices and an on location made blackberry liqueur. Far   Sidwinder's Fang - More citrus with lime, orange and passion fruit.  Both are rum drinks, which is kind of Smuggler's Cove's thing, and rightfully so!  Definitely worth checking out!

rkMqlSV_NEg4O29RUPgp4Q.review_text: I've frequented this bar since they opened and have always been aware that it is one of the top 50 bars in the WORLD. I never thought it necessary to "review" it because I feel it's reputation preceeds it and also I didn't want any more people to visit it and crowd it out. any reviews here that are short of 5 stars are naive and short-sighted. The staff here are great, hence the award of Best Bar Staff from the Guardian recently. The rum selection is cutting edge and unsurpassed in the US For Tiki info check out TikiOasis dot com.

IKwsGotasR27FMY2eQ2gHg.review_text: You'd never know this was a tiki bar from outside. It looks like an office block.  Once you enter there's no mistaking it though, the pungent smell of rum and the straw roof and indoor mini lagoon kind of give it away pretty quickly.  Our group ordered two share cocktails. Served in a bowl designed to look like a wooden log, the liquid is set on fire when served at your table, and there is a wick at the centre of the bowl that continues to burn as you sip the delicious burnt marshmallow-like skin off the top of the cocktail from long straws.

E727WbxiCBHUwLRFKfJniw.review_text: This is such an awesome bar! You feel like you're on a pirate ship. Went here for a rum tasting and loved it. I didn't try the cocktails but they looked and sounded delicious. The ambiance is the best part about it though.

J9HamWsxKorlPGUAXy-M9Q.review_text: I really liked the interior design at this place.  Makes it look like I'm in the movie Pirates of the Caribbean.  The pirate ship drink you order gets lit on fire when the bartender serves it to you.  A very good show to bring friends from out of town.  The drinks are mixed well - doesn't taste amateurish like a clubbing bartender.  Bring some friends because the strangers are friendly especially if you are female.  Actually, all bars in SF are like that.

c77e9_8PenZ_7aBX82NszQ.review_text: This place is a must visit for sure at least once in your SF life, especially if you like rum.  We had two rounds of drinks.  The first set was awesome.  I believe mine was called something like "Aku", but I don't remember.  Neither of us were thrilled with our second choices.  We wanted to try something different (minimum $9-10 per drink), so I ordered a second round from the apparently "best mixologist in the country".  My drink lost much of its flavor because this mixologist made the drink with 3/4 soda.  Bubbles aren't really my thing, as I felt I was drinking a flavored soda from can. When I very sweetly asked to bartender to counter off the soda with something - I got treated as if I had insulted the art form.  I was treated very rudely - thought my head was going to get cut off, again despite being super appreciative about it.  The other flavors were so good, I just wanted to taste them, not bubbles.  Anyway, they may be the best mixologist, but it is always a little risky to take one's job too seriously.  People have different palettes and that's a fact. The experience left a bitter taste - even someone at the bar noticed the bartender's rude response.  Otherwise, I think the place is very cool.  The decor is fun and interesting.  The seating isn't super flexible and it is a bit drafty downstairs on a cold day.  I would go back again, but probably wouldn't be too adventurous with the drink orders.

Em4ak5pSm3V_eX1MhlLV0Q.review_text: Again, the drinks and service. .  . so great. Of note: the Black Prince and 12 Mile Limit. Superb!!!

_AQJ5aSswzv-CuP6XwhyrQ.review_text: Love the ambiance ! Feels like I'm walking into the pirates of the Caribbean at Disneyland. There isn't a ton of seating but it's a chill spot . There's 2 bars and a small seating area upstairs . There are a huge variety of drinks in their menu , I tried a hibiscus drinks and then shared the volcano . Definitley a place I would come to again .

YFG_qsnCwHTxgPAYYW-YQQ.review_text: Nice job transforming the old Jade into a castaway's hideaway.  Friendly staff, good drinks.  Favorite drink of the night is the blonde parisian.

R0QvG_fkNmKQ7W3nDu0NQg.review_text: From the outside, during a torrential storm for SF, this bar is very unassuming, with its blacked out windows and small sign outside. This definitely fits into the motif of the bar, as stepping in the door reveals an amazing treasure tucked in Lower Haight.   The decorations and design of the bar could not be more spot-on for a Smuggler's Cave with a 3 level design of overhang/bar/basement. I'm especially impressed with the details, such as "rhum" crate tables, industrial-grade metal steps, stone wall with a waterfall, globular lighting, and lots of palm fronds all around.   The menu is just as detailed and flavorful. Each drink listing not only tells you the ingredients, but also provides a nice little description of the drink, from its history to how it should be enjoyed. One standout that our group enjoyed is the Hot Buttered Rum drink. It looks like watered down hot chocolate with a cinnamon stick thrown in, but it tastes like magic and was exceptionally delicious, considering the downpour happening outside. At the end of our stay, a nearby group ordered the Volcano, which is a group drink, complete with burning crouton. I'll definitely try that next time I'm there.  Their rum selection is also top notch. I'm personally a fan of brown sugar Jamaican rum, and was glad to find it a regular ingredient in many of their cocktails.   The only "negatives" I can think of are that it's a smallish bar (max 49 people) so you'll likely have to wait in line to get in, or go early to get a seat, the drinks are city-priced (expect to spend about $10 a drink), it's first and foremost a rum bar so order a rum drink, and there isn't food, so it's a good idea to eat beforehand.

5ZXT4BQB-C1XjUpKmh7kaQ.review_text: I am so sad I discovered Smuggler's Cove a week before I moved to New York.    Rum is my spirit of choice, so an entire bar devoted to the art of my favorite libation is something I should've discovered 3 years ago.  Alas, I made sure to return twice in the week I had left in the city.    Sure, some drinks are hit or miss depending on your personal tastes, but with so many choices you're bound to find something you like.  I'm a big fan of the Dead Reckoning.  And honestly, who doesn't appreciate the classy pirate decor?    There's more flame to their lava bowls than at other tiki bar establishments, the bartenders are efficient and talented, and they never skimp on garnishes.  There are 3 levels, but that doesn't mean you'll get a seat if you come too late in the evening.  So show up after an early dinner and enjoy a fine crafted cocktail from their epic menu where you can learn the history of the drink in addition to its ingredients.

zAiox5Gw6V0mr0IPOo6rYQ.review_text: Bartender refused to make specialty volcano/scorpion bowls.  Seating situation was sub par.  Decorations were great, but did not make up for lack of service/drink quality.

lNxRaIO2wNqMkCcQ8hhtyQ.review_text: If we stayed here longer, I am pretty sure Smuggler's Cove would now be my new favorite bar in San Francisco.  Mad kudos to our Lyft driver who tipped us off on a "pirated themed bar with rum drinks" nearby.  When you sell it that way, you would think that the theme aspect would be really tacky, but it was SO COOL.  Our group of 5 stopped here around 11pm on a Friday night before going dancing in Castro.  We had no trouble finding parking nearby, getting in, and waiting our expected wait for these fine crafted drinks.  I had so much fun watching the bartender work his magic.  By the time we decided on our drinks, he was able to whip up FIVE different, complex cocktails AT THE SAME TIME.    SKILLED!  I thoroughly enjoyed my drink - The Sidewinders Fang, a rum concoction with a touch of passion fruit syrup, topped with a devious snake-like orange peel.  All that was missing was a beach, sand, oh...and some sun!  I couldn't help but want another by the time I reached the bottom of the glass :(  Next time, I must try one of their infamous Volcano punch bowls.  Yes, there is fire involved, my pyro happy friends!! Unfortunately, you are required to be sitting at a table in order to partake in fiery libations and tables are scarce in this small, but full-of-character establishment.   Note:  A majority of the cocktails are rum based, but they do make some with different base liquors and they do not disappoint.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: Perhaps you'd understand it better Standin' in my shoes, It's the ultimate enticement, It's the Smuggler's Cove blues. Imagine Bob Mitchum and Harry Belafonte (tikiroom.com/img/35x4a6c…) sipping bottomless (well, at least potent) tropical cocktails. Faraway locales, where time seems to slip on by. An island escape, after the big heist that finally paid off. That's the sort of vibe you want in a proper tiki bar, and the laid back paradise at Smuggler's Cove captures that wayward leisuredom. Bonus: They have a beer on tap, crafted just for the bar, from the folks at Thirsty Bear, and a jug wine bottled just for them as well. Otherwise, stick to the rum!

WGy98ftApSKJqgcPQR8gKA.review_text: It felt like I walked onto a set for the Pirates of the Caribbean. It was my first time here & nearby parking was very easy to find for a Friday night in the city. Luckily, my friend suggested it; otherwise, I would've never known about it. This place has 3 stories with a bar on the bottom floor. My friends & I stayed on the bottom floor & sat next to the small little replica of a lagoon until a spot at a table opened up.  My boyfriend & I ordered drinks at the bar. He got a drink with milk & rum. It was really strong for my taste, but overall, it was okay. I got a sweeter drink also with rum, but in a martini glass. The drink was garnished with a beautiful Hawaiian flower. The bartender was very skilled at making these cocktails because mine tasted very refreshing. For her, it looked really easy! My drink was enough to get me lightly tipsy, which I think is the perfect medium between having fun & being too sloppy. I enjoyed it while my friends & I sat & talked at a nearby table. The noise level at the bar wasn't too loud because my friends & I were able to talk at a normal volume without difficulty hearing each other. I had a really fun time with friends over really tasty cocktails. I was so happy that I came here =)

nnmKt0M8TpxoJr9BJbJ75g.review_text: A bar with 200+ rums?! I'm there!  After dinner at Absinthe we headed down the road to the Cove.  Location:  red and green lights.  Beware no signage, just bulbs and a line.  A line for a bar...? Really... imagine that.  Has you wondering what's really going on inside. 10 minute line wait: worth it.  Unique, tri-level bar with excellent mixologists skilled in concocting delicious,  visually appealing cocktails.  This is the place you go to actually enjoy alcoholic mixtures, not like a dive bar where you just get wasted from them.  Although... that is still bound to happen.  If the 6 page menu is just too overwhelming for you or you just don't feel like leafing through it because there are laughs to be had and cute boys to be seen, ask the mixologists for their recommendation.  A few questions and they'll suggest the perfect drink.  They know their mixology and it's your best bet.    Until, of course you become a regular and join the quest of trying everything on the menu, which they help you do by giving you a nifty punch card to keep track!  Lemme get that card so I can get my rum mixology on and have my name added to the Smuggler's Cove Manifest!

TcghFuOWJwyz_-XT1pTk6A.review_text: Came here last weekend on a visit to San Francisco after a friend recommended it.  Loved it! Definitely exceeded my expectations of what was described to me as a 'Pirate Bar'  My advice - get here early! This place is small and we arrived at about 9:30pm just in time to score the last seats in the bar.  We spent 20 minutes perusing the extensive menu of rum drinks and laughing at the entertaining descriptions.  We then proceeded to watch as the table next to us was served some sort of group drink that was lit on fire!   We had to head out after one drink because the drinks were so strong, but we enjoyed every second - this is definitely a bar that should not be passed up on a visit to San Francisco!

PTOumaw4TxhtDrTkW47EMQ.review_text: Had a blast here. We came a little later and had to wait outside for maybe 20 min or so till it wasn't so crowded. Inside was a pirate lovers dream! Theres a bar on the main floor and one downstairs. All together it's 3 floors all decked out in pirate paraphernalia.  If u like rum you will be in rum heaven. The Drink Menu Is Ridiculous! The drinks are amazing and come decorated as well. Definitely worth another trip!

t1NmJ-g09NijXqycgF-evA.review_text: Three levels, two of which have bars. Still not enough seated space, but what can you do. Nice little fountain downstairs and an impressingly extensive drink menu. Beer drinkers there is one Smugglers Brew option!

ui_n-pBvOFA13ab9u1xzgw.review_text: Visited this bar for the second time recently.  Brought friends up from LA to have the awesome experience I had here my first time.  Place was crowded on a Saturday night and extremely understaffed.  Took over 40 minutes to get three drinks.  I watched the lady bartender downstairs serve people who got there after us almost immediately.  Frustrated, I called the bartender out on this when I finally got the three drinks, and was given attitude and even mocked.  Asking for the manager led to him belittling my view of the establishment, saying they craft art and it's more efficient to make the easier drinks first.  I'd believe they actually had a system, as the manager said, if the other drinks were actually different from ours.  Bar upstairs was cranking them within a few minutes.  Highly pretentious and horrible service.  The drinks are good, but they're not worth the wait and attitude.  Never again Smuggler's Cove.

xSSh0fGVrqAA7THN1At-Mg.review_text: Wohooo, having a proper rum pirate style ;) how cool is that?  you wouldn't even notice this place from the outside, seems to be kind of an insider thing.  but when you walk in, you are being transported to pirates of the caribean :) very cool interior decor, oodles of different drinks and especially rums to choose from.  only downside, the downstairs barroom is a bit small in height,..

Tm6QJcNn1QY2IYd2IZiUaQ.review_text: bouncer was the biggest asshole! ruined the whole experience by acting like he was doing a favor by letting us in.   Bartender didn't ask what I liked just made me something.  "Plenty of room downstairs" means squishing up against other seated tables. cool vibe but not enjoyable based on service.

cEXDzORurZ2dFx-B_jrjqQ.review_text: An encyclopedic selection of rum-based cocktails from around the globe, prepared with care, all served in a comfortable, fun and whimsical environment.

em8v20UxN9kc7f41ERNedg.review_text: Some of the best and strongest drinks in SF.  It's expensive, but worth the splurge!  Feel like you're on a pirate ship, which is also a huge plus.  Get's busy later in the night and is almost impossible to get a seat unless you get there early.  They have amazing, strong rum drinks that are very dangerous because you almost can't tell that they have alcohol, which led me to a day and a half hangover, but they're so good that I'll be sure to go back.

g5qD10shooDJEPjt6miMrw.review_text: Awesome divey tiki bar. They take their mixology seriously and you benefit from this. Bring a group so you can order a Scorpion bowl. Also loved that there were non-rum drinks...I'll take a Stash Sling anytime.

ErEJsypAr9r48gy92Nbxpw.review_text: I don't normally review bars, but I just have to review this place and I'll make it short.  First of all, the decor is just breathtaking. It is like they hired Disney Imagineering to design the bar because it is so impeccably designed and convincingly detailed. I felt like I was in a different world. On top of that, their drinks were DAMN delicious. I had quite a few drinks: one came in a boat, another came in a skull. But there is one that stood out: hot buttered-rum. MY OH MY I was blown away. I mean, it was a warm drink and definitely had a holiday feel to it but good lawd I will be bold enough to say BEST DRINK I've ever had in a bar. I'm about to wrestle the bartender for the recipe. Although I'd probably lose, so maybe not.

Sg-xjigaka6fFjBXgSM_Gg.review_text: Definitely a place to go, if you are into rum at all. Especially if you are not from the US, this place might teach you how rum can taste beside the world wide well known Havana Club series. Special thanks for getting a Cuba Libre that tastes delicious without making use of any Cuban rum!

72HBbs1zbbsoo4t_UpEIaQ.review_text: Super cool idea, but falls short. The space is tiny, and it's decked out in a sweet pirate theme. There are three floors, all of which will fill up fast.  The drinks were great! Only they took forever to get (because everything is a crazy cocktail here and the bartenders are in no rush) and cost about twice as much as you'd expect (though they were rather strong).  Definitely worth checking out, but I likely won't be back.

w9Q6qPp-NS0cc1ZIv6oUhA.review_text: OH MY! WOW! Those drinks arghhhhhh strongggg. Watch out.   The menu for this place is unbelievable. You'll need to allow for a min. of 5 minutes to read through and decide on what you want.   The hibiscus drink was so beautiful in color and striking in taste. I would totally order it again. It's got more of a tart taste versus sweet. It's also garnished with a hibiscus flower which you can eat. Woo!   I was here with a rather large group of coworkers, so I was able to witness / sample many other beverages (too many of which to name.) Speaking of the drink names, they all have very clever pirate-ish names.   Go big here, but have arrangements in order to get home. It can catch you by surprise.

4UL3DMIbD75c9xLXYB-Saw.review_text: I hate ranking anything 3 stars, I think it's a cop out, but I am mixed about this place. My friends and I went there last Sat. for the first time totally decked out in pirate gear. I had the full sexy pirate costume thing going and my friends were looking sexy too. This place is SMALL, we had to wait outside in the rain for 20 min. and then when we got in, wait in line for drinks, it's super dark and the drinks are NOT VERY YUMMY and VERY EXPENSIVE.  That being said....I love theme bars (dressing up is my passion) and the lighting and decor is pretty cool. It's a fun to do once kind of thing I would tell people.  My suggestion...not sure what it's called, but order the 'big orange drink' in the goblet glass..(I tried all my friends drinks and that one was the only one I liked).  All in all, it was a fun experience.

HPWgwcbfIWxCGdMCWksrDw.review_text: When a bar executes a theme well it's hard not to fall in love with it. Smuggler's Cove has done just that. The menus, the drinks, and the decorations all fit the theme but don't do so in a tacky obnoxious way.   The drinks are really great and are not insanely priced. They have a rather large drink menu that provides lengthy descriptions of each drink which was, for me, initially overwhelming -- the menu is HUGE. I had two drinks. My favorite was the Jamaican Milk Punch (it tasted kind of like egg nog).  The vibe was very casual which I liked. This is a great place to go for drinks after a busy day at work.

k05ARw8nF3nP2KJPYau0nQ.review_text: Three words: Hot Buttered Rum -this drink tastes like what I imagined butterbeer from Harry Potter to taste, YUM  Scorpion Bowl--I'm not a huge fan. The fire show is great and all once, but if you've had it once, try going for the individual cocktails, a lot of them are wonderful  The bouncers can be snooty and take a lot of time to let you in even when people leave, sometimes.  Go Tuesday and Sunday nights for a smaller crowd and more interaction with bartenders!

hCyGy0XVGF--OsoTP522ZQ.review_text: I've been here when the bartender has been enthusiastically describing the different rum drinks (am a tiki lounge newbie), though last time, I thought the other barkeep was unfriendly and snobby.   Still, because it was one of many times I've been there, I am not rating my love for this place on that one experience. I've never stayed upstairs, only downstairs, but always found the folks there friendly and a mixed bag - just my type of peeps.

skrtZlqSuXULaoy7W7JjHQ.review_text: This place is awesome! Great atmosphere and the drinks are crazy good. Just know to get there early because they start to get busy really quick.

IKh5yGBxxwoWzQCpG8AO-w.review_text: Maybe we got lucky, but there was a short line at the door.  It was about a 10 minute wait at most around midnight.  Quickly got served and the drink my friend got was strong and unique.  Put me over the edge and quickly ended my night.  I'd love to come back and give the menu a full look through.  No real place to sit, but stand and enjoy ones company.

gfjgoJ_ERWzp8JbmlYo_bA.review_text: There's something about going to a place you like with people who have never been there before. First of all, if you really like a place, as I do Smuggler's Cove, you get very insecure when your friends start out by ordering, say, a whiskey and soda rather than a mai tai. The night is very nearly ruined. Luckily you're all drinking, so everyone loosens up and by the end of the night everyone's drink is on fire; all is right with the world.

9T3-TEMe6SdhypcG4nl3tA.review_text: Amazing drinks!  However the place is tiny and always packed. Sometimes there is a line outside.

6Qz5IR4YlNkLMcBaBTUixw.review_text: I would have been better off staying at home and watching Pirates of the Caribbean while drinking from a flask.....  So my sister had been dying to go to this place for a while so we got a small group together and went.  We waited in line for about 15 minutes but the nice door man handed us a menu and boasted about their "over 75 drinks"  so the wait was not too bad as it takes about 20 minutes to get through their crazy menu.    Once inside,  the bar itself was cute, very theatrical.  Very much the Disneyland experience.  Place was busy but not packed.   To get to the point, when I ordered our drinks, the bar tender offered to make us "5 Hurricanes."  Not one of the drinks I ordered was a hurricane so I was a little surprised.   I said we wanted the drinks I ordered and she said " Well, it will be a lot faster if I just make you five Hurricanes because the drinks you ordered are really complicated."    Now tell me why you would have a menu with 75 different drinks on it if the bar tender is going to tell you what to order because it would make her life easier??????? Being more of a bourbon girl myself, I went to this place to order a creepy fruity drink for the ambience.  Go to any bar anywhere to get a Makers Mark,  go to a pirate theme bar and I want my umbrella drink with 15 different types of fruit.  I was confused but told her to keep our order and we would be happy to wait.  Well, 30 minutes later, I was not so keen on waiting anymore.  I walked up to the bar and asked if she had even started our drinks.  She said yes but I looked at the bar and saw NOT ONE drink started.  So I asked again and she said "No, but I will get to it right now."    Needless to say, I canceled our order and we left.    So my question for Smuggler's Cove is this:  " Why have such an extensive drink menu if your bar tender is going to complain about the drinks on YOUR MENU and not make them!"

gAt4z9GlFedEPN0iTe6B7w.review_text: Went here for the first time about a week ago - it was happy hour and Steve was tending...the three level layout is a bit bizarre but so worth it if you want to be in a tiki bar with 200-300 rums and concoctions made one at a time..  My gal had the Daisy Santiago - liked the drink but not the crushed ice, which I and our third party agreed takes some getting used to.  I had the Twelve Mile Limit and found it tasty and would have it again but I preferred my second drink which was just a pour of a spicy sugar cane (not molasses) rum. Great!  Third friend had the El Presidente which of the four drinks I tasted was least desirable as I felt it was a bit too orange-y...but hey, that's just me.  Hung out upstairs and since it was the end of the holidays (post NYE) it was pretty mellow which we enjoyed.   You need to check this place out if you like quality mixology and don't mind waiting for your drinks.....we waited nearly 15 minutes and the place was 1/4 full - no one pouring downstairs yet.  Decor is authentic and now I want a blowfish lamp!

H84QHQUiYriOIdTrgzuhlw.review_text: I am actually glad a number of reviewers have proclaimed they will never return.  Great!  More room for me!  In fact, why am I even writing a positive review?  Well, because I've been here twice now and enjoyed it both times.  The first, my SO and I stopped by on a Sunday evening and found a spot downstairs by the waterfall.  Last night, we came with two other friends, and ordered the Volcano bowl, which serves four and is served with an explosion of sparks and fire (in a hand crafted skull bowl).  While the volcano was definitely on the sweeter side, the other cocktails we've had here haven't succumbed to the over-sweet drinks of say, the Tonga room or Tradr Sam's.  These are complex, layered, and both strong and subtle simultaneously.    And yes, they do take a long time to make, and yes, there has only been one bartender per bar when we've been there.  I understand the care it takes to craft some of these cocktails, and this is why we wait: because it is worth it.

HT8kyFqLLDsyHGZ34LMtcw.review_text: EDIT: I was informed that this place does indeed have a happy hour.  My bad.  "Happy hour is 5-6, $2 off everything; $4 off bowl drinks."  I really want to like this place and give it 4 stars, so I'll make a return trip and give it a chance to do just that.

MQTF8C-3xd5tcTAwPPXZyQ.review_text: This place is pretty rad. You can find any type of rum here (I think hundreds...) at all price points, and the bar looks like some type of pirate tavern to boot. These are both very good things in my book. The only real downside is that this bar is TINY and gets VERY busy. You may have to loiter for a while, waiting for a place to sit...so it's better to arrive at off-peak times or travel with packs of stealthy seat-reserving friends.

rFVHR4xyjfFrLTtppewdPA.review_text: So I went to SC with the impression of a small, dark space with hanging glass floats and bamboo constructed tables and chairs. I was not let down.   By 6:30pm in Saturday night the place was packed; it opens at 5. I ordered a drink that I've never had and of course it was made with rum. I haven't enjoyed a rum drink in a while since I had one too many nights of Rum and Cokes made with bad rum.   The place was packed with typical folks I woul have assumed would be at a pirate/tiki/Old Salt hang out. A couple of John Lassetter look alikes, a rock-a-Billy couple downstairs and the rest, local bar hoppers.   The service was a bit lacking. I think people coming in that are new need some help in directing the newcomer through their special drink tasting they claim to be the focus of the bar. As I waited to make my orderI I mentioned to a woman in front of me in line for orders, "I hope these drinks are worth the wait." sarcastically. She responded by saying,"Im used to this kind of wait." guess it was just not funny but I thought the wait just to order was a bit much. The drinks were worth the wait though.  Being as it was busy it took a few minutes to land a space to sit. With three levels, I figured they should be a place to cop a squat.  Athmosphere was perfect and the bartender at least in the main level was very enjoyable an helpful. She knew about the drinks and the rums. Suggest this place at 5 when they open so u beat the rush.   Look for the red light above the door.

rl6uuV2rcMQ_pN3Vf5SUsg.review_text: This is a cool pirate themed bar. You come in on the middle floor where there is a small bar with seating at the bar and then only standing room. Above, there is a loft with more seating. Below, there is a more reasonable bar space with couches, tables, chairs, and a bigger bar.  The whole place has pirate-style decorations. Imagine if the Pirate of the Caribbean ride at Disneyland was a bar, e.g. there's running water.  The drinks are tasty and it's one of the only places in SF where you can get a Zombie (a strong fruity drink). I also had the Puka Punch which was big, tasty, fruity drink. They also have group drinks, i.e. a big cauldron with several long straws, and a huge selection of rum (and rum drinks).

lVrNac8ldvymVo6K8yHeWA.review_text: Although there was a lot of hype about the Smuggler's Cove, the pirate themed decorations didn't make up for the fact that there was barley any room and they had a somewhat rude bartender. I had to wait a long time to order a drink, and when I asked if they made margaritas, the bartender laughed at me...I'm sorry that the tropical theme mislead me to think they would offer my favorite drink. Following my underwhelming encounter with the bartender, I felt packed where-ever I was in the bar. Lot of lap sitting due to a lack of space and I was unable to hear anything. This is the place to go if you want to peek in and see the decorations, and maybe have some rum.

994SE9NAuXI24y8oCPR71g.review_text: Here's the shorthand on Smuggler's because all that have walked the plank before me hit the nail on the head:  - Tiki bar - Unassuming from the street. In fact, looks totally no descript from the street. - Walk in and feel that you've strolled aboard a pirate ship  - Rum based cocktails  - Kitsch in all the right ways - Go forth, enjoy

8nvYsNlE1p1kjAZFb2bZUQ.review_text: This place is decorated really well and has a LOT of rum, but the best part is the bartender. They are super well trained and make great drinks. It's SF-prices as in $10/ pop but it's not bad for a themed place. I kind of miss the happy hours at the bar it took over though. I don't think they serve food.

GCuop_AhH5V4MPNyUKsIig.review_text: Awesome pirate theme and delicious drinks!  The only reason I knocked a star off is because of how crowded it gets.  The guys at the door do a pretty good job of keep it from over-crowding, but seats are in HIGH demand.  Seriously, if you get up for a drink, your seat will be gone when you get back.  Even if your friends try to keep it for you.  It will be gone.  I love going here with one or two people, but for larger groups it's rough because of the seating issue.

vGoAEBoQgGRaF4_UQ3uo5w.review_text: First off, a disclaimer. i love this place like few others.  but just as the love you have for a child allows you to see past his shortcomings, i know i must here as well.  one is understandable... the other can be near unforgiveable.  firstly, the venue is too small for it's popularity.  get there early or you will be waiting out of doors, nipples tearing through your cocktail dress in the bitter cold.  get there early or you will not find a place to sit your cherry ass down and get your 'yarrrrr' on.  the upstairs galley is a sweet spot if you can get it before the hedge fund managers take it over in droves, sitting there nursing a virgin daquiri all night. the second heinous crime.  guys. guys. GUYS! do SOMETHING about the putrid and offensive restroom STENCH, which proliferates the establishment every time the door is opened.  situated next to the bar on the main level, the door opens and it's pandora's box time, wherein all the evils boiling deep within the iseeping, nfected bowels of the earth are expunged upon the weary.  the ungodly stench, enough to knock a poor pirate from his peg and put him under the waves for good.  but the drinks are wonderful.  the jet pilot is my favorite.  i'm working down the list.  the volcano comes to the four of you aflame.  i suggest you bring the makings for smores and take advantage of it's pyre.  however, if you do not find a seat as aforementioned, you are out of luck, as this needs to be set down (unless you want an inferno on your lap). the painkillers are nice.  don't be an idiot and drink beer.  they have the requisite rum drinks, like mai tais, but give the odder ones a go. the decor is beyond fun. all ye who enter here will be charmed by the decor.  just... don't sit anywhere near the restrooms. avast!

wi9SvS7xCmKMyElJVlwJdg.review_text: Pass me a life jacket, I'm here to quash the buzz:  it's Harlot disguised in coconuts and fish nets.

5x1j3Wxzol6XSMFT4l1n2w.review_text: Awesome place to take out of town friends on your "underground SF nights ". Make sure you go on off hours / days  Its a small place and you can really enjoy it casually on off nights... if you see a line, walk away... this place aint no fun to stand in the line for a drink.

2TXi4leSwlMY8rmSKol9Hg.review_text: So I went on a date here... But it was such a bad date...like..."Almost Call Your Ex" bad...
