I have a hard time hiding my facial expressions...so the date felt that I needed to get wasted to enjoy his presence. True...I ordered a cocktail and received a giant punch bowl glass of ... well...punch... with ice and maybe some alcohol? My date urged that I order more but the drinks were very watered down. I'll admit, the decor was pretty cool and it was really tempting to say "ahoy mate!" about every ten minutes...  After my date finished rambling about his ex-girlfriend, I was tempted to order another giant punch bowl, but I wanted to fit into my skinny jeans the next day. This is why I order beer or whiskey.   All in all... It was a conglomeration of "b*tch" drinks... So gentlemen, consider this place for the ladies that "don't like to taste the alcohol" ;)

qy8eLk-DtIU6BJ9_okXKjg.review_text: This place is AMAZING. The atmosphere is very unique.  They have a great variety of drinks, and make the drinks quite strong. i will def be back!

v-5KOiTV__KoBhYRCA2UNw.review_text: Wonderful Tiki/Pirate themed bar. I had 2 drinks there the Expedition and the Mai Tai.Dane is a true mixologist. He brings a level of passion to his mixing no matter how busy the Bar was. Carlos the door man was very friendly and knowledgeable of the SF area. I will definitely return here when I visit SF!

G9B6G4Vc3r6g18Kmyr4Qqg.review_text: Smuggler's Cove has a lot of potential... potentially.  Entering the place looks like you are going into an illegal after hours club. Not sure whats up with that? They definitely need a make over out front. Doorman was cool. Recommended some drinks.  Inside, the decor and layout, which is sort of a Pirates of the Caribbean/Disney/Hawaiian theme...pretty cool. Feels like you are on vacation. 3 levels. Small space. The upstairs, being the best of the three levels. The downstairs bar is hard to navigate to when there is people sitting and hanging out. Also, the bartender seemed like an ass and said there was a line!? When "bar people" are sitting at the bar, in your way, the only way to order is to weave thru or around them. Lines are for McDonalds.   As for the drinks, the two I sampled were both very unique and tasty but it becomes quickly apparent that it takes forever to get a drink because of the process that goes into building them. I think two bartenders at each bar in a must. One bartender isn't enough, period. The other big problem is they have a F-ing booklet for a drink menu. People can;'t handle that kind of selection. Definitely not at a bar. Got to treat them more like third graders and crayons. You get these colors, that's it. A dude I met there named Brian who lives nearby joked "they need cliff's notes."   However, the most blatant problem that stood out above and beyond all others and caused me and my friend to feel uncomfortable was simple: There was NO MUSIC.  Yes, I said it.   No music. Can you believe that? I still can't.  They have this cool theme that they obviously spent a lot of effort with and there is no surround sound. No surfer music, no hula music, no pirate music, no rock n roll, no biggie, no Kanye, no GaGa, nuthin.   (there was music for brief time heard downstairs but it was sporadic at best and the sound trickled out at such a low level that i wasn't sure if it was real or in my head)  Again, lots of potential. Its new. They could get it together and be rockin' hard by February. Hope so! If not, good luck.

oZGSwzlLDwFRVYzyLygv1A.review_text: I really, really like this bar. They have a line because they care about the comfort of the people inside.  Drinks take longer to make because they really care about the quality. (I watched a bartender assess and discard two orchids as garnishes because they weren't up to snuff.) The decor is sweetly nostalgic to me (having grown up in a salty beach area).  I really appreciate a place that takes a stand on ensuring a really good experience for their customers.  Yes, I waited in line, yes I waited for my drink, but the bar was really comfortably spacious and the drink was really good.  Totally worth it, and will totally be back.

ggZlf4xDCTUcUdkmy3VzTw.review_text: Best rum cocktails ever!!! Ever!!! This place got me hooked on rum and no matter where I go, it's never as good as smuggler's! I usually get the smugglers rum barrel.  The bartenders are always super nice and quick. Highly recommend this place!

_E3yaczgef7enusOIf7Jug.review_text: Arrr where's my mateys? They be at the Smuggler's Cove A good place for rum.  Three floors for drinking. An intimate location. Pirate themed decor.  Numerous rum drinks. Made very strong and tasty. But also pricey.  They also have beer. It is not on the menu. But just ask for it.

W-nxmCVHXwrCDzXzM1pv5Q.review_text: This is my favorite little hideaway bar. Its great place to take out of towners and or a cool date place.  Its also fun to go with a small group and share the four person cocktail.

1_WCnEFLFI6igUYtwbCbTw.review_text: Over 450+ different types of rum are served within these doors. Only a dozen or individuals have been able to sample half of their stock! The staff is amazingly well versed in the history and knowledge of all of their rums that I've come to try. Their menu of rum ranges from samples, to shots, and the infamous scorpion bowls. If you're new to the rum scene, don't be shy and ask one of the bar tenders- they're friendly and willing to bring you in as a part of their cult following.   They're open from 5pm to 1:15am daily and serve happy hour from 5-6pm, where all of their drinks have special  HH pricing. *Essential tip* Get there early and be on the look out for open seats/tables- the secret to this hidden cove is out and aside from the wall to wall stacks of rum, open seating is considered a treasure there as well.   *For the daring* If you sample 100 of their rums you get your name forever remembered on a plaque on the wall of the Cove AND you receive exclusive access to 100 of their reserved rum stash not on sale to the public! If you sample 200, you are graced by the Rum Deities and earn an all expense paid trip to visit a random distillery and then given a tour by the owner!   If you weren't a rum lover before, stop by Smuggler's Cove for a tasting or a bowl and you'll find yourself embarking on a journey your inner-pirate will definitely thank you for!

v58aGL3xcKISGlGiUDxxtg.review_text: Great Drinks.. friendly staff! Chilled out place.. can get a little crowded.

inO98h1UQ-tP1Q4K7V_Uqw.review_text: I love a tiki bar! This place is pretty pricey and while its not my favorite Mai Tai in the bay, they do serve quality drinks in a great atmosphere. Highly recommend everyone goes here at least once in their life!

XPOx-mCubVGQ1rRknztFtw.review_text: You will not find a better selection of rum anywhere. Anywhere. They have Pyrat Cask 23.  Really that is all that needs to be said to explain why Smuggler's Cove deserves six stars.   If you don't know rum, you owe yourself an education and Smuggler's Cove is the best place to get it.  If you do know how wonderful rum can be, you will fall in love with Smuggler's Cove. I appreciate that they limit the number of people allowed inside (Jade was awful when crowded) and I don't mind waiting for a drink because I know how long it takes for them to craft those complex tiki concoctions.   The decor is definitely tiki but it is not tacky.  I particularly like the beams across the top of the main room making it feel boat-like. Every Tuesday you will find me at Smuggler's Cove working my way up in the Rumbustion Society smugglerscovesf.com/trap…

pHwlLUKTfB2kzBPRV0N4Ng.review_text: Solid pirate themed bar. Not a very big place and the drinks are overpriced. On the whole, decent bar.

v5W7722HRgtTXxU2O7GIiw.review_text: Its away from your usual bar-scenes in SF which makes it another reason why'd I'd go back. Its a very secluded place, you couldn't tell its a bar from the outside. It's 3 floors, but very small. I wouldn't recommend it for a large crowd. The drinks are somethin' different.

ZSii2BFVJJ_5YE9D01DXFQ.review_text: Hidden bar walking distance from my house, awesome!   Drinks: Hot buttered rum, batida's etc. were all fantastic. The flaming drinks are also cool.   Atmosphere: It's great. Except it gets a little heated. No wonder the negative service reviews I wouldn't want to be working here when its crowded.   Service: The bartenders and security have been over the top nice to me every time I have been here. One time i was trying to leave and cash out and the bartender could tell I was getting a little bit irritated by the stuffiness so she cashed me out out of order!   Another time, a bartender, gruff guy, closed my tab when I meant to order another drink at closing time. I was expecting to hear it b/c it was a frozen drink, well not at all. He was super nice about it.   I also have had really positive experiences with security. They even let my obviously old enough balding 32 year old friend in without an ID, saving us a trip home.   That said I have read the reviews and I think management should respond with what has been done about these allegations of racism, homophobia, lying, jerkery etc, theres so many of them it makes me wonder if my experience is unique, or if its an old problem since solved or : \.   Finally, I might add the patrons of this bar are a combination of law students, techies, concert goers and other young people. Some guy had a shirt on that said "protect the shire" for example.... therefore read the reviews with a grain of salt given who they are coming from.  Nonetheless, five stars; I can only speak to my experience on the service.

xp9UEkFyz7h7Ii1XVzU4tA.review_text: If tiki and island inspiration is what ye seek, then look no further. As a fan of Lani Kai in NYC, Smuggler's Cove really hit the spot and satisfied my craving for rum-based cocktails...and if you're on an educational kick there are rum flights available so you can develop your taste while discussing with the extremely knowledgeable bartenders.

Oje0eeorhyDyhFRNTl4dOA.review_text: This is a cool but very small place and drinks are good, but pricey. This is a good venue for SF, but is a normal bar in any NY neighborhood.

wZG2xlICfUkJiY1NdPJH2A.review_text: Heard a lot of hype about this place and wanted to check it out on a not-so-crazy night (it's a fairly tight spot, with a capacity of less then 50.) It's fairly calm on an early Sunday evening. Although, you can't even tell the place is open from the outside- it's conspicuous. I prefer to avoid the annoying Friday stupor and actually read the inciting menu and enjoy tasting the quality rum they serve. Redbull and vodka they have not, and cosmos are also a no-can-do, they do it to weed out those annoying drinkers. It's a pirates cove- complete with sunken treasure in the fountain downstairs, and three small floors (down and up from the main) that each feature their own bar to get your drinks on many levels. They do have scorpion bowls and the like, easy-to-get-drunk-on drinks, but at $12 a pop, wouldn't you rather enjoy a fine crafted cocktail? They even have beer and wine for those non-rum drinkers. They squeeze their own citrus, grate their own cinnamon, and shake with vigor for a perfect froth.  Melissa was a friendly cocktail crafter, easy to talk to and easy to get a drink ordered.

1tnvWgCNtvTnNTq0zyshAQ.review_text: Smuggler's has taught me what a good rum cocktail really is. The long and comprehensive cocktail list is impressive and I've discovered some amazing drinks. The decor is well done and the service staff is efficient and friendly. A new regular for me.

XfqthayIC4vALuF0AdKPsA.review_text: I've only been here once.   Parking was easy to find. (Saturday night, mind you.)  It was busy, but the bartender & bar back were attentive (which is always a super plus at any bar).   The drinks aren't over priced.   Rum is delicious (generally speaking).  The drinks are good! (as in, strong!)  It's hidden! (that's cool, right? I dig it.)  It's kind of cheesy, the pirate thing. But you should have gotten the cue with from the name of the place. I liked the corny-ness.  One thing I did notice despite my premature experience here is that space is limited. It's meant for you and a plus one, maybe two.  I don't know what else to say. I was also with good company and that always makes or breaks a place.   Who knows, maybe my review will change after a few times, but it definitely did well for me this time.   Oh, plus the bouncer was nice.

tpz0iEFgkdIm4c1fxBhkGw.review_text: What do I say here about Smugglers Cove. A secret site of secrets showed me that there was a secret bar located just ironically near where I work. So secret it was that I never knew a place like this existed outside the Tonga Room - which by the way, is a slightly different feel as its Polynesian and this is more but not fully Caribbean.  I was thrilled when almost everyone I talked to knew of this place, told me to expect to get drunk on one drink, and that due to my childhood of growing up with a mother who was born in early 1960s Hawaii who was into the Exotica Kitsch, I knew this was going to be the place for me. So I found the red light, walked in, and immediately felt like I walked into a tall, dimly lit, secret rum runner cave. There was a waterfall, globe lights, wicker furniture and best of all, Exotica cocktail music playing, to which I commented to my friend attending with me, "Walter Wanderley is playing" - she had no idea who it was. Which reminds me, if you are a Lex Baxter, Martin Denny, Walter Wanderley, Arthur Lyman, Kava Kon, or Tikiyaki Orchestra (who sometimes plays here) fans, then this is the place for you. It is more Caribbean than Polynesian however make no mistake the Tiki Gods from the North and South Pacific are present in abundance if you look closely. This bar is not short on Volcano's or Skulls either!  If you want to soak in the atmosphere and watch people walk in and be amazed, listen to some great music (a little loudly), I suggest heading upstairs and sitting near the railing that overlooks the bar. There, you will be up high, next to all the rum barrels and globe lights and get a feel for what it is like to be perched high up in a cave. For a moment, I almost felt I was in Thunderball or some other James Bond 60's movie. This wont make sense to you until you actually walk in, sit down, and start drinking. You will know exactly what I mean.   If you want something a little more romantic, or dark and deep, and secret and feeling a little mischievous, head downstairs, the darker lower level is the bowels of the cave, where the waterfall plunges and where there is room to stand and dance a little on an empty night. The bar there is larger, but not always serviced during the week. Sometimes people wonder down, sometimes its more secluded, but regardless its definitely worth a walk down the grated catwalk stairs over the waterfall. Looking to be a little more social, wanna get that Volcano or Scorpion drink ($36-ish) but dont have friends to share it? Sit on the main level (the middle floor) and ask some of the friendly, social regulars to share it with you. Paying $36 for the experience of watching the Bartender or Bartendress light a rather large bowl of alcohol you will soon enjoy on fire is pretty much worth it alone, however, whats in the bowl is not only going to get you so into the mood of Exotica, but you literally will forget that you are in San Francisco and not French Polynesia, Hawaii, or Port Royal or Tortuga Island if you know what I mean, by the time youre finished drinking it. Drinks are rather pricey, I will admit that, NOTHING seems to be under $10, and the average is $11-16 PER DRINK. Which kinda is a little too high in my opinion, until  you realize that the ingredients are not only fresh juices and fruits, but with over (and I lost count) 50 types of rum from different nations, 300 years of rum history, drinks that go back from the 1700's all the way to today, and bartenders/bartendresses that really take their time and pride in making a drink worthy of being ingested, yeah, Id say that seems a very fair price. Not to mention, the atmosphere alone is amazing so consider it almost like an admission fee the first drink, and each other drink after, you likely will forget they are as high priced as they are. Are they worth it in a word, absolutely. Smugglers Cove really is a hidden gem - matter of fact, I think the walls might have some hidden gems and treasure in them, I swear I saw some - and if you ever wanted bragging rights to be a pirate, be at one of the top 50 bars in the world, or just wanted a little of that Pirates Of The Caribbean Disneyland atmosphere without actually going to Disneyland, you came to the right place.

0mP76PwDxamNMpO1qnHuhg.review_text: Came here for my birthday celebrations and there was already a line outside the door with a bouncer. It wasn't long but damn, a line for a bar? This place must be crackin!! We finally got in and two things...pirate theme was cool and this place is SMALL. It has 3 floors/levels but each room is cramped and no bigger than a large bedroom (that is including the bars).  The party must go on so we ordered a Scorpion Bowl and a Volcano Bowl for our party of 5. Order the Volcano Bowl over the Scorpion if you're on a budget. There is a lot more fire involved. Ha! Drinks were strong but sweet but solid.  Again, the size of the place comes back to haunt us. As we were finishing up our drinks, some girl comes up to us and says to us, "I noticed you guys weren't drinking anymore and I was wondering if I could have your table so we can order our drinks." She wasn't rude about it, but it was annoying that it had to happen. You have to have a table to order a bowl, FYI. We felt a bit rushed, so we had to make an early departure and move onto our next destination. I guess you could say we had to "abandon ship"...haha! No? Okay, sorry...

_c8CB-JPZTyoFPE_WIYkmQ.review_text: Great place for some very tasty drinks.  They were amazing, and the selection was off the charts.  I couldn't decide.  So I asked the bartenders recommendations.  They took in consideration what I liked and made drinks perfect for it.    I knocked one star off cause of the wait.  Had to wait to get in, which is understandable.  But more of waiting to get drinks... just took a while.  One more bartender down stairs would have increased that time and probably encourage me to get more.  I didn't feel like waiting around for a 3rd drink.    Overall great experience, and I will be back.

5isObQlrdJsGTcgrcoQSxg.review_text: You're growing on me, smugglers cove. You're still crowded, and and a toss up when it comes to service, but the deliciousness of your cocktails cannot be denied. Who doesn't love giant tropical rum drinks, though?

YbZg36FoMgkKcTEPae5siA.review_text: This place is a total gem. It's a non-descript building so if you don't know what you're looking for, you'll miss it for sure. After reading the rave reviews about Hot Buttered Rum I thought I'd give it a shot. Boy, was I in for some yummy goodness. The drink is super smooth and tastes like candy. I can definitely see myself getting really drunk off a few of these if I don't watch myself. This is coming from someone who can barely handle two drinks. I am quite impressed. That says a lot.  The menu had so many choices, it was a bit overwhelming. I don't recall what my friend ordered but he seemed to like it quite a bit as well.  I love that it's half speakeasy, half tiki bar, all class. I will definitely stop here again, especially since it's a bit tucked away but not super far from transit if you really think about it.  Looking for a date place? Need to catch up with an old pal? I wouldn't recommend bringing a ton of friends here but if it's a small group, it's definitely a good place to check out. You can thank me later.

XFQoKwXcAf0Cr0KG_w2j-g.review_text: I had a great time at this place, and would most likely go back.  PROS: - Delicious, unique cocktails that make you feel like you are on a tropical island -3 stories, amazing ambiance, makes you feel like you are on the Pirate's of the Caribbean Ride at Disneyland! - Reasonable prices -Really friendly bar tenders and bouncers   CONS: -It's a VERY small place.  -Not ideal for large groups -Difficult to find seating -Be prepared to stand in line outside

_XFhTYX3wS0ftGc9u4pLqw.review_text: Love love love the kitchy / dirty pirate look of this place, but the prices are way too high for those punch bowl thingies, even if they are packed with alcohol (and taste).

lqM8exENHuy0jjDFQM1EbA.review_text: WOW. How did I not discover this little "treasure" earlier?? I am usually not a huge fan of rum, but damn - every cocktail I've tried at Smugglers was DELICIOUS! 10/10 would come back again and again!  Undoubtedly, each drink is around $14.00+ so it's not a place to get drunk on cheap drinks. But, if you'd like to sip on something tasty and tropical, this is the place to go!  The only complaint I have is that the venue is extremely tiny and can be a bit cramped. Bartenders were straight to the point and didn't seem overly friendly, but meh - they make good drinks, so can't complain.

fsVXiBCjuGc5sST6QC1zLA.review_text: Super cute and fun, I always expect a mermaid to pop out of the water. Awesome volcano drinks and beautiful flowers in the drinks. It can get super busy with a line out the door which makes me feel fancy but I wouldn't wait (hence 4 stars). AaRRRggGG!!

x9Jj7iepr2n59Rs2zCxnXg.review_text: This is definitely the place to learn about rum and if you aren't interested in learning you can just enjoy the the cocktails.   I recommend the sidewinders fang or the painkiller (always get #4).  The juices are all very fresh and you can really tell that the bartenders take pride in their work and put care into the drinks.   Just try and get there early or come late to avoid the crowd.

6eJzYPuGVy3l9KmVne_3uQ.review_text: Smuggler's Cove is rum heaven. It's rum Nirvana.  It's rum Mecca.  It's the alcoholic promised land of rum.  Rum for the most part doesn't get the respect it deserves.  At least not when compared to libations like fine wine and scotch.  Smuggler's Cove is here to change all that.  This is probably the only place on Earth where you can get an expertly mixed (Tiki) Navy Grog and a (Cuban) Daiquri and a former long lost rum cocktail that dates back centuries without having to leave your bar stool.    Rum is historic. Rum has shaped cultures. Rum is complex and sophisticated.  Smuggler's Cove is the place to experience that.     These drinks are works of art.  Your bartender is a master ninja of mixology.  Be patient, this takes a little longer than your usual Red Bull and Vodka.       Oh and that decor, yes I know it vibes "Pirates of the Caribbean" but it's really about 18th Century West Indies rum smuggling. Don't get me started.  :-)

8MeD1D70MC-0dIK2Lr11WQ.review_text: I am not really into pirates or thematic places generally, but Smuggler's Cove is really well done. The downstairs cove area is the perfect hide-out for a cold winter night. The punch bowl that my group shared was a little bit too sweet for my taste, but still fun to sip on with the giant straws.

VZmSmKWbJnaFDQm8MZHTiQ.review_text: As others have said, the bouncer ruins the experience.  The drinks are decent, the decorations are great, the noise should be controlled better, but the rude bouncer who calls his "friends" to mess with people is rude, inappropriate, and not a professional.  Being on a power trip gets you nowhere in the service industry and ruins the reputation of a bar.  Maybe the owner should takes a few feedback and get a bouncer who treats customers with respect.

0QdwQLVxZpgy9Qb2Qakflw.review_text: Ahoy Mateys!   STRONG rum drinks, a really dark bar, drinks with fire, all in a decked out pirate's cove makes me dream of a pirate's life for me.  Smuggler's Cove is not just about the pirate themed bar, I found their rum drinks really well crafted and unique.  They have a huge menu of options and a lot of rums to try straight if you are into that. Beware of the strong drinks and the punch of sugar because it will really knock you on your ass!   I wish I lived closer so I could continue my adventure through the long list of drinks that sounded so good.

_N7Ndn29bpll_961oPeEfw.review_text: I've been here at least 5 times now and I think it's time to write a review.  I love this place. I wasn't much of a fan of rum until I began coming here, sampling several of their rums as part of their Rumbustion Society. Ask for a membership card when you go.  Apart from that, the cocktails are great, made from many ingredients, and they're much stronger than they taste. The bartenders are pretty cool and are pretty diligent when it comes to making your drink. It's like an art.  The atmosphere is great. The interior is beautifully decorated and the people who go here are pretty cool. We meet new people every time we go, there's a crowd there every night of the weeks, but expect a line on Friday and Saturday after 8pm.  If it's your first time, I recommend giving the Hot Buttered Rum and Dead Reckoning a try. At times, however, it can take a while until you get your drink as there's only a few bartenders.

u2iRnoNLkB2mSWl1yRtmdw.review_text: Went to Smugglers Cove this past Saturday and had a pretty good experience overall. There was a line outside, but it ended up only being about a 10-minute wait for us to get inside. Btw, don't try to cut in line- the bouncer will call you out. Lol  So we got inside inside and were awed by the decor. Ever seen The Goonies? That's what Smugglers Cove reminds me of. Although it technically is 3-stories, it is very small, and with a lot of people there it gets cramped easily. You're lucky if you find a place to sit.   As far as drinks go, I was quite impressed! I tried the Hot Butter Rum, at the recommendation of an intoxicated person in line, and it was so good! I also got the coveted Rum Barrel, which was as delightful to drink as it was to look at. My friends were happy with their drinks as well, which included the Zombie, Sidewinder, Dark & Stormy, and Scorpion Bowl.   The only problem we had was with the long-haired bartender downstairs. I don't care how bad of a day you are having, you don't take it out on your customers. He made the wrong drink, and instead of setting it aside and making the correct drink, he took it and slammed it into the trash. Then he left the bar area, came back with a bucket of ice, and made his way through the crowd like a running back, with no regard for the people who were standing. At least the other bartenders made up for it.   My friends and I plan on going back, we just hope Long Hair isn't there cuz he might Spartan Kick us next time!

q2cGMOPz43FpEvFzhW2D9w.review_text: Went a few weeks ago to celebrate some electric news. We got two of those huge bowls with the fire and the straws and the whatnot. They were fun, but expensive as shit. The atmosphere is kinda the same way. Won't go back until I win the lottery or rob a stagecoach.

tXWnIAOHDlK7sQfew0YgLQ.review_text: Love this place. The bartenders are amazing they are all super nice and make amazing drinks. The only thing I didn't like was the horrible ventilation system. It was so hot down there sweat was dripping off my face literally at one point I thought I was gonna pass out. They really should work on that and it will get a full 5 star. Even the heat was unbearable Im not gonna lie its not gonna stop me from going there lol

ZLL-S3TihuU4WiA6tcsdJQ.review_text: I went to this place for the first time over the summer. My friend was having a pirate themed birthday pub crawl and this was the first stop.  At first I definitely have to say I was a little skeptical but I was pleasantly surprised at how great our experience was!  These were by far the best cocktails I've had in a long time.  There are so many drinks to choose from, and the bartenders were very friendly while helping me narrow down my choices!  The drinks are very exotic and the presentation of them is very nice too.  One of the drinks I shared with a couple of my friends was the Scorpion Bowl.  It was so cool how they lit it on fire and everything.  I also really liked the unique look of the place, it was a nice change from the places I normally go to.  The only reason I take away a star is because it's a pretty small place so it gets crowded pretty easily.  My group got there fairly early and we still had to wait outside a little bit to get in.  The drinks are also pricey...I definitely want to take some more of my friends to this place though, this place has delicious drinks and a cozy atmosphere!!

ekaQsTZ_PlxR88xtHgZtcA.review_text: Coming across yet another published set of accolades for this bar (this time in Sunset magazine for their Mai Tai perfection), reminded me that it's high time I updated this review.  Yelpers, I'd like to pose a series of important questions to you:  Where else can you get the absolute finest ingredients (flown in from around the world, fresh squeezed on site, or painstakingly tinctured at home & lovingly carted in for the creation of these insanely delicious libations)?  Who else but these highly trained bartenders can mix together these fine ingredients via droplets and shakers and a dash of voodoo, to create for you these drinkable visual and gustatory works of art?  Why else but to relax and mingle with a quite varied crowd, melting into the sexy darkness such as Smuggler's Cove would you even go to a bar in the first place?  And finally, (perhaps most importantly),  When do you plan on returning here, and can I join you?  (And by all means if you haven't checked this place out yet, What the bleep are you waiting for?!?)  I drink by the seasons here: coconutty, fruity libations such as the Tradewinds in the summer, nutmeg spicy originals like the Pupule in the fall, traditional but out-of-this-world perfection of Hot buttered rum in the winter, and spunky & potent drinks like the Jet pilot or Painkiller in the spring.    You see, it is a bar for all seasons, the answer to all your questions.  It is, in short, my favorite bar of all time.

StZXvBBoa_GPKxEzotyvNg.review_text: Saturday night in SF. Crisp air, bright lights, a homeless man's urine trickling downhill toward my boot. You gotta love the Bay Area. I was out with a group of four and we were thirsty and hungry for trouble. I don't know the area well so no matter what place they suggested on our pub crawl I immediately responded, "I'm in!" One of my mates suggested Smugglers Cove (though he had never been). He had it bookmarked on yelp (shameless plug)! We circled for half an hour in search of expensive meter parking. Our fruitless, frustrating search ended in a dimly lit 10 dollar parking lot. "You go to the corner," the man yelled at us, violently gesuring northward. It was 8:30. We looked at the car one last time, hoping all of it's windows would be in tact when we returned. It was a short walk to smugglers cove. We laughed and talked along the way, untill we saw ... The line. "Are they giving away drinks inside," the only girl in our group asked sarcastically. The line moved slowly. Ahead of us were quiet, somber 30-somethings as far as the eye could see. We couldn't see the bouncer but every few minutes he could be heard commanding "No cuts." When we reached the front of the line we were informed that the line would be moving more quickly soon because a party of 20 was about to leave. Unfortunately they were still inside when we finally made our way through the door. The bar consisted of three floors, each rather small. A staircase adorned with pirate paraphernalia led up and down from the ground level. Eenie, meenie, miney, moe. We took our chances with the bottom level. Much like the other two, it was wall to wall people. We forced our way through the crowd to the bar. Another line. Ahead of us, dozens of people vied for the attention of the two bartenders. We browsed the menu while waiting our turn. We used the pictures on yelp (wink wink) to help us make our selections. Hot buttered rum all around! Tonight we are pirates! Arrrrrrrgh!! While awaiting our drinks, we anxiously scanned the crowded room in search of a seat. Wonder of wonders, a spot with room for the four of us opened up just as our drinks were handed our way. We hurried across the room, ready to clothesline anyone who got in our way. We plopped down onto the cushioned edge of the lagoon, overjoyed at our good fortune. We all took sips from the warm mugs clutched in our greedy hands. Excellent! Warm, sweet, rich and buttery. A perfect drink for a cold night on the high seas. We chatted amongst ourselves until our cups were empty. A man quickly came and picked them up. Not wanting to brave the line at the bar again we decided to move on to the next stop of the night. Overall an intersting and tasty experience, but avast ye land lovers! This bar be crowded!

ytRjxjLsJKjqBOvEhC-9Lg.review_text: Their specialty is rum, and rum-a-tum-tum it is good. They have a drink called the Flaming Volcano (or something to that effect). It comes in a bowl with fire rocks and serves up to four people. It's quite a show when they bring it out.  Very inconspicuous on the outside. Looks like a shady panel of black glass, but on the inside, you'll feel like Johnny Depp might come out of the wood work as Capt. Jack Sparrow. Three "decks" with two bars. One on the main level and one on the bottom.   Only complaint is the lack of enough chairs and tables, and only 1 restroom per gender.

T_x_m-kFfW9jjAsE7-EwBA.review_text: Loved the creativity in the decor! The reason I gave this place 3 stars was for three reasons: too small and crammed, it wrecked of some bad BO, and the bartender or guy helping the bartender seemed a bit racial, didn't care to explain the drinks as it was my first time (I haven't felt this way in San Fran, ever). I didn't love my drink. I ordered a pain killer 2oz and came to a realization that I don't love rum!  But hey rum lovers, do check this place out, it's a must for the rum lovers!

kK0QDyfeSwcZl4gGilnW7w.review_text: I have never ever rated an alchy place so highly but first time for everything! I was around the Civic Center area and we decided to get a drink before an activity. At first I wasnt going to get anything but I defs felt left out when all my friends did. I had a few sips of theirs and I was convinced that these drinks were really good! I am not a fan of mixed drinks that you have to sip on for days since I do not like the taste of alcohol. However, these sweet drinks barely tasted like alcohol and I was sold that this is now my place. It is not like a midori sour where it is sweet but nothing really happens. I definitely felt the effects of the alchy but didnt have to scrunch up my nose every time I took a sip. I forget which drinks I tasted but I am sure that whatever you get, it will taste good. Drinks are over $12ish nish and I got this really sweet one with condensed milk haha. There is limited seating at the bar but I believe there is more seating upstairs. Honestly, you cant go wrong with this place if you just want to hang and be chill. The pirates theme is pretty nifty too. I will be back!

g8TkB9kLwc5JUdLcAU1Tfw.review_text: Just on sheer unique and enchanting factor Smuggler's Cover deserves 5 stars. As far as Bars go in the city there is nothing that comes close in comparison. It's in a league of it's own. We are talking about a pirate themed bar where swash buckling is supposed to take place.   Upon entry it definitely feels like you have been transported. My only disappointment is, altho completely unrealistic and I fully admit that, is the bartenders were not dressed up as pirates and speaking in old english. Now that would definitely have rounded out the whole pirate experience.  The drinks are expensive, but pirates are expected to do a bit of swindling on price. I wish I could remember the name of the drink, but the group I came with ordered something that came in a tiny barrel shape and was set to flames. Quite the spectacle. We all just stuck our straws into it after the flames died down and got drunk merrily.   Lastly when the place gets packed space is definitely a premium. It's small and cramped or you could look at it as cozy and intimate. To each their own.

f-wjQLYvzGpHCMJq8Hjc0w.review_text: Overwhelmed by their fancy pants rum menu, I ordered a go to classic. So much to read, so much I didn't know. Rum, fancy cold and lime. I've made this a thousand times and yet when y touched my lips I couldn't believe the sweet complex flavor I tasted. And it just got better from there.   Ok, but even if you don't care what type of pirate booty pours down your trap, you'll have an excellent time taking in the decorations. I felt like I was in some secret Pirates of the Caribbean bar in Disneyland. There's even a water feature (pond lagoon thing) in the lower level. So much to taste, so much to look at, you'll be in sensory overload. Not a whole lotta places to sit. This is not the place to visit on a group. Stick to one friend or date. It's kinda dark so I imagine this could be a cool date place too.   Prepare to spend some mullah though. The drinks are pricey. And if you're feeling adventurous, order a "side of danger," a cup of some crazy strong rum.

q90nV9qHGlr0zwhoDtoYjA.review_text: The yelp review only allows me to identify 4-stars as "Yay! I'm a fan."  I feel "Yargh! I be a fan" would be more appropriate.  This will probably be a work in progress over time- my wife and I just moved to Franklin and Eddy (no into an actual home, not onto the street with a shopping cart I PROMISE) so this will likely be a frequent spot for us.  We stopped in for a night cap after a nice dinner in the Financial District.  We start out with a line outside.  Okay I get this... the place was wall to wall people.  I get it even more because the weather had just turned warm and it was a hotbox inside.  So I appreciate the effort.  Of note I think there is an 83% chance the door guy was Mac from Always Sunny.  I was looking for pyrotechnics on his coat when he gave me the ocular pat-down and after a few ninja moves we were in the door.  Let me preface by saying I HATE KITSCHY.  I love Irish bars and bemoan the send-away, build your own Irish Bar/TGI Fridays thing.  This is not that.  Yes there are things on the wall that shouldn't be there, there is a fountain with a colored light.  But for me, it works.  Its fun.  It's not Margaritaville and the bartenders don't wear eye-patches and call you matey.  It's a theme but that's it.    What really sells it for me is that they easily have the best menu I've ever seen at a bar.  I love the new craft cocktail thing but hate that I now have to ask the bartender what "rose petal infused water" tastes like or what the difference is between "citrus bitters and sour bitters".  The menu here explains it all... like really well.  In fact so well I would like to see restaurants that have a period theme do the same.  I wanted to have a drink that had a historical thing to it-- BAM there's a section for that.  My wife wanted something sweet and fun-- BAM there's a section for that.  Some people might be annoyed with the breadth of their menu, but come on... at $10+ for a drink this makes me feel a little better about it.    Also the drinks are STRONG!!!  I could do without the whole "lighting things on fire" jam but it is what it is.  We tried to circumvent that and get the drink in two glasses but alsa-- unless ye be a sittin, ye cannah hav tha drink.    Okay it was really really hot.  Too hot.  We left after one drink and I may have trouble getting my wife back on a Friday or Saturday night.  I talked myself into thinking it was on purpose bc that's what a ship would be like.  Yo ho!  I will have to update when I am able to stop in a for a drink when it's less busy.    Bottom line:  if you are into the whole craft cocktail thing, places like Alembic and 15 Romolo are awesome.  However I know a lot of people who don't like those places because they feel guilty about asking for a cosmo or a jack and coke.  Smugglers is the place you can go get snooty-toots about your drink while your friends and guzzle sweet liquor that's on fire!!!  Everyone's happy!  I see this as being the perfect place to come to just sip good rum straight but also to bring a bach/bach-ette party.  Pretty rare combo.  It's like Frank Reynolds and Fatty McGoo all in one!

qGrBTnfwsHHFale_EVCuiA.review_text: I came here a little over a month ago and although there were unexpected surprises throughout our night, I ultimately enjoyed myself. I suggest coming here early. I think we arrived around 9:30 pm and it was already packed! It took us 1.5 hours to find a table downstairs because there isn't an efficient method to seating and people can sit for an unlimited amount of time. Even worse, the lineup to get drinks is so chaotic! There was only one bartender and the other man was in charge of just billing. Overall downstairs is a mess and on top of that it is stuffy, dark, and moist!   I enjoy the extensive menu of themed pirate drinks. All the drinks have fun names and descriptions and many are served in fun cups which I loved. I ended up getting the Hawaiian Sunset. It was pretty pricey for the amount you get, but it was sweet and delicious! I was in a group of four and we also shared the scorpion bowl. Surprisingly the four of us didn't feel anything after drinking it, but I would suggest giving it a shot just for the experience. Heads up though, to order a scorpion bowl you need a table first!  The surprise of my night here is actually pretty nasty! Apparently someone flooded the men's bathroom and it ended up leaking to the lower floor. It was SMELLY and the leak ended up taking over the whole ceiling causing everyone to leave! No one needs poopy bathroom water hitting their heads or getting in their drinks!!!! Nasty! Even worse is that I do not think the security guard warned the customers waiting in line. There was a line around the corner when we left. If I were them I would not want to step foot into a flooding bar.  The funny thing is that apparently Kanye West had also been at Smuggler's Cove earlier on in the night...I wonder how big a disaster that would have been if he had been there during the event.

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: Fun little tiki bar in Hayes Valley.  MUCH more authentic and fun than the srsly gross Tonga Room in Fairmont.  Pricey? Sure- but honestly, much better ambience than the aforementioned wannabe tiki lounge (which is twice as expensive and has way too sweet drinks)

xi94GOYwC9SXlxy3G1ZoZg.review_text: I imagine this is what it's like to be drunk on a Disneyland ride that lasts for a couple hours.. And it's freakin awesome.  Yelp don't lie, drinks are strong and amazing and come in fun cups and glasses. It's pretty fun way to break the norm.  Next time I'm for sure bringing more friends and getting into the punch bowls! I got to see one of the bartenders deliver one to a table of people and they have a whole fire show to go along with it!

REGjppkq2IkDLRQVmRj_Bg.review_text: A real, live, pirate ship within San Francisco.  No joke.  The outside of this space seems as if it's the backside of some Hayes Valley condo with a Red light and no signage reminding you of a garbage man's stop on route to Market street. BUT once you've stepped inside you quickly forget about the world outside of this new magical land of Jack Sparrow's imagination.  The bartenders were amazing.  Simply amazing.  I asked for the "Zombie" since it was the one Barrel marked drink that a few of my friends found common ground on in recommending.  The bartender must have poured about 15 ingredients in his mixer and went to town. It was pretty neat to see how fast he worked and even though it took a few minutes to concoct I was thoroughly entertained by the scenery.  Not to mention the guest who came in dressed as Jack Sparrow himself.   I've also heard that you can start a card and if you fill out the entire card by buying/trying one of every drink on the menu you'll get your own gold plaque on the wall.  I only saw about 10 so far and I've only had one drink out of the hundred or so available.  It will be a goal.  Such a fun place to visit I will definitely be back.

oN9bug-cjYV5XfAXkUkDZQ.review_text: I normally only go to bars begrudgingly with friends, but this is one that I would happily patronize anytime.  A top notch rum selection handled by great bartenders who make the best rum drinks I've ever had.  They have all manner of cocktail options, many of which are sweet, but always in a perfectly subtle way.

IqIpCfg0qDhIkaUJGKzlyw.review_text: This place gets busy!! On a friday night early at 10pm we had to wait in line to get in. They have this amazing menu of all kinds of drinks from the Caribbean. I got a coconut jamician milk drink which was not as good as it sounded. My friends got cool looking drinks with mint leaves and tropical colors. I loved the wall that was a fountain and all the sea pirate decor. we felt like we were in disneyland in the pirates of the Caribbean. Not really a place where you can sit and talk but a cute unique sf bar!

Qzlk-UNsxqBaIn7SEItJ6g.review_text: "You need a table to order that drink. It's one of those square things," dismissively leered the rotund barwench. Surprised at this rudeness, I politely asked what she would suggest. "Whatever you like. I'm too busy to answer that." There were no square things to sit around in the crowded dungeon-like excuse for a bar. If you enjoy being insulted by bar tenders with a bad case of biscuit poisoning, this is the place for you. Otherwise I recommend just about anywhere else in San Fran.

B0hB0k3YcFIkesUdrNfeZQ.review_text: The people at the bar were weird. The people working at the bar were weird. The menu was weird. I realize they are a rum bar, but come on. How many people exclusively drink rum?? Get a grip. And they act so offended if you try and order a different liquor. The drinks are expensive. The bartenders are grumpy and pissed off that they work at such a weird place and people are throwing them so much attitude about only having rum. The lights were too light. They are super strict about being quiet outside, even when you are having a normal decibel conversation. It was not fun... more of a buzzkill than anything else.

rm-oUeqX0T3-SvaoGw2UJA.review_text: I came here on Halloween (dressed as a snowman) and was amused by the number of pirates I saw at this place. This place is two floors of pirate ship theme and more rum than you knew probably even existed! Drinks are pretty pricey, but they're pretty and themed and that's the kind of stuff I liked. We got one of the volcano drinks ($40!) to share. They give you a mini show by lighting the middle of your volcano on fire and then continue to give you ginormous straws so you and your friends don't have to break your backs trying to multitask holding a volcano and trying to drink at the same time. I like the novelty of it, but $40 was kind of pricey for essentially a bowl of ice with watered down juice (thought it did taste good - didn't taste like there was any rum in it though). I got another drink as well and on the flip side, it was super strong.   Overall though, I loved the theme, drinks were good for the most part, and I had a good night.

pIo73J0a7bxCK7q9BHdkzg.review_text: Started the party here last night. You can tell the owner put a lot of money into this place. The flower and garnish in the " rum barrel" ( $12) made me feel very tough. The menu had a ton of choices and the bartender on the lower level was very happy to explain the various options you can partake in drink wise.   They have 3-4 beers on tap. I tried a Thirsty Bear Brown Ale on the main level ( there's 3 stories at his place) . Good stuff.   Not very crowded. I'd check it out again....

3h15ylfAKK2TVGnMSSbapg.review_text: Neat place to come when there's no line. The big volcano drinks have more sugar in them than alcohol but they're festive for sure. There's lot's of pirate themed decor, but not a lot of room. It was crowded but the bartenders were handling it like champs. I love it when they hush people for just shouting out their orders out of turn.

KFV9jDa1Lb36nZ5MGcrVcQ.review_text: Moseyed over here after dinner for some cocktail action.  Great largely authentic tiki bar vibe.  A little cramped though.  The menu was amazingly informative with plenty of options, both individual drinks and group bowls.  The bartenders were super helpful, but it's almost to the point where it is a problem -- for example, when trying to order our first round of drinks, some college aged looking guy was asking question after question after question to the bartender. He's standing idly this whole time (literally for about 5 minutes), and when the kid finally orders a simple beer (lame at a place like this), the bartender finally can get to me.  He easy could have been multitasking finished at least a few of the drinks I ordered, but instead, he just made a bad backlog worse. Oh well... the drinks were still very good.  Side note: only a few blocks from Absinthe, so it's a great one-two punch.

csJB5kjZXAgWpN5h6y3sMQ.review_text: Smuggler's Cove is great!  I've been to several tiki bars across the country and this one has the best decor by far.  Upon visiting, it was just after 5pm and still daylight that it took a minute for my eyes to adjust to the striking contrast of the dimly lit bar.  There are three levels and two bars.  I went down into the lower level and it looked like there was some sort of meeting going on.  I returned to the main level, ordered a mai tai then found a cozy corner on the upper level that overlooked the floor below.    The mai tai was very good in that it was made in the authentic, traditional method.  No instant mixes or flavored rum.  The bartender measured out every ingredient - not out of being cheap - but because this is the type of establishment that favors authenticity and continuity. The craftsmanship makes it worth the price.  I definitely recommend visiting Smuggler's Cove.  It's decor is amazing. The staff is friendly and extremely knowledgeable.  The drinks are made with care and precision. This is the perfect place for an after dinner "dessert" drink or a good place to start the night.  I also highly recommend bringing out of town friends who have visited other tiki bars.

PMBgjVUFBRSAzvkVuSzxpA.review_text: DELICIOUS cocktails.  Their drink list (er, book) is more than impressive and their decor made me feel like I was on the Pirates of the Caribbean ride at Disneyland (and let's face it, what's more fun than being drunk at Disneyland?)  We also had an awesome bartender that instilled us with little known alcohol fun facts while making our delicious cocktails.  Can't wait to go back!!

9N-jabBo0hrrF8aVLIwnMw.review_text: Recently named one of the Top 10 bars in America, right?  Maybe Top 10 in SF, but hard to say in the nation...  Ruggy says Hot Buttered Rum and Ruggy is right.  Another good drink is the Volcano Bowl which is always a crowd favorite.  Fun fact: the cubes that are lit on fire are actually croutons soaked in lemon.  Smuggler's Cove is the bar you'd expect to find at the end of Pirate's of the Caribbean.  Another good bar in SF with the same flavor is The Tonga Room in Nob Hill, which I prefer because of their live band and dance floor.  Try both and decide for yourself, but remember: Hot Buttered Rum & Volcano.

pJQNx6BsCyYGNNYlFdnfAQ.review_text: Love this place!  Just wish it was less crowded but that's what happens when a place is good.  Fun drinks made from scratch...which take a long time to make.  Be prepared to wait & order 2 while you are at it.  Love the whole atmosphere!

5EXEBolr4rxUNYSRgawi7Q.review_text: Meh... Apparently Yelp thought my review was on the short side. Sorry Jeremy.  Meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh, meh !!  Translation: "Boring. I don't get it." (and they lost one star in the rewrite)

ei6Z52YF1UyTVaMQOYubPw.review_text: Best tiki bar in SF!  Great place to plan a birthday party and event gathering.  Bartenders are friendly, fun, knowledgeable and have tons of experience!    Try their piña colada.  It is perfectly mixed!  Of course, when you are there with friends, you MUST try their The Volcano!  You will see fire, sparkles, rum filled in a skull, boat and whatever they have!   Happy Yelping!

j6pW2YPhywHl_eTbJs4egQ.review_text: This is one of my Favorite bars. I had no idea I liked Rum so much until coming here.  If you are in San Francisco this is a must do.  Talk to the Bar tenders they are very nice and will point you in the right direction for a drink.

BdcNkjxcse8y48YISk6low.review_text: If The Goonies was your thing and you'd like to have an "Adult Goonies" night, Smuggler's Cover is probably your best friend.  The pirate ambience feels like some sort of strange amusement park ride, and the drinks pack a punch while retaining their sweet flavor (Credit to their expert bar staff).  Be ready for rum though, all of the rum.

0UJ0IutXnkp_jX2YpxPTYw.review_text: You know you're a regular when the bar-back says, "Welcome home!" My hubby & I come here at least once a week (twice lately). I recommend the Saturn or Caribeño with Gin! Actually, I recommend pretty much everything on the menu, there's something for everyone!   I love that you can always find friendly people willing to chat or buy you drinks! Sure there's a line, but with only 2 bartenders its to be expected. Drop by in the hours around opening or closing & you'll be sure to get a drink fast! There's also a spot in the Snuggler's Cove (top floor) where you can take pictures w/o flash (for us iPhone users)!

426IAYOuscDp4KzKa1_mcg.review_text: It's like the Pirates of Caribbean Ride and a dive bar had a baby.  (Advice: its gets crowded Thursday-Saturday)

_xpivv6pnLim13KiaHBKqg.review_text: Being an avid fan of Trader Vic's, I came here with reservations that it wouldn't be nearly as good.  I was wrong.  The drinks this place makes are amazing!  Every drink we ordered here was better than its counterpart at Trader Vic's (albeit with a higher pricetag) and damn, do they put you on your ass.  We were told the Zombie was the strongest drink on the menu.  I tasted it and thought "nah, it's not THAT strong..."  I was wrong again.  An amazing blend of rums and maybe a splash or two of juice, this drink will put you down for the night if you're not careful.  The Puka Punch is almost as strong & even tastier!  The pirate theme is the kind of kitsch you expect to find at a dive bar, and I'm not sure the decor fits very well with the upscale cocktails they make, but this place is still a must-visit.    Word of warning: no food or snacks here & the drinks are all quite strong.  Eat beforehand or plan to get tipsy before your next meal.

-x0CKxpoZkmj7QbzJRhEOw.review_text: Love this place!  Got to go for the first time last night to celebrate with some new friends and it was just great!  The drinks are delicious; the ambience a lot of fun; the staff friendly, nice and very helpful.  And, of course, the RUM!  All the many choices of incredible drinks mean I'll be happily coming back often.  I had the Dark and Stormy (times 2!) and it was perfect.  Some drinks have fun garnishes and I saw one that looked like a burgundy colored squid - turned out to be a rum soaked plineria (probably spilled this wrong...) blossom (that tasted good, too!).  This place certainly has a low key entrance that you'd miss unless you knew the address - which adds to the fun because once you step inside it is wonderful! If you love rum you gotta go!

_KQVe3rXh4yX2X5XiCvErQ.review_text: I come here every time I want to take out of town guests on an adventure, or when I need a breather from the hole-in-the-wall grunge bars of the Mission. Watching the bar tenders is entertainment enough for the evening--their mixology skills verge on a feat of acrobatic juggling. The elaborate menu is an encyclopedia of rum, and after two drinks, it reads like an academic chapter from Sweetness and Power.   The decor is a gimmicky hybrid of pirate and tiki, with glazed puffer fish hanging from the beams and fisherman's netting on the walls. Smuggler's has three levels and two bars. A technicolor fountain dominates the downstairs area, but I prefer to grab a crate-table on the top floor if one is available. Be warned--the first two floors turn into a crush of bodies on Friday and Saturday nights.

4XIjdvV3bz-e_NYzJRJLHg.review_text: What a fun place. I love to come here on rainy days as you feel like you have been transported somewhere else. We sat at the bar as this place is always busy, and had fun trying a few drinks with the bartender. We even had a flaming fishbowl thing. Its a fun place to go for 1or2 drinks.

K2DvBAGeehjyLSBx-Qy6qw.review_text: Over400 premium rums from around the world and 8 pages of delicious cocktails... Need I say more? If so, wait till you see the inside!

mAMHVEn9lUb6E81RzEPxcw.review_text: I went there a month or so back.  The drinks and design of the bar were good (although they have removed the 2 way mirror from when it was Jade) but overall it wasn't a great experience for 3 reasons:  Unnecessary line to get in - once we were in the bar wasn't crowded. Expensive - drinks were around $12/each for the nicer cocktails Crowd - mid 30's to 40's crowd and because they pad the line, there is plenty of space inside which is inhibitory to meet new people and socialize with people outside of your party.  Probably a good place to take a date because you'll get a seat downstairs and she won't be distracted by attractive people, but really not my scene.

OQBeD6RvLNjfgB64MBI1IQ.review_text: Marco is a rockstar.   My new favorite concoction has to be the Queen's Park Swizzle: it's the closest thing to an overindulgent tasting "fruity bitch drink" I've, well, indulged at the Cove so far AND it comes wrapped in a little obi-like towel as if it just waltzed backstage from performing a show. Bravo, Miss Swizzle, you were wonderful!

BtJDvVNwHVGrWy5qzhE4Ow.review_text: It's hard to nail them since they were only officially open for three nights but sheeeez. Where do I start? Got a bunch of people from my old work, new work and random friends to hook up her to check out the cheesiness and have a volcano drink. Get there at 6:30 place is not particularly crowded. Saw a few of our party upstairs with empty glasses. They informed me it took them 30 mins to get a rum and coke. Asked me to order them another since I was attempting to get drinks. By the way 10 bucks a drink!!!! Took me 30 min to order as well even though I was sitting at the freaking bar. My girlfriend who was on the way called me from outside saying there was a line and it was raining and could I come out to get her. A LINE. The place was near empty. Clearly they were trying to garner some cheap attention. When I went out to talk to the door man he said sorry its policy she will have to wait. We left. I felt sorry for the bartender, super sweet and made a killer Mojito but why the F#$K would they only have one bartender during opening week in a bar that mainly serves fru fru cocktails. Oh and again the fake line to make people think the place was bumping. That was just silly.  Hope it gets better I had high hopes.

NQkp8G5z1Zv4ilVhMtEWIA.review_text: I came here with four girls.  Terrible, terrible place. Barely any place to stand, tough to find seating, lines were crazy long at the bar. It was stuffy and gross and grimy.  Not to mention the bouncer was a total d*ck and no, we weren't drunk, our interactions with him happened at the beginning of our night.

gT401XnCiqlhRC0F5l2uBg.review_text: Hidden on Gough with a very missable plain black door, Smugglers is a super fun and different bar with fitting decor that makes you feel like you're in an actual pirate cove. The bowls are great to share and the variety of drinks available is amazing! Seating, however, is quite limited so would recommend coming to snag a spot.

JUfeYfJ6XtZAWxCpC1Zw0Q.review_text: I love the theme and feel of the place. Definitely not your average bar. Lots of rum drinks, since its pirate themed (obviously, from the name of the place), and there are three floors. But don't let that fool you, this place is tiny!   There is limited seating, but if you and your friends manage to grab a spot, order a Scorpion Bowl to share! The bartender will bring it out to you and light the coals on fire, which provides a nice little show while you enjoy your rather strong community bowl of libations. Just be careful not to melt your straw in the fire like I did....   Again, it is required you have a table or somewhere to set down your bowl of fire, or the bartender will refuse, understandably. It runs at about $36.   Purely because of the small size of the place, I would recommend you make this place your first stop of the night, and move on to other roomier bars in the city. It gets rather uncomfortable later on in the night even if you have a table, because the standing people will be constantly looking over at your party with their puppy dog eyes hoping that you'll get up and leave so they can enjoy a Scorpion Bowl themselves.   Don't be a fool like me and walk by the inconspicuous door three times before you figure out where the bar is.

8_APo4b5Y2lDlP681zvROA.review_text: I like Tiki bars and I'm glad that the city has another good one to add to its Tiki repertoire. What makes this place great too is that I do like rum. Since they have such a vast array of rums, I was able to figure out here that I do not like dark rum. However, I still liked all of their drinks and although a little pricey (normal for SF), each drink is artfully prepared. You can tell by the fact that they control how many people they let intot he establishment and insist on keeping a small bar with only ONE bartender to keep the quality consistent.   The decor is great and so much fun to see. The outside is very unassuming and looks nothing like the inside. If you think you're lost, just look for the red and green lights outside and you're there. The red and green lights represent the port and starboard sides of a ship, just fyi.

FpX4x2drtn1C_XihFysmQg.review_text: All sorts of Rums from all over the world. Awesome Columbia Rum "Dictador" aged over 20 years, very smooth. A must visit kinda place in SF.

zFn4uEpD6p2zxItJyvZ6UQ.review_text: Since I've been in the bay area I have been on the hunt for the perfect tiki bar. This place comes pretty close to it. Came here with some friends and sat upstairs. Tons of seating upstairs which is close to the main bar, you can also sit downstairs where again, they have another bar and a water feature that is kinda peaceful.   The drinks were awesome, started with the smugglers rum barrel, moved to the volcano and ended with an original Mai Tai (definitely my least favorite of the night).  Only thing keeping this place from 5 stars is the bar tender in the basement. She was V RUDE and not welcoming at all. I won't complain about the length of time it took to get a drink because lets face it, a tiki drink is gonna take a while but her lack of any sort of enthusiasm to see another human being was a downer.

omKzUFOC2YLIYnvy0_4GVQ.review_text: I like to drink Rum! I didnt used to; now I do.   Whiskey, vodka, and beer can be so boring, that's why once in a while I go to the Smugglers Cove for the Rum! Its refreshing and after two Planters Punches youre on the way to the Irie Isles of the Carribean...

TsA6TZSqS11j8T5YP9skQQ.review_text: My absolute favorite place to have drinks in the city, especially with out-of-town guests. Smuggler's is a great theme bar, without being campy. The drinks are legitimately first-rate, and there's really no other place like it in the city.

NZEa3CrFiqEvu_uDl3pTHQ.review_text: Walking up to smuggers cove, I wasn't sure if it was even a bar or any type of establishment opened for business.  I decided to trust the address on google and proceeded to opened the door anyway.    This rum bar was a new experience for me.  Don't get me wrong.  I didn't not like the bar, it was just different from what I'm accustomed to.  The bar was brightly lit and the music was very low and had a playful vibe.  This is a good place if you just want something casual and not anything too stuffy.  It was pretty crowded when I first got there which was around 11PM and I waited about 15 minutes to order a drink.  I think I just happened to walk in at a bad time because half an hour later, the bar cleared out quite a bit.  I ordered the Puka Punch.  This is a good drink if you want something strong but can't stand the taste of alcohol.

QbddwvhELG9-loCCV16U8w.review_text: This place is kind of hidden, and you'd have to know it's there to know it's there, which I love.  I found it about a year ago when my hubby & I wandered over there looking for an old favorite of ours, Jade.  Lo and behold, it was transformed into a pirate bar!  What a pleasant surprise, 'cause the bartenders are really nice and they make kick-ass drinks.  I've been taking all my friends there and everyone loves it!

QS_Yc7Uhz5li7tFKfhCnIg.review_text: I could go on all day about how amazing this place is, so Im going to try to make it short.  Im a huge tiki bar fan and this is my favorite tiki bar.  Its hidden location really does make you feel as if you have found a hidden treasure. The interior is immaculate, and the decor is a full tiki/pirate immersion. You forget you are in San Francisco, and instead feel as if you have been transported to some ancient, secret, tropical, pirate watering hole.  The drinks are unrivaled in taste, use of fresh quality ingredients, and presentation. Oh ya and as if thats not enough, they serve drinks that are on fire...weeeee.

n-LZIcHGmWfRl1GwdNlFzQ.review_text: Really neat atmosphere. They did a great job of making it look like a pirate ship. 4 stars is really riding on the interior. Drinks were disappointing though. Tasted cheap.

bED8RYkQHGrQJRfrOBr9Ow.review_text: My favorite bar in the city. The drinks aren't cheap, but you get your money's worth. They can take a while to make, but you're not getting the usual; trust that the bartenders are creating a little bit of paradise for you using top-quality ingredients behind that bar.

avw0-No4SZ348c06Z2j3pA.review_text: A wonderful addition to the neighborhood. It's a fun place with a gorgeous interior. Someone obviously took great pains to provide an atmpospheric little bar where the drinks are imaginative and reasonably priced!

yR-6YxGdgNJTBfJtQ5CmRw.review_text: I came here with a group of friends and because the place is so small only half could get in and half had to wait- that was lame (even though I understand why they had to do it). This place from top middle and bottom was packed. I really didn't find anything to special about the drinks they are pretty pricey so expect to pay close to $30 for two drinks depending on what you order. We also ordered the big bucket dealio drink that they lit on fire, that was fun and you share it with a lot of people.The bouncer was real cool and everyone did have a great time. The Bartender was so busy but he doesn't talk or smile at all which I thought was lame, I understand you have to mix many drinks and yada yada but smile guy shit don't you want to get tipped well or bring people back? Even the barback had no personality.  If you have not been here you should check it out at least once it's pirate themed and different from other bars but I don't see myself coming back for these reasons: over crowded/waiting in line, bartender is not persobable and the drinks are pretty pricey. If your a pirate person this is your place.

he4K1UtoD4Su54SbCoFkUw.review_text: Though the name would lead you to believe that it is a secret gay bar, and the exterior looks like the head quarters of an evil organization, I assure you this is one of the coolest pirate tiki bar experiences ever. I say experience because the second you walk in you are transported to a very awesome rum soaked tropical wonderland. I mean they have an indoor waterfall, how much cooler can it get than that. Now lets talk about these bowls. Holy heck yeah batman, these things are so cool, delicious, and rumtacular its not even funny. I strongly suggest the volcano bowl, it is out of this world, and they light it on fire. Also beware, drink it with others it is deceivingly potent. The cove also features a cornucopia of  decadent cocktails, that are fantastic. The only  two negatives would be: 1) its too small, when this place gets crowded forget about it, its way too crazy. granted I'm a relaxed bar kinda guy. 2) the prices, still totally worth it, but still damn...   In the end the cove has a special place in my swashbuckling soul (dig the alliteration, it took me a sec) so it gets a 5 outta 5. Also don't say i told you but ask about the drink bingo card thing, or the rum school, or both... the choice is yours.

USZ6XUarw563pg1ON8TaVA.review_text: Think Disneyland pirates or the Caribbean ride/Tiki Room but serving delicious well made tropical drinks. Drinks are average $10 and up but the taste and concoction is really really good. For a person who prefers not to taste the alcohol, they sure know how to serve deadly drinks. Really hard to spot the entrance which is a fantastic way to weed out tourists. This place is an awesome three stories bar with huge variety of rum and plenty of seating areas. Yo ho yo ho a pirates life for me and my maties!  Quick tip: watch out for the street cleaning signs and avoid getting a ticket! Order their specialty house drink: Smuggler's Rum Barrel

DAjfeiurnQyV--vKj39j1A.review_text: As one of the top bars routinely ranked in the best bars of the world, it was no disappointment.  We were initially concerned that it would be full, as they have a strict capacity limit, but fortunately they had yet to get super busy.  We both had painkillers, he got the 2oz version, I opted for the 3oz.  They both were amazing, transporting us back to Jost Van Dyke in the Virgin Islands where we had just been a year prior almost to the day.  Perfectly poured and a spectical to see made.  Their menu pretty much runs the gambit of authentic Carribbean / Cuban  1920s era drinks.  Atmosphere is authentic, inviting and rustic.  Bartender was courteous and helpful.  Drinks are reasonably priced, all things considered.  It's a must-visit when going to SF, we will definitely be back.

Ma_gwnVShENgTuhHNpAvyQ.review_text: Easy to miss.  Just look for the black, unobstrusive entrance and you'll be transported into a pirate world.  Fun decor and theme, but that isn't the only treasure this place hides.  Bartenders are incredibly knowledgeable in all manner of liquor, and they knock cocktails out of the ballpark when it comes to quality, and the value is absolutely terrific.  Please stop by.    PROTIP:  they can even make something tailored to your tastes at your request.  Just let them know how sweet, aromatic or citrus, and what type of liquor your prefer.

nos7eU-naFk32w15RwvDRA.review_text: It feels like you're at Pirate's of the Caribbean in Disneyland. Very fun for SF... but can be a little cheesy too.

2UuNTFCDZPa3DImEA111fw.review_text: Went back here again a couple weeks ago, and I have to say that the speed and attentiveness of the service has improved.  It doesn't seem impossible to get drinks anymore, though the place wasn't as crowded as my first experience there.  They've filled out the carribean pirate ship decor as well.   I think that zombies are up to $14 now, however.  This place can get expensive in a hurry, and that is my only reservation.

Xq_BboSLsfaHbbgqEYX1UA.review_text: being out-of-towners and not knowing where to go, after dinner at Jardinere for my hubbie's b-day, we were referred to Smug-town and fell in love instantly. its an itsy-bitsy, 3 level bar loaded to the brim with booze, specifically foofy ones with pirate themed names which basically consist of rum and some juice of the moment.    overall: great place to check out without the overly annoying, worn out, tiki lounge feel (aka Tonga Room). ahoy matties...

k-vUlHIPmzdA_9-xhilRiw.review_text: This place is easily on of the most fun bars I've ever been to. I walked in and was convinced I'd fallen into a fantasy tavern in another world by mistake. I think it's safe to say that I was instantly impressed, and excited.  The piña coladas are bomb, and all the drinks my friends ordered, they loved. The drinks aren't too sweet, nor are they too overwhelmingly strong. A must here, as long as you're with a decent sized group of friends, 3 or 4 preferably, is the flaming bowl. I don't remember what it's called exactly, but the theatrics are totally worth it, plus it tastes delicious.  The staff were fun and helpful. It's a great place to just hang out with friends when wandering the city. Also, I saw some people there dressed up with pirate hats on, which just made everything better, and no one even batted an eye. Instead of looking goofy, they fit right in. I may have to come back here some day in full costume just to see what happens.

ilesK4CRarjiblkxUDL_tQ.review_text: Indoor Pirate ship, Volcano drink on fire, green lighting and huge chairs!!! What more can I say???

flyL9UbHFIgluKDT--JVVQ.review_text: Smugglers Cove could easily have been over decorated like a bad ride at Disneyland but this place has just the right amount of kitsch. LOVE it! I've always gone at happy hour and given how small it is, I don't think I'd go during peak hours. The bartenders take their time making the drinks so patience is required but the reward is the best mai tai on the mainland. My only criticism is that it's a little dark upstairs which makes it difficult to read the menu - that's half the fun.

PrS-1IkZBA31DM2fwfuSZg.review_text: Oh Smuggler's Cove, how I love your erupting volcano drink. My best friend and I handled that massive thing expertly and started our night off right.   The bartender was amazing, so friendly - and she was making drinks like mad!   I will definitely be back. This place is awesome.

uSyPtqgXYsAwdiPvostnLg.review_text: "Why is the rum always gone?"   Captain Jack Sparrow will never ask this question once he steps foot inside Smuggler's Cove because they serve nothing but rum in all it's liquor prestige. Holding the pink slip for the most diverse selection of rum in San Francisco from 34 different countries (including Dominican Republic's Brugal), I think it's safe to say that this bar has solidified their reputation as the premier spot for rum lovers alike.    From the outside, one could easily pass by without even knowing a bar existed behind the blacked out door, and you can't peak inside either since the windows have been painted black. This notion of shutting the world out due to its exclusivity is what gives Smuggler's Cove an illusion of secrecy - that you could be part of something illegal...  Upon entering, your vision will be feasting on the carefully thought out nautical choice of decor. Anchors, fisherman's nets, harpoons, shells, rum barrels, and not forgetting to mention the Hawaiian shirts that bartenders wear which add a very legit islander feel. Very welcoming, and arouses the anticipation of what their mean collection of liquor will do to you.   Their menu is quite helpful also, for example, if you want to try patron's favorites or would like to know which packs a strong hit, just look at the symbol next to the drink of choice. I went with the standard and picked their popular Smugglers Rum Barrel, (I promise to be a tad more adventurous next time), and I had a sip of my date's Navy Grog. Both drinks did not disappoint, and Smuggler's Cove did not disappoint.   A++++++++ Excellent rum, amazing bartenders, great atmosphere!  P.S. Come during their off peak hours to fully enjoy the place, otherwise, expect cramped spaces since this is not a huge venue.

iYcA4HdHZkKnr5qwBna33Q.review_text: This place is awesome! If your with a group get the drink they set on fire. I cant remember the name but it tasted great and was so cool to watch.

_xQu2ynqZIOBsh3xU1zFgQ.review_text: Shiver me timbers, it's great for a group of 4 or less. If you're planning on attending with a large party be warned your seating arrangement may feel more awkward than Tom Cruise at the Playboy mansion.

BGzavA_ddMr-jGmhArv7fg.review_text: I once dreamed of having a pirate-themed wedding. I had lots of spare time in university and so my flights of fancy (and sensitive nature, I guess) got me sketching nautical wedding regalia in notebooks, calculating plank mechanics, and obtaining quotes on boat insurance and life-preservers in bulk. For a guy who hates weddings, I spent a shameful amount of time on the subject. Let's not talk about it again.  Anyway, fast-forward to my first night as a resident of San Francisco. Smuggler's Cove transported me back to to when I associated partying with portholes.The aesthetic there is nautical without being fey, and the aroma of rum is potent in the air.   I ordered many drinks, some of them engulfed in flames. The drinks flow at a deliberate pace, but that's because the bartenders carefully measure their shots and there are some 6-10 ingredients per cocktail. But cool those jets hombre, because once you slide that rum-soaked goblet bedeckled with a paper umbrella mouthward all will be right in the world. A wonderful welcome to the west coast.  Obligatory Title Pun: Yo, ho, ho, and a bottle of FUN.  Menu Readability: They have a very piratey menu.  Need to mention: I hate hate hate the name Smuggler's Cove.  What this place teaches me about myself: I should have tried harder in university.

o8PAw4M1JpD0A4sS1gDK8Q.review_text: Updating the Cove to 5 stars. The previous review was on day two of business, and the Cove has gotten better and better. Cheers.

x0UXRYvAvVMjXcELrMmuyg.review_text: Can't wait for the novelty to wear off and this rum soaked atrocity to fall off the Hayes Valley map.  Jade was such an understated posh little neighborhood hangout with fantastic happy hour and the occasional "crowd".  Outdoor lines, interminable waits for drinks, and crowds in this tiny enclave are a recipe for disaster. Take your pirate cove back to Oakland where it belongs.

i-6V2FjscqbcZh9VbsFwFQ.review_text: The GOOD: Really liked the variety offered, deserves to be called one of the best cocktail places in the country. If you want to try out something other than the usual tropical, citrusy cocktails, go for the Hot Buttered Rum. I imagine that's how spiked Butter Beer from Harry Potter would have tasted. You get to sip it out of a cinnamon stick straw ! The interior decor stands up to its name. Certainly deserves a 5 star rating, but...  The BAD: Expect to spend around 30-40 mins in the queue on busy nights. Really annoying if you are planning to impress someone but first have have to stand in the cold for so long. Knocked off a star just because of this.  The UGLY: The place is really tiny. Good luck finding a spot to even just stand. Definitely not recommended for groups larger than 3. This is a major buzzkill because after the queue outside and the crowd at the bar, you can't even have your drink in peace. Never feel like having more than one drink.

gZiwpZ8qkWlbhKSDNW3F2A.review_text: The small and discreet storefront does little to advertise the charms that lie within. Driving by?
