Look for the port and starboard running lights as your location hint.  But once you're inside, look to be charmed! The interior is a whole lot of fun, with terrific details and charming touches. It's tiny, but not so small that the place seems cramped, thanks to three discreet levels that allow for a lot of seating for the size and nice little nooks. Unfortunately, there isn't a whole lot of sound muddling, so the small space can get noisy when it's at capacity.  Capacity can be an issue, since it is a small space, and the staff is really careful about not going over the fire marshall's recommended capacity. That's a good thing though, given the amount of decor!  None of those things are enough to dampen my enjoyment of the place. Especially when you consider the drinks!  If you enjoy an adult beverage that is made with the attention of a fine meal? Just check out the huge menu! It's a large book, which feels like a Chinese restaurant's menu and is filled with great drinks that anyone's palate can find a pleaser in. And for those that like to know the what and why of their drinks, each entry has a detailed entry to inform the curious.  As mentioned in some other reviews, the size of the space and the complex, gourmet-like mixing of the drinks make service occasionally slow, which means that this isn't a very good bar for going out and getting hammered, if that's your goal. And at the prices, there are better values for the purpose of getting a major drink on too.  This is a place for the mature appreciation of the drink and the society of your fellows. In summary, if you want to be a douche or get picked up on, better off going elsewhere.  Oh, and did I mention the faster way to get a drink? Shouldn't need saying, but at this rum bar, you can get served more quickly by ordering the rum!  And speaking of the rum... Like drinking? Like collecting? You absolutely need to look into the Rumbustion Society. Not only is it a guided tour through the complexities and differences in rum that serves as a tutorial for your palate to that wonderfully complex beverage, it's a great opportunity (once you've become an "Initiate," to try some rare and unique rums. If you think you're going to visit more than once, you owe it to yourself to at least try out the first phase of 20 different one oz. pours. Ask any of the super-friendly folks working there, they'll fill you in!

34hxylRP15cVPUS0BSDldw.review_text: Love this place! You would never know what is inside from the blacked out windows and the little green light outside. I always bring friends from out of town here or for pre drinks for birthday's etc. My personal favorite is the massive scorpion bowl that they light on fire! its awesome. i recently discovered I have a slight allergy to rum..but i still come here and drink it regardless...i will take the risk for the punch.

CMBHaQsUyKpii4FAbSBi5w.review_text: Definitely a great place to have drinks with friends. The atmosphere is really chill and the staff is friendly. The drinks are strong, everyone has to try their zombies.

uYFz9ITmzqome2xfq-kkhQ.review_text: This is an awesome place to hang out with friends and have amazing drinks! The painkillers series 2-4 is my fave and it takes all my pain away lol... Bartenders are friendly and environment is pretty chill, its like walking into the set of the pirates of the Caribbean... Will be going back fosho!

4mKHjIOp2jGIjmNGRHUIDQ.review_text: I have never written a review on Yelp before but I felt compelled to write something about this place.  Totally over hyped bar. Was hardly anyone there when we went on a Saturday night. We had a couple drinks then moved on to a more festive atmosphere. Drinks were just ok and over priced and staff was not very friendly and frankly rude to us and another couple while we were there. I will not be back.   I would definitely not recommend to anyone.

_S5tB9stFX3YKLBPVoEjqA.review_text: i can't hate. i was a big fan of "jade", so it sucks to no longer have them around. they havehowever,  brought a fine replacement to the neighborhood. the decor here is something along the lines of the "pirates of the caribbean" ride at disneyland. very cool. they still have bars on the main floor and the bottom floor, and extra seating on the top floor. the famous water fountain is still there too.   drinks are a bit expensive. $8 is the cheapest, but most run in the $12-$13 range. these prices aren't any different from most tiki bars, though. and they really make each drink to perfection and load up on the alchy. they also have scorpion bowls, ahem... if you'd rather have a beer or a regular mixed drink, they have you covered as well.   since i live about a block away, i will surely be back a fair amount.  p.s. if the line upstairs is too long, go downstairs. that was the case thursday, and we got our drinks from a very nice bartender downstairs in no time.

Nrw5rzrPFjpumgrLIjgamg.review_text: If you want a great rum, this can barely be beat!  The ambiance is awesome and almost unbeatable. You have to see it to really get it.  The only issue I had was with 7 servers and only about 20 customers, the service was very very slow. For most folks, however, I think people are used to this and expect that in a bar atmosphere... but 7:20 ratio?? What were they doing? I don't know so I grant them the benefit of the doubt and give 4 of 5 starts =)

ZhATZtcAivCoCVCup3VSeQ.review_text: I has been wanting to check this place out since it opened. I absolutely love the decor here! It's 3 floors and there's an amazing array of seafarer decorations! I love the fountain too! I was seriously impressed with decor and probably need a few more visits to check it all out.   I've only been here once but I'd love to come again. I was treated to a drink which was amazing! The menu has a dazzling array of fancy rum drinks at fancy prices. The price warrants the quality of the ingredients and dedication of the bartenders; however, this is definitely a place to stop off for a drink, not stay and get trashed unless you're loaded (money-wise or drink-wise). Definitely check this place out sometime!

JZMPR_463Jk-Y-eg79m4uA.review_text: ARRRRRRRR....pirate bar!!! smuggler's cove is not your average tiki bar. the cocktail list is impressive and LONG - so many to choose from! the bartenders all know what they're doing, and the drinks are finely created.   the puka punch is pretty epic, and the scorpion bowl and volcano are pretty impressive - and massive!   and beware - some of the drinks are deceptively strong! (i'm talking to you, puka punch!)  it does get a bit crowded in here and is hard to find seating in here, which is a problem if you order a fire-lit drink like the scorpion and volcano. but man, this place is awesome.

D_vUuSroj1CDxJqYWAG1Ww.review_text: I cannot rate this place higher.  Decor is off the charts. It's like a Disney ride where the designer didn't totally buy into the family friendly crap and made a kick ass actual pirate cove. Arrrr! I ordered a Scorpion bowl.  They delivered it to the "table" (shipping crate) and as the waiter set it on fire he cackled with a "muhahahaha" evil laugh.

keDrbt3kDKaDCANO86nyug.review_text: I went here for the first time on a Wednesday night. The place was pretty packed and we had to wait 15 minutes to find a table so I don't wanna know how it is on weekends.  Everything besides the lack of space was great though. The interior is amazing, you feel like being in a pirates of the Caribbean movie.  Order the 6 people bowl (scorpion, I think), really good rum pineapple cocktail which they set on fire for you while doing a little show at your table!!

jTGyJxTZlYqwxAXztfWwgw.review_text: Definitely a novelty and a cool place to hang out. The atmosphere is great and really pirate-y haha. Multiple levels with comfy benches and even a pool of water on the lower level. Extensive menu of cocktails based almost entirely on rum (no surprise there) - a bit pricey but the festive atmosphere more than makes up for it. The only cons are the limited seating and the wait for drinks. The volcano bowls seem to be really popular and I can see why...

Z_cRQZn0EW1tsMsrXo312w.review_text: This is one of the most celebrated bars in the United States. Unbeatable rum selection. Very cozy, intimate, and trendy. Renowned and deeply knowledgeable bartenders.  Can't lose with this choice!

en7bEkzUtMBcZBGrADW3Xg.review_text: A friend of mine was talking about this place last week and to my surprise after a nice stroll with some friends Smuggler's Cove just happened to appear in front of us. So we decided to come on in..  There was quite a wait. There was a line blah blah it was to be expected but I still had a great time with my friends. So if I ever stroll on over again I think I'll do it on a weekday.   Intimate, nice bar. They went to town making this place look like a pirate lovers dream. I came here once before when it used to be Jade and I was impressed with the decor and all around feel of the place. Bartenders that night were on top of it. I talked to Matt one of the bartenders here later on and gave us good suggestions for drinks. He didn't disappoint.   Definitely a fun addition to Hayes Valley and although I can't see myself coming here a ton I will totally recommend this place.

74_-F-a_jxVBz-aBDRsYDQ.review_text: Zero star for the extremely rude doorman.  Cute nice cozy place. that gets 4 stars. Can get crowded ( very crowded, as its very small place)  The bar tender was pretty cool and the drinks were good. Forgot what I drank but was good. Sure wanna come back when there is a different gentleman working on the entrance.

4jEhGsIlA5rWUtAmGGdmJg.review_text: This place was awesome. Interesting niche and drinks. Just a pity that it was a line to get in.

uFvrfog94XPCMWWvt6NVgw.review_text: Where else can you go to a bar that looks like the inside of a pirate ship? The waterfall inside is a nice touch and I like sitting on the lower level. We usually get the rum punch bowls that they set on fire. The bartenders are cool. This place is always crowded and sometimes there's a line outside but its usually worth the wait. They have a large and unique cocktail selection and the drinks are always strong. Overall I really like the ambiance of this bar but it is pretty small even though it is three levels/ sections and sometimes it takes a while to get your drinks.

uJqx8ZYk4hI_XkVDqB7BoQ.review_text: I'm sad that they don't do the cinnamon show anymore with the punch bowls. They used to throw cinnamon on the flames and they would flare up and it was so cool. I think they're too busy now to do that. Oh well, their volcano punch bowls are still awesome. I always order the rum barrel punch, but without the souvenir mug. The menu is so long, so you should probably just go with the first thing that sounds good. I've spent a long time perusing the menu and then I can't remember what sounded good haha.  Note: this place is always crowded so go when they first open. Plus, they have happy hour so drinks are a couple dollars off in I think the first hour.

YA956p6_J6tNZaeZUi1QHg.review_text: Some of the best cocktails in the country and they have the awards to prove it. They make an excellent Zombie, but the Puka Punch is where it's at. The decor is great and the bartenders are incredibly friendly. I'd recommend not visiting on the weekend as it does get very crowded. If you like rum in the least, this is a place you need to check out.

rVWebsft_jx629iCO6vQ5w.review_text: This joint is decorated like it was the official drinking spot of Disney's Pirates of the Carribran theme ride, but with over 300 runs an plenty of specilized mixed drinks this is also the most impressive rum selection I have seen in a while. The bartenders are a bit full of themselves, but they certainly know what they are doing.

nNsDgAaEbxXw-fPOlIaP-Q.review_text: Oh my friends, what a find!  I heard about it before but didn't really know where it was. I found out when I actually was looking for a dry cleaner close to my new apartment; thanks to fellow Yelpers, I was told about this cleaner "next to Smuggler's Cove".  Oh, I thought, this is close to my place, great! Then I realized it replaced Jade Bar, which I liked very much, and sadness ensued. But I still wanted to give it a try.  Good thing I did! Yes, the pirate-themed decoration is not for everybody, but even though I'm sooooo much more Ninja than Pirate, I kinda like it. I also love rum, and they specialize in it... they have rum flights, which I have never seen before! The cocktail list is impressive (77 seven drinks!) and if you're into drinks, you will spend about an hour reading the Menu (yes, I called it a Menu) with all the ingredients, history of rum, funny quotes and all, like the girlfriend and I did. The bartender, Steven, is new there but very nice and professional.  I had a flight rum, their special Smuggler's Cove Barrel (comes in a little barrel you can take home!) and the deadly but delicious Puka Punch. The girlfriend also had a Mojito, which she didn't like, because they make it the traditional way: little sugar, little lime, more mint, more rum and less muddling. I liked it, but I am not a fan and here is my breakdown for the Mojito list:  - Taste: 2 stars. I like them sweeter, less minty. - Appearance: 4 stars. Very elegant. - Price: 3 stars. 9 bucks, fair. - Bartender's name: Steven. All the other drinks he made were excellent, so I bet he can make a kick ass Mojito if I ask for a sweeter one. - Overall: 3 stars and a half Mojito.   Just like Jade Bar was, the place is quite small and even on a Thursday at 8pm we had trouble finding seats; and some girl behind me kept elbowing me in the spine :(  I will definitely go back because 1), it's 2 blocks from my new place and 2) they have a card for the 77 drinks and you get a stamp for each one you try, and when they're all stamped.... well I don't know what happens, but I hope I get a map to the Dead Man's Chest (and that will determine the fate of the update to a fifth star :)

NIvEp2Rkvufik9ZZ4QGlaw.review_text: Don't really get the hype.  I got the daquiri.  It was fine.  The atmosphere is fancy tiki.  Maybe I've just become too much of an LA girl because this just doesn't compete with Tiki Ti.  Didn't really think it was worth the wait.

ttC21tYWje99-twhibbs3g.review_text: Yo Ho Ho! The NYT had it right; Smuggler's Cove is already the hottest new tropical or tiki themed rum bar in America. With good reason. The atmosphere in incredible, with nods to many of the great local tiki bars of the past. Notch and Martin have combined their visions into a wonderful temple of polypop and nautical fantasy. Love the waterfall. Meanwhile, the drinks are all we've come to expect from the country's most celebrated rummixologist.. The spices in the Smuggler's Rum Barrel are overwhelming -- ideal for me, but if that's not your taste be warned. The mai tai is excellent, an interesting variation, though closer to a "classic" or traditional mai tai than to Martin's former Island Mai Tai. My wife and I both loved the Euridyce rum, a distinctive, someone fiery tasting, rum specially made for the Cove by Alameda's own St. George's Distillery. A very good sipping rum. We only had the Special Reserve, the Cove's other exclusive rum, in a couple of mixed drinks, so we have to try it a few more times before we can comment usefully on it.

RCKdmKDZRd-RovZVtNSCLA.review_text: This shimmer-me-timbers pirate party zone has at least two cool elements about it. First, it's on multiple floors -- there's even a metal stairway down to the bottom by the underground bar. Second, they seem to specialize in rum drinks, if you're already plotting what to have.  Depending on what drink you order, some might even come with a special pirate's mug to keep! One thing's certain: they go all out for the pirate ship decorations.  Can get a bit overcrowded... Argh!

Uvoe-lg-XrFh3OStIZMmuA.review_text: This place get the "Can't Judge a Book By It's Cover" award. Outside it looks like a sterile office building with just two lights, red and green (port and starboard, get it?) Inside it's like stepping into a nautical wonderland. Aye matey, yo ho ho and a bottle of rum!   My son brought me here for my Father's Day celebration. We had the Scorpion Bowl...careful, eyebrow singeing is a real risk here. We were in the basement, but it felt like the bilge of a pirate ship. A unique and fun place to experience rum in all it's glory. Hats off to the brave entrepreneur who brought this fantasy to life. Highly recommended!

D_XyDs6d4DXgIdObhHeZDQ.review_text: ***Good*** Rum! Rum! Rum! All their drinks are amazing. Atmosphere is legit; even if packed doesn't take too long to get a drink. Three different, albeit small, floors.   ***Bad*** Small; and can require a decent wait to get in during peak hours.  ***Recommendation*** Any of their signature rum drinks: the punch, or that giant thing they light on fire.

RG1u7a4bbwFKJfUaJwi_Xw.review_text: On my list of top three bars in the city. I still have quite a few more to go to but if you like rum come here. If you don't like rum come here and ask them to recommend you something and you might find yourself loving it. A staggering menu of drinks, an even more staggering menu of rums. Crazy decor. The only complaint is that they sometimes can get too busy but the drinks are worth waiting for. Either way whether you like the dolled up fancy cocktails, the more refined sipping cocktails or you want a party here, seriously come here.

zXi8WzXV2lfefnnzPEnOOw.review_text: Admittedly, with the anguish of Jade's demise and the bitter spite I have for themed bars this place didn't stand much of a chance coming out of the blocks. However, the 100G+ remodel must have flipped a switch in my subconscious dating back to my days of eating mushrooms at Disney world.   The interior was slathered from top to bottom in pirate nostalgia that would take a 85 year old pack-rat with a Johnny Depp fetish half a lifetime of picking through Caribbean garage sales to accumulate. Fortunately for the new owners I think giant anchors and war tarnished scabbards have their own page on Ebay now.   Their Rum list was as lengthy as their drink menu was extravagant and I admit I was a bit overwhelmed by the options they had. Each drink was built well, and although I am not a fan of paying 14 dollars for a cocktail, the amount of good rum in each drink crept up on me from behind like a horny raider on a fair wench.   The staff were all extremely personable and friendly and I had an interesting chat with a Dom DeLuise stunt double while he checked libations from a list in an apparent attempt to sample the worlds finest Rums while his blood pressure soared higher than Jolly Roger during an attack on the Queen's vessel.   I can't see myself stopping in here for my routine ten drink happy hour on my income but this would definitely be a prime spot to bring a date that you wanted to impress. The copious amounts of rum in each drink may work in your favor as well if your lass is a bit of a lilly liver.   I am gonna quit before I make one more ridiculous pirate metaphor.

l6in2-26rJL40SDNe6qz-w.review_text: I love rum.  I'm a Caribbean girl, how could I not?  This place was a dream.  The drink menu is EXTENSIVE. Any kind of rum drink imaginable, they can make for you.  My friend and I arrived early and noticed that it never got terribly crowded.  The bartender was super friendly and we had a great time.  Take a cab, because you will get plastered without meaning to. It's the rum.  Did I mention that I love rum?? Next time I'm in San Francisco I will definitely stop by.

XrRbDfhofoq-Cys6oKXdJw.review_text: Shiver me timbers! This place is funny - it feels like you have just stepped onto a set for a pirate movie right when you walk through the door. (something you would never expect when you see it from outside) I definitely have a friend that I HAVE to take here when he visits SF - I kind of just want him to visit so I can show him Smuggler's Cove!  I'm not typically a rum drinker, but thankfully the bartenders are EXTREMELY knowledgeable and friendly - I told them a few of my cocktail likes and dislikes and he whipped up a delicious rum based drink. (The menu is pretty long and wordy - so would have probably taken me a good while to find something on my own)

iu_RSnuAWlJboEJeZYG2nA.review_text: Stopped by here the other night after a yummy dinner with friends in Hayes Valley. This place is such a treat! It's hidden away and is very synonymous with its name, and has a intimate and fun tiki theme once you walk inside. The bar contains three "floors", with bars on the ground floor and the lower level. The ambience is fun and a great place to catch up with friends, although I can see it getting cramped on weekends.  THE ORCHID DRINKS. So pretty. Probably the best Mai Tai I've ever had--although I don't have many other points of comparison since I'm not a regular Mai Tai drinker. The bartenders crushed the ice and shook the Mai Tai concoction perfectly, and garnished it with some lime and a beautiful orchid. My friends ordered the big bowl drink (don't know the name?) with a fire thing inside, and it looked like a fun option too.  Side note, I may have ordered the drink just to take pictures of it because it was so pretty. It happened to be a plus that it tasted delicious too. Don't judge me!

IfZ1vqGIX31AmDFa0swSRw.review_text: I prefer coming here in the off hours and sitting and chilling here in what feels like the left over set from Gilligan's Island. But I did recently bring a group of 9 here on a Saturday and it was not so bad. Yes, Our menus were sticky but probably from all those who had passed through already. We were in the downstairs and had a few seats and eventually we all were sitting by the time someone came back with our drinks.  It's always so hard to decide what to have here but I think the Pina Colada is the best choice when you want something you will for sure like & is done very well! Yes, you're outside waiting across from the projects, but you are also around the corner from the Ballet. It's the city, Folks. It's everything opposite of the slick hipster bars. people included, which is refreshing! (though you may witness some unhappy faces who just don't get it) This is a come and be happy place.

u0jfWqgmsHsNSKfYxNYDHg.review_text: Came here for my birthday with four of my friends. We were lucky to get a table in the second floor/loft area. There was a long wait to get in since it's so small.  We got two Lava bowls and they were strongggg! We also loved the fire so much that we didn't want to put it out and drank from the bowl while it was lit (and melted a few straws).  Very fun- I'd be hesitant to come again with such a big group but I'd come back for sure if I was with one or two people.

7WSyI6xu6fe0i_7lsLgk_A.review_text: MARKO was an awesome bartender!   I had never come to smuggler's cove before, and a friend suggest it. Came here last Thursday and there was no line around 9pm when we came. The bar is split into tri-levels, each level getting larger as they go down. Dimly lit, there is only one bar on the main floor and one bar downstairs. We sat down on the main level and the bartender asked us what we would like.   My boyfriend goes "idk, what do you recommend?" Marko: "have you ever had a Mai Tai?" Boyfriend: "No" Marko: "Mai Tai it is" Boyfriend: "What... I don't know if I want a Mai Tai" Marko: "You've never had a mai tai? you're drinking a mother fuckin' mai tai"  this was all in good fun of course, and the mai tai was DELICOUS. It was ~$10. hey have a huge drink menu with drinks ranging from $9-$100 (those serve four or more)  Had a great time here. Obscure office looking building on the outside, but when you walk in it looks like Pirates of the Caribbean

phx600L3FXtSThW9vkiVhw.review_text: Fun, great tiki bar vibe, best of all the drinks. I got the buttered rum, warm sweet and delicious. Would go back to take more friends!

rTYN6CvFLAtetOXlba5R5A.review_text: I like Smuggler's Cove. It's like Disneyland and I also like Disneyland. Their extensive cocktail list could be slightly overwhelming if you're one who has a hard time making decisions but after all the friends you meet at Smuggler's Cove, you'll just end up ordering something they recommend and you go home happy (and feeling like you just walked off a boat at Pirates of the Caribbean).

ndily3e-Noj7SwlY_vK1Bg.review_text: If I could give this place 4.5 stars I would. I'll round up to 4 for now.  I wasnt all that enthused about the atmosphere at first, but it grew on me. I walked in thinking "THIS is one of the Top 50 Bars in America?! Rigged." But gradually, I grew to like the place.   I appreciate how all the drinks on the menu are tied into the pirate theme. I chuckled at some of the drinks' names while some of my friends cringed at them. (Think about field workers - wont go into that too much.)   Ended up ordering the hot buttered rum. Worth trying, but not the whole drink! The alcoholic taste is not pungent, so recommend this to the friends that arent fond of the taste of alcohol. Just share with a friend since its very rich towards the end.  As for the atmosphere, I enjoyed how not everyone was a trendy hipster so I didnt feel underdressed or judged for coming in my work clothes. There was a wide variety of people which is very much appreciated. One group had a emo-grudge look going on and another group within my range sported a laid back hippie style. My point is that there was a wide variety of people and almost anyone could fit into this atmosphere. No pirate costumes spotted though :P

IH1iOatR3UkGxuiZVD4Xqg.review_text: It's so CHEESY but I love it! And no tourists. It's like Pirates of the Caribbean at Disneyland inside. And PACKED. The MENU is HUGE. Every single drink I've had is EXCELLENT. Get a punch card and try them all! If you are in a group, get one of the volcanoes. Seriously. The bartenders are really fantastic here. Go early, avoid weekends if it is too late. I love that there is no signage and it is basically in the projects.

TLXPg3e2pBdwwjHJuJmhdw.review_text: BEWARE-Service  My wife is a Mexican immigrant and was denied service by an asshole at the door because of her ID format. He was a total asshole about it.

9L5RsVYJoLN2G0ZpWQiB9A.review_text: Amazing place with great rum drinks! They have one of the widest assortments of rums and rum-based cocktails in the city. Pain killers come in the 1oz, 2oz, 3oz, and for those extra strength days, 4oz varieties. With home made coconut cream instead of the normal bottled stuff. The decor is much tiki with a very intimate feel. I usually sit on the ground level, but there is also a bar downstairs, and additional seating upstairs. All my drinks have come out pretty fast and amazingly delicious.. So the only bad thing I can say is weekends get packed..   They have a couple giant party drinks, including volcanos, as well as two souvenir drinks: a tiki glass and a barrel one-- very cool keepsakes. If you are interested in the world of tiki and like the whole pokemon idea of collecting them all appeals to you, there is a cocktail card and a rum card. If you can hit 100+ rums, you get your name on a plaque on the wall.. I met one of the 500 guys last time I was there.. his friends weren't happy that I was encouraging him tho..  Go early. Go off night.

IB0_DRx-L8O1MtzwPF-lQw.review_text: Love this place.  The cocktails here are simply the best.  This is a place I would bring out-of-town guests to.  Walking inside feels like walking into the Pirates of the Caribbean ride at Disneyland - the walls are filled with nautical themed things, and the menu has drinks like "grog".  As someone who was obsessed with POTC and the Monkey Island video games, it's a dream come true.  The cocktails are all fantastic. I like the Caribbean flavors so I literally would just pick at random off the extensive menu, but actually some of them aren't for the faint of heart/low of tolerance. If you see a little picture of a barrel next to a drink, know that if you have it, you're in for a special night because those are the strongest drinks.  Besides fantastic cocktails (some of which come flaming and/or are meant to be shared amongst a group), you can actually taste some good rum by themselves if toy want. Now I'm no connoisseur, but I hear the rums are great.

bM1vovFIegj7naEzhIRIDg.review_text: My word, this place is a gem!  I don't always drink rum, but when I do...I drink a lot of it at Smuggler's Cove. The drinks are a bit on the pricey side, but they're definitely stiff. The decor is what you would expect from a tiki bar, but the layout will make you forget you're in the middle of a city.  I generally stick to bourbon when it comes to cocktails, but I ventured into unfamiliar territory last night, and I'm glad I did! This is the perfect spot if you want a strong drink that won't make your face turn sour.

SGDRGEP7_HwzrL0Dsf-7Og.review_text: Really fun place and great drinks but an incredibly rude bouncer who eventually got abusive with one of our friends.  Will only go back if we knew that bouncer wouldn't be on the door.

coEX0WGa92jJZ0Wgn1WRMg.review_text: I LOVE RUM!!  Yes, I'm a pirate!...a NINJA PIRATE!!! Even had a friend get my self named after boarding Rum drink submitted to Urban Dictionary (urbandictionary.com/defi…). And there's not a thing I don't like about this place...okay, maybe one thing but it's just because everyone else likes this place also, that sometimes it can get a bit overcrowded and take a lil too long to get a drink.  But the bartenders know their Rum (I believe all of them are Rum Masters or in the process of becoming one - don't quote me on it though). I particularly like this bar when it's somewhat empty.  The upstairs is a nice place to hang out with a group of friends overlooking the main bar and entrance.  I never really hang out at the downstairs bar because it usually fills up first and for some reason I feel a bit claustrophobic down there.  Sitting at the main bar is interesting...you get the attention of the bartender (which is nice because you can learn a lot), but you also get the "excuse me"s of others trying to order drinks. I like that their menu provides so much detail regarding the drink including it's potency.  Make sure to get a card so you can check off every drink you have there.  If you try them all, you can acquire some kind of card...which I, obviously, haven't gotten yet =( Now, only if they offered some small appetizers...

5v6juPIOisfmogp7QSso-A.review_text: Fun decor and yummy rum drinks. The place gets way too crowded, though. Maybe they should hire an extra bartender so it doesn't take quite so long to get served.

ucvTVzBMSGkLjzHqPdCM9A.review_text: Tinted black windows on the outside (and I believe a lack of signage) trick the common folk, but yes, there is a bar inside of here...and it's the bees knees. It's 3 stories, which, I know at first sounds like it's huge, but it's actually a very intimate and cozy bar. You've got the first floor which is like the size of a bedroom, the upper deck/balcony which is about the size of a small bathroom, and the area below being the size of a living room. They even have another bar down there and a freakin' waterfall. It essentially feels like you're inside a ship when you're there. You want to go now, don't you?  The drinks are all Tiki themed with rum being the main attraction. They're strong as hell and creep on you pretty late too -- or maybe because I had a big dinner beforehand? They are tasty too. Prices are more expensive than the norm but that's because you get your money's worth. I had one drink and I was good for the rest of the evening. The bartender we chatted with was very nice and outgoing and made some great recommendations for myself and the birthday girl. We saw a large group of people order a giant bowl drink with over 9,000 long straws coming out of it. There were flames. RADICAL.  Bring a date here and cozy up on the rock seating beside the waterfall. I did it and plan to do it again. Set the course for most badass bar in the city.

SHLsXd5jg0UgpDQoSWBHkA.review_text: Cute pirate-theme bar, small and sort of hard to find but located near a trendy, fun part of Hayes Valley.  Drinks are pretty good if you're into rum-based stuff.  There's two levels but the downstairs was kind of cramped and dark.  The menu takes forever to read since it's super wordy.  Overall, fun and cute.

0gpFaPgAeR78Cxeo9gd4KQ.review_text: This place is special! I loved it here. There is a funny doorman and the sign is a green and red light bulb. Entering is like going into a haunted house  (which I LOVE) Parting the dark curtain, you know you're in for something unusual. You descend down a dark metal staircase and pretty  soon bubbling blue water comes into view. There is plenty of cozy seating and one wall is a tropical looking bar. Everyone looks happy and cheerful. It's like being on a dark tropical holiday. Since I don't like the sun, this is a perfect as it gets for a tropical holiday.  Oh, the rum drinks are fantastic. We tried a fun selection from the huge and interesting drinks menu. From what I can remember...we had a Rum Flip, Pick Your Poison, Dot Dot Dash and other rum drinks that I will only remember when I try them again. The Rum Flip was my favorite and it's worth driving to San Francisco for another one.  It's really fun sitting on the ledge of the bubbling water and sipping the very powerful and unusual drinks. My new favorite!! Very exciting place!!

IprKHet03baoU8heBOYuwQ.review_text: On the outside, it looks like a mundane building...one you could easily pass by and had no idea there's a pirate themed cove inside!  We got there around 9:30p on a Saturday night and had to wait in line... I feel like the bouncers hold up a line as free advertisement...not cool with the winds of SF hustling through!  Once inside you get to the first bar. You can go upstairs where they are some seats and tables, or go downstairs to another bar (which I thought was more crowded). The place has cute decorations, and the drinks are yummy (av. $9-15/drink) and unique and nicely presented (mine had a hibiscus flower :)! The good thing was there was no music playing so you can actually have a conversation with your friends, but at the same time, the lack of music was making us sleepy. The place was also a bit smaller than I expected, but with its cute atmosphere and yummy drinks, I recommend it!

zU4G-4B2JDl8n4jaGSJPzA.review_text: Homophobic Sexist bouncer. I honestly can't believe I experienced this in this city. While leaving Smuggler's Cove this past Saturday, 11/16, the bouncer referred to my partner as a "whore" and made homophobic remarks to me because of my  "brightly colored outfit". I feel it's important to note that this occurred without provocation or instigation of any kind. I don't drink and only ordered only a Fentiman's cola. We left at 9 with our wits (and in my case sobriety) about us.  It's unfortunate that this incident occurred as I otherwise enjoyed our experience at SC. I cannot imagine that a place which prides itself on making quality high end drinks and a significant/classy selection of rum wants its bouncer (reportedly) reeking of alcohol at 8:30 pm and insulting their clientele to patrons waiting in line.   I remain shocked and offended and will not return until their rude, unprofessional bigot of a bouncer is replaced. I'm positive there are hundreds of reasonable human beings who would be happy to take his post.

59QzQ3-dmOD1USV2hQpwkw.review_text: Everything that needs to be said about this place has been said. Custom cocktails, a little too small/often crowded, and a cheesy decorating scheme. Also in the most random/nondescript space in the middle of the more questionable part of the Western Addition.  Given the above, this place could be good or an absolute disaster. Smuggler's Cove doesn't take itself too seriously though, so I'll go with the former. Plus the Scorpion Bowl is prepared with unicorn tears. Go ahead and ask the server.

rEuJ2MADbG5ZEVTPqkKoFg.review_text: My favorite bar in all of SF.   The staff who work here are incredibly knowledgeable and their skills exceed any and all expectations. I love love love going here for cocktails, (my favorite being the Pampanito)... Just don't take me here too early cause it often turns into the only stop I can handle, and by that I mean these drinks are dangerously delicious, always wanting more until you can't tell if you're in a bar or locked under the deck of a pirate ship... speaking of getting me tipsy off my rocker, Steven Liles is my favorite bartender in all the land for obvious reasons. He is kind, quick with a smile and a drink in your hand.   For local rum enthusiasts (aren't we all?) they have quite the selection from near and far, if you manage to drink your way through 200 or more of their fine rums they actually put you on the wall! Be sure to ask your bartender about this Rum Club of theirs!!  For visitors to our humble little city, this is a MUST stop for anyone looking for the best libations San Francisco has to offer!! You won't be disappointed!!   Watch out for those scorpion bowls though, THEY'LL GETCHA!!

GxwfhunWwiG0lDbkcV-J2w.review_text: This is the sort of place that requires respect. This is not the place you grab a bud and watch the game, if you want that, kindly move along. This place is for people who appreciate fresh ingredients and top notch rums made with care. Every Time we go there we are so pleased with the drinks. The crew is busy making multiple ingredient drinks and many of them. Kindly don't waste their time, be prepared and know what you want. It keeps the line moving and makes the tenders happy.  Respect them, they will respect you.

gSZ_PvKBmdsnW0EOuaq3IA.review_text: Have seldom had a more humiliating or insulting experience...  Went in for a cocktail (on the basis of the very good current vibe about Smuggler's Cove) & ordered some cocktails -- good, yes, bur fairly overpriced and nothing too special. Ho-hum evening - not too impressed but still,  relatively mellow experience.  However-  upon leaving - I was *physically* grabbed by the bartender (who came all the way to the exit to intercept me) -- apparently, I didnt sign my credit card slip & hence WAS LEAVING WITHOUT PAYING... He felt the need to grab be before exit (even though the credit card guarantees payment of my charges...) All-in-all, a humiliating experience in a bar that really isnt deserving of such attention.  I will not be back.

0KACxE-2K4msX7Juw8TEqQ.review_text: They lite your drink on fire! what else do you want?

YQP5MYkb6CQoyEf1jxVGuw.review_text: This is the perfect after dinner spot for a couple of drinks with friends. I love the fact that this is a serious tiki bar and doesn't dive off the deep end into disneyland territory. The staff from the doorman to the bartender to the bar back are all friendly, helpful and hilarious. I don't know how anyone could walk out of this place without a smile on their face :P

HEPfqAH6ObF36Fp1B9Fi1Q.review_text: The name alone is enticement enough, and I've had this Pirate's Haven on my list for some time now, when my friends serendipitously suggested we grab a cocktail here last night after - fittingly - watching "Magin Call" last night at the Kabuki. And though I expected a ship wrecked lair, I hadn't expected such elaborate decor. It was almost as if we'd walked into the Pirates of the Caribbean at Disneyland, and yet, we were at a locals' haunt, not a tourist trap. How odd? And yet, this is San Francisco, i.e. Never Never Land, so I was not in the least bit surprised by the irony. My first tasty treat was Painkiller No. 2: a delicious concoction of pineapple & orange juice, fresh homemade coconut cream, sprinkled with Nutmeg, and made with Premium Rum. Superb. And second, I tried my first ever Hot Buttered Rum. (What better venue to experiment?) Absolutely scrumptious, it was. Before exiting, we toured the grotto area in the basement below, which reminded me a lot of Casa Bonita back at home: yelp.com/biz/casa-bonita…

OZ0swpflv2ApbTDnNZJFSQ.review_text: yarrrrrrrr! I love the non-descript exterior and the pirate-themed ship inside! It was quite a surprise to walk into a whole different environment that one would least expect based off the outside building. The bar gets another star for the novelty drinks. Where else can you order hot butterscotch rum with a wafer stick?? Awesome!! Highly recommend for a good time with good cocktails. Next time I go back I'm going to have to get me one of those 4-person punch bowls.

CpYy-uIO7V5TY30DnkoeOw.review_text: For a top of the line tiki experience, I prefer Forbidden Island.  But since you'd actually need a pirate ship to reach that eponymous destination (i.e. Alameda), Smuggler's Cove is your best option when within SF city limits.    Although I'd never been to Jade (S.C.'s predecessor), my friend says that the layout (and particularly, the waterfall/grotto) haven't changed.  What assuredly has is the decor -- presently a half-tiki, half-pirate collage.   The drink menu stars rum, in every role imaginable.  Sample enough, and you can become part of the "The Rumbustion society,"---whose incentives are a bit corny, but whose process is kinda cool.     I'd wait until this place cools off a bit before coming, as its a rather small vessel--although if you stumble in after midnight, you likely won't have to brave a line and you'll have a place to sit.

ydAJelmtnNdj3Dhs4R6VdA.review_text: OK, I am a HUGE Tiki connoisseur.  I came to SF to hit some of these bars once and for all.  Smuggler's Cove was no. 1 on my list. Tucked away off Gough street in the city, there is a little bar that if you were looking, you'd miss it..  Once inside, you are greeted with a little bar with a HUGE rum selection. You have a small seating area upstairs, and a 2nd bar downstairs..  Very small, but that's why this place is excellent. Holding true to the traditional Tiki bar, it has no windows.. but inside you get lost into a world or inebriation..  The Menu book is superb, and the cocktails are savory to boot.  The staff inside are extremely awesome guys, and they even treated me like one of the locals which I always find VERY rare in the bars in LA.  I walked out totally plowed, and with a couple free mugs from the owner, and I have to say, I can't wait to come back. This place is freakin' amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

65uUyG9yuF0rdMh0z7ajaA.review_text: Yeah, it really is worth all 5 stars.  There's a line to get in?  Worth it. Trust me.  The other big advantage of the line is that they prevent the bar from getting too crowded - it's not a big space (and all the dark paneling and crazy nautical accoutrements make it feel even smaller), and it would have serious potential to feel claustrophobic, but the crowd control prevents it.  First, the atmosphere inside is fantastic - the space has been utterly transformed into a piece of the Pirates of the Caribbean set; it's amazing, and really sets the mood for the amazing quantity of rum you're about to consume.  For yes, while they do make a few drinks without rum, let's be honest - that's not why you're here.  After waiting in line for about 15 minutes, I walked in the door to find Martin himself welcoming us in with a small sample of the house rum, which was delicious and a perfect way of warming to the occasion!  The cocktail menu is something like 8 pages long, with fun, detailed descriptions of each of the drinks.  They even have bingo sheets with all of the cocktails on them, so you can get them checked off.  Not sure if you win anything for filling your sheet, other than your own personal pickled liver, but it's an entertaining concept, which is continued with their Rumbustion Society - a 3-level checklist of every rum in the house, 200 some in all.  You start with a 20-rum punch card, then upon successfully passing the final exam (yes, really), graduate from that to a further sampling of 80 rums, and finally hence to an additional 100 rums.  Pass all of these tests, and you get to join Martin on a private distillery trip!  That's crazy.  Crazy awesome.  Anyway, back to the bar.  The cocktails are amazing.  Really.  All of them.  And flawlessly made.  Yes, this means that your drinks will take more than 10 seconds to make, and that you'll probably have to wait a bit at the bar.  Don't whine; art takes time, and it is most assuredly worth it!  Speaking of bars, there's the small one on the main floor, and a somewhat larger one downstairs, so when your beverage of choice starts to run low, you can choose the shorter line.  Oh, and just to counter one of the complainers, I too had the Chadburn (actually, it was the first thing I ordered) - rum, port, pear liqueur, and mole bitters.  This drink is just as unique, complex, and sophisticated as it sounds.  I thought it was fucking brilliant!  Yes, it's unusual, but that's why you're in a fancy cocktail bar, and not ordering rum & coke's at some meat market.  Anyway, just had to give props to one of my favorite drinks of the night (and I had 4 myself, and sampled about 8 others).  Finally, one of the coolest things about tiki bars (or maybe it's just rum in general?) is that they just seem to make people happy.  Gin makes a man mean; Tequila makes ya crazy, but rum just makes everyone friendly.  I made a ton of friends while waiting for drinks with pretty much everyone around me.  Great bar.  Great feel.  Great drinks.  Hell yes, it's awesome.

0V4B8A4tNArJp8aqDYX4-Q.review_text: This has instantly become one of my top 3 bars in San Francisco.  We went on a Tuesday night so it wasn't very crowded. They have got an insanely sweet pirate theme, with water running down the walls, light up puffer fish lamps, and a huge anchor on the ceiling.  There are 3 levels to the bar, all small, but intricately decorated.  The bottom 2 floors have bars, while the top one is more of a hang out I like to call the crows nest. I would go here on a mellow night as I could see it being a problem if it gets crowded. Also I love that the entrance is just a black wall with small letters that say Smugglers Cove.

_FFLOTcMzMmqdnS0kKoUsw.review_text: "Yo-ho-yo-ho a pirate's life for me! With glasses of rum! A roomful of chums! I'm as happy as happy can be!"  So the fact I wrote a little song obviously means this place is amazeballs!    And yes, it totally feels like you're in Disneyland, but not in a bad way!  You're won over by a small, dark space full of people surrounding delicious drinks of rum!  How can you go wrong?  Plus you have such a nice and well-educated bartender to help guide you in the whirlwind of drinks to choose from... nice waiters who tell you not to eat the flaming sugar cubes unless you're dying of curiosity (which we were and we should've listened to him)...   The drinks:  5 of us tried a number of drinks and each other's.    Results:  None are bad, but really some are more amazing than others.  Yes, the drinks are a bit on the sweeter side (to me), but still delicious with crazy tiki presentation... the bartender used a whole orange peel just for my drink!  Yum on the Rum:  I promise to take better notes on my drinks... especially since I'm headed back in a week or so.  :)  All I can say is go for the barrel, since that's their specialty.  Why I like it: I like fake pirates.  I like that I can't think of another weird little bar like this.  I like that parking was shockingly easy in the area on a Sunday night.  I like that we happened to be hear around happy hour.  YO-HO, YO-HO!

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: It's like they took my beloved Forbidden Island, stacked the seating area on top of the bar, and turned the outdoor space into an underground tiki lair! And added really cute boys manning the door and bars and an adorable barback with an amazingly acute sense of hearing. The space and the doorboy were enough to bring me back again and again. Add to the equation some brilliant cocktails and this place is all set to be a HUGE hit.   I was fortunate enough to be Heidi's date to the much anticipated and highly-coveted soft opening over the weekend. Let me tell you: Jade will not be missed with this jewel of a bar/tiki lounge taking it's place. If you are looking to get drunk, it's not hard. Pace yourselves, friends: these drinks, much like myself, are beautiful but lethal. Just when you think you've never enjoyed such exquisite and delicate beauty in all your life...BAM! You've been knocked over the head and kicked in the groin. In the best way possible, of course. These drinks are patiently hand-crafted with love and the artists behind the bars take great pride in their handiwork. As such, you will need to be patient. Treasures such as these require a little extra time. If an impatient brat like me can do it, so can you. Breathe. Take the opportunity to drink that much-needed water between drinks.   Particularly noteworthy are the Blonde Parisian (now named the Blonde Autumn), the Hulekale-something, and the adorable man at the door (ahem). I will be back. Oh boy will I be back. The only thing I'd change is my length of stay- this is more than a bar. It's a destination.  Might I add that that awful chlorine stench we all became immune to back in the days of Jade is now noticeably absent. Whew! No inhaler necessary.

X5jK3nsGWe9uDJbWvTObSQ.review_text: Gorgeous inside.  Smart and friendly bartenders and staff.  Great specialty drinks and an amazing permanent menu. Each beverage is hand-crafted and the flavors are multilayered and lucious.  It will take a long time to get your drink, but be assured that the barkeeps are working at top speed to get you what you need.  A fun, educational (if you are interested in the history of rum and/or bars/cocktails in America, tiki-era lounge music, deviant art, etc.) and laid back place to get hammered.  ...and you will get hammered, intentionally or not. It's just one of those things that happens at the Cove.  However, do not go here if you are impatient, in a large group, have somewhere to be at a certain time, or just wanna get wasted with your bros, yo.  The magic of the Cove will be lost on you.

0Chi_CzoTmkw1NvZg0sksg.review_text: The what-neighborhood-is-this? vibe of the location (kind of Civic Center, kind of Western Addition, kind of Hayes Valley) is a good match for the how-did-I-get-on-a-ship's galley? feeling when you walk in the blacked out, nondescript doors.  I love the glowing cavern lighting and the three-tiered minglabity - the decor and planning is excellently thought out.  A little clean for a pirate themed place, but when you sample the drinks, you'll understand.  If this was Pirates of the Carribean, your rum&coke would be too sweet, and the ice would not be fancy.  Travesty, travesty.  The menu is prolific, if a bit heavy on the storytelling (thanks for the italicized ingredients, guys).  I had a tantalizing cocktail of allspice liquor, lemon, selzer, bitters, and (of course) rum.  A very special rum in fact.  If I remembered the name of it, I'd pass it along, because it was truly an inventive and delicious libation.  But then if I remembered the name of it, it wouldn't have been rum.  More impressive still, the bartender was the fastest, most proficient drink artist I'd ever seen, and he did it with panache and a smile.  Will I be back?  Absolutely.  Do I think people who call this place overrated are kind of jaded urban elitists?  I'm not going to answer that.

2HxQF9flaRc58XRp7BUY5g.review_text: I'm a huge fan of the concept, and rum in my drinks. The decor here is pretty cool as it has all kinds of pirate stuff on the walls. The menu does a good job telling you what are the house favorites and which ones have a little bit of kick in their drink. Looking from the outside, you would have no idea that this is a pirate-themed bar as there are no signs and the doors outside are blacked out.  Unfortunately, the execution left something to desire. While there are three levels to the bar, they are all really small. Coming here on a Saturday night, it got pretty crowded and it was difficult to move around. Not only that, but it was really stuffy in there. However, the cramped space may have been how pirate ships are, so I guess I can give them credit for being authentic. Drinks here cost anywhere from $8-$12 which is reasonable for San Francisco.  I can see myself liking this place a lot more if it wasn't so crowded. There are a bunch of drinks to choose from and try and maybe I'll come back and try more, especially by being a huge fan of rum.

LDDtUQkXaHBv0jySmViaPg.review_text: Arrr har har!  Every drink in this place is amazing, and not over priced considered how elaborate most of them are. Don't miss the hot buttered rum.  Be aware there is no food here at all.  There is a waterfall inside in the basement, and a upper balcony as well. It can feel pretty private even when the place is busy.

m_LqKx3ve3Ib-j1WnKVA7w.review_text: I love this place. It has taught me that a hot buttered rum is nothing short of heaven, and that every drinking experience is heightened by feeling like you're in a pirate ship.  On busy nights it takes a little bit to get your drink, but it'll be so delicious I doubt it will really matter that much. And there are three levels of the bar to explore, though on busy nights it doesn't change that fact that there's nowhere to sit. Still, let me get in on another one of those huge flaming volcano drinks and I'll sit on the floor. I don't care.

Wc6dVl-6a2TnE2Rwqon0vQ.review_text: The kitsch of the Tonga Room plus the cocktail sensibilities of Bourbon and Branch meet to form Smuggler's Cove.    Last night's soft open had some rough patches.  Service was very slow - bartender was all on her own; some dude was standing by her but not lifting a finger to help her (at least in the 29 minutes I was standing at the bar waiting for a drink...yes, 29. And there were only three people in front of me getting drinks.  I don't mind waiting for a quality cocktail but I'm not sure that this is a tenable arrangement).    Also, the poor thing was reading recipes off the computer for every single drink requested -- again, hopefully something that was unique to opening night.  Drinks:  the Three Dots and a Dash was spicy and delicious.  Really good.  The Sidewinder Fang was a little too astringent for my taste but will please those who like a pucker.   Everyone was raving about the Rum Barrel; will try that next time.   Great atmosphere on the top two floors; the basement area was a little less tightly conceived.   If they can make these great drinks just a bit faster -- this place will be a wonderful addition to SF's cocktail culture.

IRwBBig6UEaZOTuUVjhC8w.review_text: Smugglers has the highest quality tiki drinks you may ever find in your lifetime.  I went on a Thursday around 5:30... which was probably a good idea because there was a wait by the time i left around 7.   House made syrups, huge menu of tiki-ness, ridiculously awesome decor... Its obvious why this place is so highly rated.

vZnO_Cf6MLSz3ek-rVozPw.review_text: Bars with bouncers make me nervous.  I don't like 'em.  Not only do they exude an air of menace, there's also a certain haughtiness to them that make me both cringe and growl.  That said, the Smuggler's Cove was a clear exception to the usual rules.  The bouncer was friendly enough, no attitude, no hipster snobbery.  There's nothing I hate more than running across some two-year transplant who thinks he rules MY city just because he works at some trendy joint.  That was a major plus, just getting a smile at the door.  Very interesting decor...I like the water feature, comfortable seats, good lighting.  And personally, I LOVE the fact that the music is low enough for people to actually have conversations without yelling.  Overloud music is one of the banes of the bar scene, in my opinion...it's a cover for all the dingbat hipsters who really don't have anything interesting to say.    If you want a meat-market bar where ditzy chicks meet up with douchebags for meaningless flings, this is probably not the place.  I went with my husband, and most of the other people I saw were in mixed parties, so it feels more like a place where friends go to socialize with each other...not meet new people.  That's a major plus in my book.  But the DRINKS...oh my, the tasty beverages are what it's all about.  Yes, they take a while.  They're complicated, and the bartenders care that they're done right.  If you're in a hurry, go somewhere else.  These are drinks to be savored, not slammed.  I tried two: the Sorrel Punch, with hibiscus; and a Batida with passionfruit and coconut.  Both were yummy and pretty, and well worth the wait.  My only complaint is: no grub.  Not even a bowl of wasabi peas.  I don't know if the complications of hot food are worth it, but to me, tiki bars are more than just watering holes, you need FOOD.  Bowls of dry snacks, at least...maybe even happy hour pupus.  To really settle in and enjoy multiple rounds of drinks, you have to offset the booze with something solid, especially for the after work crowd.  Otherwise, after a couple of their amazing drinks, I have to go somewhere else to eat.  And I'd rather not leave.

9is4PUB0nOo0Tf6xGW_Y-A.review_text: Perfectly crafted cocktails served with attitude. Love the intimate setting of multiple levels. The vibe changes with the crowd. Two cocktails are my max there. Prices are in the $13 to $15 range but pours are very generous.  They also do a great job on the classic cocktail.  A must try if in SF.

nYXgSTJbcBl30yL8IF9FDQ.review_text: We went to Smuggler's Cove on a Monday night, so there weren't any lines for drinks and the crowds were not too large. The word "tiki bar" doesn't do this place justice: walk through the unassuming, secretive front door at 650 Gough Street and you feel like you've literally stepped onto a pirate ship, with ropes, barrels, and old rum bottles hanging from the ceiling. They most definitely stick to a theme in the decor. There are two bars, one on the ground floor and one on the lower level, as well as additional space upstairs on the mezzanine. Head to the downstairs bar (The Boathouse) and you actually feel like you're in the hull of a ship. They make over 70 different cocktails and have over 400 rums available in-house. For the non-rum-drinkers, there are other cocktails available as well. I enjoyed how they keep the music low and the total occupancy at just 49 people, giving it a more intimate feel and letting people enjoy their drinks and the atmosphere. I can see how on a Friday or Saturday night this place can get packed and the line for drinks can be long. I'll admit that I wasn't sure what to think of Smuggler's Cove based on reading its reviews, but once I got there I was pleasantly surprised. If you're looking for a fun bar to go to with a couple friends, check this place out.

wqPqpJaomgdB1sSP4abuKA.review_text: The bouncers here seriously ruin the experience. They are awful. AWFUL. You have to follow their rules to a T. For a bar that promotes people getting drunk as hell I have never seen someone have such a control episode. I really hope the managers read this and get new bouncers, otherwise I would highly advise avoiding this place, solely because the bouncers are fucking terrible. And I know I'm not alone in thinking so. Go ahead and read the other reviews how "nazi" the bouncers are. They kill any fun to be had.  Summary: bouncers suck. Bouncers suck so bad, I would avoid.

NjcoEe5bjVvGlGwjHXu0Kw.review_text: I hate waiting in line. If we were not the first people in line we would have left. If you share the same hate as I do I would recommend trying this place on an off night (Sun - Wed).   Once we were let in we managed to find a spot at the bar. This by far was the best seat in the house! Yes the drinks took forever and a day to make, but they were well worth the wait. So very tasty and fresh! Our favorites were the Mai Tai and the Smuggler's Rum Barrel. We also tried (and liked) the Jet Pilot, Kona Cocktail, Dark and Stormy, Pupule and Puka Punch.  We definitely plan to go back. But not on a weekend. Probably works best if you go with a small group or in a pair.

ACUVZ4SiN0gni7dzVDm9EQ.review_text: Yo ho, yo ho, a pirate's life for me. We pillage plunder, we rifle and loot. Drink up me 'earties, yo ho. We kidnap and ravage and don't give a hoot. Drink up me 'earties, yo ho.  Yo ho, yo ho, a pirate's life for me. We extort and pilfer, we filch and sack. Drink up me 'earties, yo ho. Maraud and embezzle and even highjack. Drink up me 'earties, yo ho.  Yo ho, yo ho, a pirate's life for me. We kindle and char and in flame and ignite. Drink up me 'earties, yo ho. We burn up the city, we're really a fright. Drink up me 'earties, yo ho.  We're rascals and scoundrels, we're villians and knaves. Drink up me 'earties, yo ho. We're devils and black sheep, we're really bad eggs. Drink up me 'earties, yo ho.  We're beggars and blighters and ne'er do-well cads, Drink up me 'earties, yo ho. Aye, but we're loved by our mommies and dads, Drink up me 'earties, yo ho. Yo ho, yo ho, a pirate's life for me.  I wish I could remember all the words to this song when I've had a few of the magical rum concoctions the bartenders make here and I really want to be obnoxious and sing it.  If you don't like rum, I suggest you do not go here because I'm not sure they have any other drinks. And really, it's a RUM bar people. Also, these are serious cocktails so be prepared to wait for a bit for your drink. They are crafted carefully and with love.  I agree with Colleen B though, music would be an excellent addition. Perhaps songs about pirates? I know an excellent one...

cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg.review_text: We headed out to Smuggler's Cove during a night where it should've been Snuggler's Cove. (Yes, thank you, I'll be here all night.)  But seriously, it was so crammed in there, we couldn't get an order in until 20 minutes later. And that's only because the bartender noticed my very-tall date, handed him a menu, and then came around the bar to take our order IN THE MIDST OF THE MADNESS. If you don't call that amazing service (well, to us), I can't help you there.  The place is quite large and entirely themed; sorta pirate-y, sorta tiki-y, loads of awesome. It's the Pirates of the Caribbean ride at Disneyland, without the water, but with delicious booze. Their menu's massive, but entirely impressive. Each cocktail was beautifully crafted with a lovely garnish (you'll need to check your macho ego at the door, because, yes, your drink may come with a flower).  When we finally snagged a couple of seats at the bar, we chatted it up with the bartenders (super friendly) and learned a bit more about rum. Fascinating stuff, really. Or maybe it was fascinating because we'd had three cocktails a piece?  Prices: a pretty penny, but certainly worth it. Service: fantastic. Beverages: an experience, really.

FjSwrlcU3ZSvcohOxUCtyg.review_text: Really amazing drinks. Arguably the best, fun cocktail place in SF. If you're looking to get fancy, Local Edition and Bourbon&Branch have you covered. If you want super high-quality cocktails in a themed and quirkier atmosphere (there's a wishing pool here! And a small river!), can't go wrong with this place.  Get the Volcano, it's a scorpion-bowl style drink. There's explosive fireballs involved. Good for show, great for a party.  I'm docking a star because the service is nonexistent. You'd better come with a group of good friends, because the staff here is kind of a drag. Look man, I understand that bouncers have to be aggressive to do their job, but this guy kept running around the bar and ordered us to move around throughout the night, and not kindly either. Pretty unpleasant interactions. The bartender? Don't ask for a recommendation. It's fascinating to watch him at work, but he will not be answering any questions for you. If you do, he'll throw a menu at you and tell you to figure it out yourself.  All-in-all, great venue to have fun and have some delicious drinks (my personal favorite is the rum flip, a "spiritous" rum drink with whipped egg whites, one I LOVED and want to try making by myself), but don't come here looking for the friendliest customer service.

AE3e8Jbb-wmkgEvWsKnQ7w.review_text: Came here with a large group of friends the place was amazing.  Pretty packed but really enjoyed the upstairs area.  Had a few of the bowls which were pretty pricey compared to other bars but the drinks were very tasty and we all got pretty tipsy.  The bartenders all seemed super chill and laid back which is the best.  Would definitely  come back again for some cocktails.  I think it's probably a good weekday bar we came on a Wednesday, I don't know if I would attempt it ever on a weekend as it's a pretty small place.

9FOrsYpBwOIHvTzqBpe0Qw.review_text: A great spot to make a regular day a little more special. It was my birthday and I was looking to step up this low key Monday. The bartenders here poured me up a variety of the Happy Hour punches and made lil' ol me feel special.  Definitely looking forward to a return visit.

2XgvN35TRQdFsYV0njVM6A.review_text: Small place. But the drinks are dope. The atmosphere is dope. Bartenders are friendly. Only drawback is when it's really crowded it gets stuffy and it's hard to get a cocktail. Overall an awesome place.

7A8G5qjqGNAZoTve-bsDPw.review_text: Drinks and venue are cool and the bartenders are nice but the lone bouncer was a dick that seemed like he had small bouncer complex. We had a group of 5 with 1 person lagging behind and he was forced to wait outside. The bouncer claimed there was a huge group around the bar, but really there was almost no one there. Maybe 6 around the bar waiting on drinks? People were leaving the whole time the guy was waiting too. Bouncer should figure it out

hWSwFpGV6cqbyJ9zlHNNyQ.review_text: Do you want to get swept up into a magical world that imbibes feelings of warm caribbean beaches and mysteries of old expeditions lost to Davy Jones himself to start your evening? Are you a pirate? Well, rest your seafaring feet here and enjoy one of their hundreds of different rums. And if you don't fancy rum, then it'll be the plank for you.   Side note: participation in the rumbustion society is not exactly welcome on weekend nights.

WT-aoKxcDePQrwqnI2aWBA.review_text: Avast Ye! This here Smugger's Cove is quite an interesting place. We decided to cast our anchor here after a nice dinner out in the city. This bar is definitely unique and there are not many alike! This bar offers 3 floors of pure pirate and open seas decor and their extravagant drink menu is a journey into the abyss itself!   The atmosphere was more chill than normal bars and the drinks were definitely interesting, albeit a bit overpriced. The drinks come in a large skull cup to share with a party of 3-4, or more if you want (See my posted picture). They also light the drink on fire so that added a nice touch. Although we did have to wait about 20 minutes to get in so the bar is a bit small. Overall, their selection in drinks is worth exploring and if you've never been here, you should at least check it out with your friends once!   Pros: -Nice theme and decor. -Chill atmosphere. -Huge selection of unique drinks.  Cons: -Over priced. -Limited space. -Hard to find, no signs on the outside.   Though, while inside, it does make you want to sail the 7 seas and find your pirate's booty! Haha  You know what they say, "Time flies when you're having rum!"

-8JWmF9DSl7EFK0u-FuSVQ.review_text: Unless you can still handle overly sugary, crappy, low quality drinks like the girls with Fake ID's in front of us, this place is not for you. I thought the drinks were VERY expensive for basically using well alcohol. The thing they light on fire may be the worst, most sugary, disgusting thing I have ever tasted and once in college I took shots of Midori!   Also, it was Freezing and there was a line? It felt very artificially created- the line- as people would leave and they would not let anyone in. Also, it was pretty empty inside. I would never wait in line at a bar but our friends were already inside.  Anyway, I guess I'm just too old to be able to wait in line, drink sugary, head ache inducing,  over priced drinks and still feel good about myself.

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: Smuggler's Cove is kind of funny because it's such an exceedingly serious rum bar with a detailed menu, complicated drinks, and highly professional bartenders. On the other hand it's every bit as campy as the pirates of the carribean ride at disneyland if not more so.   There's a clear disconnect between these two things that make it a pretty unusual and unique place but if that's not your thing go for the drinks because they're great.

eA5i8ETSww-M5TSYh87QZw.review_text: Definitely need to come back with a bigger group. Only 2 of us were drinking here on a Wednesday night and we were surprised there was a line outside at 10pm!    Awesome tiki bar vibe. Although lower key than DTD's Enchanted Tiki Bar of special Disney effects, Smuggler's Cove has more character than Trader Sam's in the Richmond. There's water trickling down a wall and cool seaside decor everywhere. 2 bars, 3 "floors" (one is an additional seating area that overlooks the main floor), and just enough space to snuggly move about.   Extensive drink menu! It took us a while to go through the whole thing. There seems to be only one drink good for a group (4 people) and that was the Volcano. But since we were just getting individual drinks, I decided on the-  HIBISCUS RUM PUNCH ($9) Was quite weak. It tasted mostly like hibiscus iced tea. Kinda tart, kinda watered down. But it did come with this edible hibiscus flower and THAT was delicious. First time I ate a flower and it was ah-may-zing. Gotta hit up a Trader Joe's or Whole Foods to find me some hibiscus!   P.S. I have a thing for tiki bars (:

ELRYFqdbmq7WU3TattYi2A.review_text: Their cocktails here are comparable to Bourbon and Branch. Must try: gin passionfruit lemon cocktail if you want something different from your usual. I thought this place would be bigger than it really is by looking at the pics. Best place to sit is the bar area from the front door. Very friendly and attentive bartender.

5jLkKtE4HPlrbjw-0w9lvg.review_text: I'm pretty sure Smuggler's Cove could covert any tiki non-believer. 1.) the drinks really are pretty stellar 2.) the staff is super friendly and 3.) the decor is as awesome on the inside as the exterior is nondescript. Don't let that simple black glass front fool you - there's a world of tiki goodness inside.

Y3u-FdtcM86GtsWA6mrnuw.review_text: Avast Ye!   If thar be a finer house where salty dogs can warm their souls with the best rums I know it not.   Ye cocktails are the stuff what legends are made.  Ye vault be filled with more treasures than Morgan's chest.   Ye barkeeps be more skilled than a Jack-tar on a whaler.   Belly-aching landlubbers wouldn't know a fine spirit if it crept out of their breast.   I give ye all the constellations needed to chart a course for Smuggler's Cove!

Tk5UbqJmpu1GCdR07m1aJQ.review_text: One star for the pirate ship theme. Otherwise, this place blows. The bartender was rude, environment was stale and drinks were super expensive (I got charged $3 for a non-alcoholic glass of pineapple soda). Call me a cheapass, but their kitschy decor does not warrant their upscale prices. One big YAWNN for Smuggler's Cove.

mQM4K216Uf71Gaz1RoDjkg.review_text: I confess that don't generally seek out tiki bars, unless I'm lucky enough to be in some tropical locale (which is sadly not often enough). But this place transcends tiki. I remember reading that some magazine recently named it to its Best Bars in America list, and it's easy to understand why.   I mean, they should post warning signs: the cocktails are *dangerously* good. They are so delicious that they just disappear. And they are so refreshing that of course you'll have another.....But be very careful, because they are so balanced it's easy not to realize how potent they are.   Damn, these guys know how to mix a drink.   I like the downstairs room, it's cozy and dark with a little bar right there. It's incredible how much variety and selection they offer in such as small space.

Znid_azpcHmdRMHGicmkWA.review_text: Yes I am a fan! I went here last night to check it out in hopes of having another place for me and my ladies to enjoy and within 10 mins I was texting them to have a happy hour there soon! FYI-the outside looks a bit deceiving as there is no big sign outside, the windows are tinted black and the words SMUGGLERS COVE is on the door but small. But its all good because once you step inside you forget about it.  The bar on the ground floor is small, actually the whole bar is kind of small but there are three levels.  On the first floor there is a semi waterfall, and the whole ambiance makes me feel like I stepped onto the set of Pirates of the Carribean.  But the great part of it is its not tacky. There's enough decor to make you feel like your somewhere else but not over done like some island themed party.  I decided to head downstairs as it was crowded at the main bar. The downstairs has its own bar which was managed by Patrick, the friendliest bar keeper there is...Thank you to Patrick and Ben (a regular I take it) for making my first visit enjoyable.  Patrick not only made the most "AMAZING" drinks but he was very pleasant. I had the AKU AKU which was fruity and the liquor was not overpowering. I also had the Painkiller and that was defintely something different and worth trying.  Although I suggest you take it easy after this drink as it is pretty dayam strong!

E7QxNi02-JEtcuyWFyqt-Q.review_text: The common man's Tonga Room. Great bartenders put on a show with drinks they light on fire. If I lived in the neighborhood I would be a regular! The only thing missing was music, but it still had a fun and boisterous atmosphere. Can't wait to come back!

_vICwzBkH4B02S9xneFVLA.review_text: A fun gem hidden behind an unassuming tinted glass door. Steve the bartender and Martin the owner were both awesome to chat with, they were extremely informed with All the tons of Rums I've never seen before.

806piRS5Ueod_7oNHQDW-Q.review_text: SECRET TIKI BAR! With a heavy dose of rum history and education, which I loved. I visited late on a Sunday and our group had plenty of room, but I hear it gets packed. If I lived nearby, I would probably drop in after work once a week to try a different historical cocktail until I knew all about various rum drinks from various rum locales and they awarded me an honorary PhD in Rumdrinkology.   PS. Painkiller #4; it's good for what ails ya. Trust me.

c24niAEMJmgne4UflTS_mA.review_text: this place is great place for amazing drinks, great atmosphere, and a good time.  Great to bring people out of town that want to see a different side of SF.   but I suggest to get here early, there is always a wait outside.

AT6NwNkLKxgW2fsQGNs-gA.review_text: When I first discovered this tiki post/pirate ship, masquerading as a non-descript office building in the middle of a dead block, I nearly piddled my pants. For those who pass between its red and green lanterns (your only visual tip-off that you've arrived), it is an oasis of exotic drinkies. Rums are their specialty, but you do have other options. The drink menu itself reads like a tattered paperback you're fairly certain your Mommy wouldn't approve of you knowing about. And while it can take a while from drink order to actual sipping, you'll soon be asking, "What wait?" They are artisans, and the proof is in your glass. Monday nights are excellent if you want to check things out sans the annoying throngs.

2hLupOq7hj7t3yVGSaZueQ.review_text: Best Dark 'n Stormy in the city. Their group "skull" drinks (serves ~4 people) are pretty epic.

sbYi3ulmwy2nZx_VjC_tBg.review_text: The brilliance and deliciousness of their bevs balance any unwanted kitsch, which is pretty minimal, all things considered, and in my opinion, not at all unwanted. Theses are the only cocktails I've found worth their weight and the wait (I can make a damn good Manhattan myself, thank you very much, Bourbon and Branch, but perhaps not a Painkiller). Speaking of which, Painkiller 4 is what I'd have if I sat on death row.

EEBcB3Sm8LDASwBeu8UKsA.review_text: Really, really good straight rum.    Only had one mixed drink here and it was good, but a bit on the sweet side.  Place is very small and very Pirates of the Caribbean (the ride).

2dogBMa9fSKKDHifcOVoyA.review_text: Cute n' Cozy!  The decor and ambiance is so well themed, you'll think you were really in a smuggler's cove in the Caribbeans.. after a few Pain Killers or if you have the Volcano drink that serves four all to yourself, you will believe you were.  Great rum drinks! Rum is a personal preference of spirit, simply because it reminds me of the tropics and the nonchalant demeanor of pirates-- though they do act with purpose when they have one. And just like them, these drinks go down carrying a purpose... to inebriate your A--.  This spot offers three cozy floors and two bars with cocktail waitresses (least on weekend nights).  Staff-- friendly, informative, and knowledgeable.  Have your IDs out and ready because there is a doorman. The times I've been there, he was quite inconspicuous but have no fear, if you cannot find him, he'll find you.  Drinks are quite unique, average $12/13 per cocktail.. I think. Not entirely confident as I was gradually entering the pleasant purpose of blur with their rum concoctions.  Will be back and they do accept CC!

GO1y1duHFo-AaS4RiLMKDQ.review_text: Uhhhhhh okay. I'll be honest: I don't know what the big deal is. I think it's just okay.  They do have some really legit drinks here. All of their rum drinks are spot on. If you come here, you come here for the rum. I had this warm butterscotch-ey rum drink... I forget the name, but it was great. Really delicious and creative.  Why I don't like this place:  - the wait isn't worth it. There are a million other bars in Hayes Valley that have good drinks. I feel like you come here once to experience it, but after that there really isn't any point - I hate tiki bars. I'm biased, I'll admit it. - tiki bar aside, the ambiance is kind of not my thing. It's this dark, dirty pirate tiki bar. I like dark and dirty, but mixed with the kitsch pirate theme... ugh barf. No thank you.   Come here for the experience once. Experience it. Then go back to your favorite bars and just chill there.

1qcq_VTO9fYIslCUwudlOA.review_text: I'm not much of a Rum drinking at all but I have to say this place rocks the rock.  All fresh ingredients added to your beverage of choice.  I had the pain killer with my friend.  Wow it was so tasty.  I love the fresh nutmeg, adds a lot of flavor.

RndtjBHm41mIisU-oGeV1A.review_text: Came here at 10pm and waited 30 minutes to get in. This place is TINY, but the drinks are so good. They're known for their punches and rum-based drinks. I'm not a huge fan of super sweet drinks, so I went for their famous hot buttered rum.   I definitely recommend the hot buttered rum. Even though it's going to make me fat, I'll run the extra 5 miles to burn it off =) so good. It reminds me of Harry Potter! I can see myself ordering this at Hogsmead on a cold wintery day.
