IU-7eZMf_qc6T3ILdsylMQ.review_text: Have you ever been to Disneyland, gotten hammered in the parking lot or in Downtown Disney - entered the park and ridden on Pirates of the Carrabian?   No!?  Well my friend - you have not lived (nor have you scared a bunch of small children)  I admit I was already a bit drunk when i arrived but not intoxicated enough to not realize I had wandered into an amazing little bar.  There seems to be three stories (we stayed on the main level) and the bar is decked out like a pirates cove, complete with a huge anchor, puffer fish lights and swashbucklers.  The drink we had was ridiculously strong and really sort of pushed our team over the edge for the afternoon - but it was tasty too!  I'll be back

f0UBxoEUlA0CcNz5yW8d3A.review_text: My first thought when I walked in was "This place looks like Disneyland!!!" The decorations are awesome; it totally looks like Pirates of the Caribbean. We arrived around 11 PM on a Saturday night, and I was worried about having to wait to get in because I had read online that their capacity is only 49 people. But we were able to go right in after just a few minutes. The bouncer was super friendly and even ended up buying one of my friends a drink later on in the night.   The drinks were delicious and pretty strong. There were so many to choose from! A few were even topped with an edible hibiscus flower, which tasted like candy, yum! Some of the guys complained that their drinks were a little too sweet, but really, what do you expect when you order a fruity drink filled with tropical fruit juices? In any case, I thought the place was great! I'll definitely return, though with the decorations and fancier, pricier drinks, it's more of a once-in-a-while experience than a regular hangout spot.

gZmEZvZwLJH7JiQfIdbkRQ.review_text: My homie n I stopped by here to meet with a couple girls and have a drink before heading off to party. We almost walked right past the joint bc there were no signs or lights out front that read "Smuggler's Cove" or at least words like "cocktails" or "bar", so you gotta keep your eyes sharp to spot this place. There might be a doorman hanging outside. That should help.  I stepped inside and felt like I was at the Krusty Krab (you know, where Sponge Bob Squarepants works?), but instead of Krabby Patties, it's hella booze. And it's dark inside. And people were getting wasted. We had a drink and bounced.

KVfZRTxbgzAfShWWneOqFQ.review_text: I'm not normally a fan of fancy cocktails but damn, that puka punch is a delight. It feels like disneyland inside, in a good way, and the drinks are strong and good for sharing.

0dhxd1e1Cnywc-On6y2Xfw.review_text: We wound up here already about 2.5 sheets, and this place and the friendly patrons and bartenders did nothing but help us on our journey to 3. The basement has a very cool vibe.  I'm not even a fan of sugary, tiki drinks, but I could hang out there, just drinking beer and being jovial with random people. The girl had a number of sweet drinks, but the one that sticks with me is the hot buttered rum, of which, I had a sip.  It tasted like "Christmas in my mouth," or something involving my mouth and Santa.  Again, we were all very blurry at this point.  As Eric Wright would say, "Don't quote me boy, cuz I ain't sayin sh**." The staff and the clientele here are very friendly.  For tiki bar enthusiasts, it's a place to seek out.  For others just looking for a cool place to hang out, I'd recommend it highly.

9OyPEDQ0N6i0rWv9S-XjgQ.review_text: I give Smuggler's Cove 5 stars with one caveat: come early or come on a weekday. It's a small place that get's very crowded. There's often a long line outside waiting to get in on weekends and Thursday nights.   That said, this place is really worth checking out. If possible, imagine a tiki bar but classy...I promise, it's possible. There's a subtle waterfall by the stairs and stone protruding from the wall. I remember the bartender once telling me that there are something like 75 types of rum and 200 specialty rum cocktails. I might have made up those numbers, but there are a lot. They also have fire-spouting volcano drinks that are fun to share with a couple friends. You'll end up spending a good $10-$14 per drink, but this place is worth it every once in a while!  Oh, and don't be deterred by the fact that there is not a large sign marking the entrance. Look for the two lights  - one red one green - on either side of the door.

FN9GBf0qq5Bd2kDnIBh90w.review_text: i love this little gemstone! from the outside, looks like a whole lot of nothing. also, there is quite a line sometimes.  the inside is a pirate explosion! so much fun, lots to explore (3 different levels). the menu is probably one of the best parts. a cheat sheet for which drinks are stronger, the 'favorites' and little descriptions of each.  there's even an inside little water pool/fountain downstairs!!! wasn't kanye west here once too?

vE3W5fwpUrJN4cbg2v6JsA.review_text: I love the pirates theme and the place is really cozy... and by cozy I mean pretty small. If you've got a group of 4+, and have a table, you should consider getting a "volcano" which is a giant rum punch bowl. Lots of fun for the group!  My only dislikes of the place is how there's always been a line up outside when you go on the weekends and how "cozy" it is. Other than that, service was friendly and prompt at the upstairs bar.

GBkSuO6Z9ccXol95Y1_2LQ.review_text: This place is absolutely amazing. They have an immensely large selection of cocktails to choose from and on over the top tiki bar themed ambiance. On the weekends the place can get pretty busy but they're good about limiting the amount of guests such that the wait is never toooo long for a drink. Definitely an SF type of place with good prices and even better drinks. They have a crazy rum collection but I'm more of a gin or tequila person and the bartender whipped up one of the best gin cocktails I've ever had. highly recommend for anyone looking for a unique atmosphere and creative drinks.

nxU-UaeP6wvhJ1Cjaiq0TA.review_text: This place was neat.  We were there for a friend's birthday and the ship wreck decor was very amusing.  I'm giving it only three stars for two reasons.  First,  I guess I'm getting old and I like to be able to hear the person sitting next to me.  The music here made this nearly impossible.  Though I'm sure it didn't help that both upstairs and downstairs (we were in the latter) were pretty small so even conversation seemed loud...or maybe it was just because people were trying to talk over the music...just thinking about it makes me ears ring.  Second reason is that they ONLY serve cocktails.  No beer or wine and the cocktails are very pricey.  The first drink I got was something like a Chi Chi (they don't have their menu online so I couldn't look up the exact name) and it was 60% ice.  It was delicious, but four sips and my drink was gone.  I'm not exaggerating.  Seriously.  And it cost $9.   Second drink was the puka punch, which was better but still not worth $14 plus tip.    So basically if you love expensive crazy, mostly rum based, cocktails in an under the sea ship wreck type of setting then this is the bar for you!  Otherwise, maybe head to a bar in North Beach...that's what we did.

ZDXi_G8UfnjkTlkbDas42w.review_text: Smuggler's Cove is one of the most interesting bars in SF by far. Great theme and social atmosphere! I've never really been a big rum goer, but their drinks are amazing.   The size of the bar is a bit on the smaller side and can easily get overcrowded, but definitely worth it if you're looking for something different and exotic.  Try and find the hidden skulls throughout the bar. Apparently there are 5. I was only able to find 2. Thought that was kind of a cool challenge.  The bar gets 5 stars from me despite the small size issue. I had a phenomenal experience and plan on returning for more rum-filled adventures.

viJ6kz7orqjlI_0G1MaVZA.review_text: This place can get REALLY pricy...especially when you gun for their Rumbustion Society.  All told, you will spend well over $2000+ to complete the list.  Crafty gimmick to get you to spend your dough on a lot of rums you probably won't like at all.  And we totally miss the one way mirror in the restroom...

SnyeyN7UhDtupp1N3KVfxw.review_text: We can't wait to come back!  A fabulous take on the popular tiki bar, with a pirate twist.  Come a little early and secure some seating downstairs much like being inside a ship.  There is a second bartender downstairs so the drinks can keep coming.  Love the smuggler's barrel.  This place has the feel and drama to it like being inside the Tonga Room, but the drinks are delectable like Forbidden Island.

3cnIyELXdZa9C9nFH5NXtg.review_text: Came here last night as our last stop during a happy hour that just kept going...From the red and green floodlights that are really the only indication from the street that there is something here, you don't feel like there is much to expect.  However, once inside, you enter a world of swashbuckling drinking happiness.  The pirate theme is well done, but not over done.  The drinks are pretty effin good, but a bit on the pricey side.  Definitley get the Scorpion bowl, but be careful, you and your group will burn through one in no time flat...argggggh!  I would have given the drinks alone 4 stars, but I had to knock a star off because the place is to cramped...hard to find a table to sit and get a bowl on.  Also its pretty pricey, even for SF standards.  A scorpion bowl is $36.  Otherwise the place is amazing!

g-oxsda0wMjKgIoXXrZlQA.review_text: The Good:  Their Rum drinks are awesome.     The Bad:  The crowd is so so.  Think Marina crowd that wanted to go "slumming" for a night.  Also $11 per drink is too much.    The Ugly:  The inside looks like their marketing to 12 year old Peter Pan fanatics.  Got it...rum is your thing...pirates, beaches, ships, etc...not necessary.  Although it would be pretty awesome to see the bar tenders try to make drinks with a hook hand.  They do that and I'll forgive the cheese ball decor.

GzMGpRigknVrlXg20vYEzA.review_text: LOVE this place. A great little hidden location in the hayes valley. You walk in and feel like you just stepped into a scene from the Pirates of the Caribbean...(minus Johnny Depp). Try their Puka Punch. It's so good it's almost dangerous. You might actually think you're standing next to Johnny Depp after a couple of these.

ocv-VFMpn5i2Q6w5aVulug.review_text: Pirate bar theme was pretty cool, was expecting a little more excitement, like costumes at least. Bartenders weren't very exciting, however the drink menu was pretty awesome! Huge selection of specialty drinks.   We spent most of our time downstairs, which was pretty crowded and stuffy, the walls were pretty low so it was very loud, since the space was limited. it did seem the upstairs was also crowded but less stuffy & loud.

j_xdpXxPdSVhlwTJ7roKag.review_text: These guys know their cocktails.  The menu is huge and, after a couple of drinks, I couldn't decide on a third.  For the first round, I went with the 27 Swizzle and for the second, the Port Royal.  I loved both of them but how could I not try more?    Before I asked the bartender for help with my choice, I was considering the 3 Dots and a Dash but I just couldn't commit.   Once I asked, he said, "Let's see, first you had the 27 Swizzle and then the Port Royal.  3 Dots and a Dash."  Wow, he really hit the nail on the head.  The fact that he even remembered what I had was impressive.  That he was able to pull that one cocktail, out of all the others, off the top of his head and know exactly what I would like was amazing.  Not to mention that he was the only bartender on that night in a reasonably busy bar.  He owned that place!  I love tiki and I really love this place.  I think it's now officially my favorite in San Francisco.  Plan to see me there, probably rotating floors to mix it up a bit.

w6SaPljfM2KfW9guNXCkGA.review_text: On back-to-back nights I went two places that I was pretty pumped about.  Both have great reviews on yelp and seem to be the topic of conversation frequently.  One disappointed, one exceeded my wildest expectations!    Now, it probably doesn't hurt that I was about 3 drinks deep when I wandered into this Pirate-y haven... but really!  What's not to love about this place?    I got here about 8:30 on a Friday night and while there as a good crowd, there was not yet a one-in-one-out policy (as I hear sometimes happens on weekend nights). After a good 30 minutes of hovering, my group was able to score a table.    I spent forever pursuing the extensive menu.  Too many good options.  To be honest I am not sure exactly which ones we tried, but they were all delish.  Yes they take a long time to make, but I watched the bartender blend big fresh chunks of pineapple for my drink!  Worth the wait if you ask me.

_NapVMwIlOzAsTvIdDs-JA.review_text: So we arrive at 6 pm on a Tuesday night and are told to wait in line. My two friends and I are surprised as its 6 pm, on Tuesday, and our boyfriends are inside and didn't mention the line.  The bouncer tells us they have a 49 person strict capacity so we will have to wait until someone comes out to be let in.  10 min go by AND THEN a suit in the back of the line is let in because his other old suited buddy comes out to get him.  The bouncer then gets very spicy and tells us that that guy had already been inside (false from our in-line conversations with him) and had a drink and I seat waiting for him. Well we pipe up that we have drinks and seats waiting for us inside, and he just ignores us and tells us to get over it. Instead we realize this is a bar, in SF on a Tuesday evening and it cannot be worth all this BS so we text our friends inside and wait for them to meet us at the dive bar down the street.  Report from inside: Boy says the cocktails are good but expensive. Because each one is a handcrafted specialty they take some time to make, and because each of the two bars only had one bartender it took 30-40 minutes to place and get your order at the bar. Ambiance is cool, but overall not worth the BS  Bottom line: try again in a month when the hype has died down and they hire a few more bartenders.

R1G07rJnf-nl4Vm8kXsfKQ.review_text: I have been wanting to go here for a while, and I must say this place does not disappoint!  We arrived on a Saturday night, and it was not as busy as we expected at 9:00. We waited probably only 25 minutes. When we finally got in, the bar was pretty packed. There is a street level bar and a downstairs bar (which was too packed to visit). The menu is full of rum based drinks, and we had a hard time choosing drinks (I am not too familiar with rum). She had the Kona Cocktail which was smaller than expected, but pretty with a flower in it. Sweet, but not too sugary. I had the Demerera Dry Float, which I enjoyed, but it was very dry.   My only complaint would be that there is very limited space, and empty glasses everywhere (I'm not sure there are any waitstaff. But hey, its a bar. A pirate themed bar! Its supposed to be messy.  Overall the bar had an awesome vibe and I cannot wait to bring my friends! It was awesome watching the bartender/mixologist making 6 drinks at the same time. The drinks are very well worth the price, and despite all of the alcohol, you don't get any strong alcohol flavors (a good thing). On their website, they have an option for you to take tasting notes (a big plus) so that you can work your way through their menu and remember what you enjoyed!   Ill be back!

2ojO4ZImtGy71cMqoKgOQw.review_text: This place could be realllllllllly lethal.  There are so many fun drink combos, you want to try them all!  And the décor?  way cute.  Watch out on those stairs though and bring your $$$.

lgj3ly7nzjsWy9UmK1JKBg.review_text: Smugglers cove is one of my fav spots for a chill night (aka when I don't feel like clubbing). As many other reviewers have noted, there's a large selection of drinks and they all taste good. Caution: it takes 5 min to decide what to order and 5 min to get a bartenders attention.   Sometimes there is a wait to get into the bar. It's two floors and they don't like to pack people in here.   Painkiller 2 is bomb if you like sweet drinks and coconut. I think I also had the kona one, which is not loaded with ice. Lots of their drinks have a ton of ice that take up space in the cup.   4 stars cuz I like it but I'm not omg about it. Moving out of hayes so that will be a test to see if I rerun regularly.

94htq_sEsmtixHP48rlEbA.review_text: I really wanted to like this place.   The decor is fun, however a bit Disneyfied and overly polished.    The drink selection is beyond impressive, I had no idea that rum could be mixed in so many deliciously different ways! The bartenders have great skill in mixing up the complex drinks with finesse and skill.    However, therein lies the problem with the Smuggler's Cove. The drinks are complicated and in high demand but there simply aren't enough bartenders to meet the demand.  Waiting 20 minutes (no exaggeration) standing at the bar and separated from my party to place an order was a major buzzkill for the night.    For the Smuggler's Cove to be an enjoyable experience it either needs to hire a second bartender for each of its bars or hire waitstaff to take your order, or a combination of both.  Until then, I'd rather walk the plank than return to the Cove.

3IOwbGxS_SUvNzZDVvEP4A.review_text: I love this bar. I do not love the bouncer, but since he seems both impervious to booze and boobs, I won't say anymore than that.    Large groups beware! Unless you get there early, you'll definitely have to wait outside on a weekend.   I think the drinks are better made on the ground floor level, but the lower level has more room for groups.  It's not exactly a place for people watching; the best show is definitely at the bar, especially when people order the flaming bowl drinks!   This definitely one of my favorite places in San Francisco.

GqzoKYXv6F1O85bhywyoSA.review_text: AHOY MATE!  I love different themed-bars, especially Smuggler's Cove.  The name says it all.   Came here around 8:30pm and the place was pretty packed already.  A couple kindly enough gave up their table for our party of 4 since we ordered the volcano that needed a flat surface.  Volcano serves 4 people at around $34.  Not bad considering it is a good amount.  I was excited to see the flames and the prep that the bartender showed us at our table.  This was one of the reasons why we made a pit stop here before going home back to the bay!  Very cool pirate decor.  3 level bar, with tables mainly upstairs and downstairs.  Middle floor is bar area mainly.  Pretty small but awesome place to hang out!

znOdqgvAO8-YV3vo2McFKQ.review_text: Wow, just an amazing experience. I lucked out and got preview tickets for December 5th. I went with three of my friends. They limited the number of tickets available to ensure that it wasn't too crowded and the bartenders would be able to give each drink their full attention.  The entire place is visually stunning. The decor is less tiki-oriented than some people might expect, but there are many artifacts lining the walls that have come from historic Bay Area tiki bars like Trader Vic's. There are three bars, one on each level, so if the bar you are at is crowded, try one of the others. It's not a huge space, so I'm glad they are limiting the number of patrons allowed at once - this reduces the time you spend waiting for your drink.   The cocktails - what can I say that hasn't been said already? Each one is prepared by hand, with fresh ingredients. Every single one I tried was well-balanced and delicious, with some intriguing flavors; well worth the price. While they did take 5-10 minutes to make, they are well worth the wait. I'm sure as the bartenders get more comfortable making them, the wait time will decrease.  Overall, I'm giving Smuggler's Cove the full five stars. It lived up to all my expectations, and in the case of the drinks, surpassed them. If you appreciate quality cocktails served in a South Seas atmosphere, you will not be disappointed.

0I75pBnKohLcbrbohgMZwQ.review_text: I love Tiki bars and was excited to go to Smuggler's Cove, which is conveniently located two blocks from my sister's house. It was around 10 on a Saturday so I wasn't surprised to find a line of people waiting to get in and we waited 15-20 minutes but the guy managing the line was friendly and pleasant. Ok, we finally got in and I thought the hardest part was behind us but no. The space is small and it was packed to the point of discomfort with people jostling for drinks at both bars. The bartender overcharged us for our drinks (either that or the prices on the drink menu are out of date) and it took almost as long to get them as it did waiting in line. Once I got my Jamaican Planters Punch, it was strong and refreshing but we couldn't really find any personal space and I was eager to go once we finished our first round drinks. It's great for the owners of Smuggler's Cove that the place is so popular but maybe they should think about a larger space to accommodate the hordes of people waiting to get in. Personally, I think that Tiki bars should be relaxing and this place stressed me out.

2v3YdCK-2l7OjUSK2iR71w.review_text: I will NEVER go here again. I arrived at 6pm and waited about 45 minutes for my ice-filled, over priced, hardly alcoholic drink. By the time I was ready to order drink #2, we were told that we had to go stand in line and get our drinks and names on some list.  The "bartender" was continually looking up drinks on the computer. I understand that they have a lengthy drink menu but, when you look up THE SAME cocktail ten times in a row, perhaps you should re-think your profession. Said bartender was a serious hot mess. She couldn't remember a drink's contents for the life of her, it took her nearly thirty minutes to get drinks out, and she couldn't handle the concept of "I'm paying for these two, she's paying for that one". The only reason I'd ever return would be to get a glimpse of the sexpot that's working the door. I was amazed to read that people would wait in line for this shit show of a place. Ugh, what fools.

nUe-50eAcvv4dXZJzuYzEw.review_text: Trip 1: 5 STARS. We came for a drink before having dinner nearby. We had 3 drinks in total. Vibe was great, drinks were even better. Bartender downstairs was an authority on rum and made excellent drinks. I ordered the special drink in a special barrel glass (to take home), which was outstanding. Note, we came back a few days later but had an awful experience with the bouncer (see next review).   Trip 2: 1 STAR. I wish I could write a review on our experience for our second trip to Smuggler's Cove, but unfortunately it ended at the door. The Bouncer let in 3 people who arrived just before we walked up, and then stopped us at the door and told us we had to wait. We were happy to wait, but it was very windy and cold outside so I asked if my wife could wait inside the little entry way (away from the other guests and the bouncer himself, who was waiting further inside - I guess he was cold). The Bouncer very rudely refused to let her in the doorway. We both thought this was extremely obnoxious. We had come from a fairly fancy dinner and were both dressed well (and we're both in our mid-20s, so I assume the clientele they want), and she was in a dress that didn't keep her very warm in the cold. After this encounter, we decided to just go home and not waste our time. It was a good thing that Uber was more accommodating than the bouncer. Also worth noting - while we we were waiting for our Uber (1-2 minutes per the Uber app), two more people walked right into the bar and were not asked to wait outside (even though no one inside the bar had left). This added insult to injury, and put a bad taste in our mouth on our last night in San Fran before ending our vacation.

KTs38V5KZE7HLoSaq1vrKw.review_text: I have mixed feelings about this place. The drinks were good, but who knew so many hipsters liked pirate themed bars? I was ready to wade in a sea of bros and broettes, but no...hipsters...HUH!   The layout is kind of weird...long and narrow...so there is minimal space to get to the bar...that kind of F's up the point of me coming here. I managed to get 2 drinks though...a pina colada which was kind of awesome. I also had something else in a martini glass, but it was eh...and I don't think this is the kind of place you can return a drink, even if you could make it back up to the bar.   All in all, I'll probably bring out of towners here to experience the "coolness" of going to a bar that is solely indicated by a light, but other than that I probably won't be back.

VAIBMyGZB2IGEKt-NjNMWw.review_text: A small but a really good place if you want to have a laid-back night with friends. It gets too crowded around 12 but the crowd slows down after that.   Very friendly staff. The bouncer came in around closing time, asked us how our drinks were and if we had a good experience . He even talked to us in Hindi. Haha.   The drinks we ordered were good. $10 or $11 drinks are a good price for a bar in SF.

l26TgP9ox03XRLDuG-9wvA.review_text: Land Ho!!!!!!  Trust me- LOOKING for this place would not elicit such a a swashbuckling response. Even with Smee's telescope you'd be hard pressed to find this place. Honestly- it's totally nondescript....which is probably my favorite feature of the place!  The place has a "speakeasy" meets "Pirates of the Caribbean" meets "tropical version of Rickhouse." The place is divided into three tiers- seating that over looks the bar below (think ship-wrecked tree house), the main floor with bar numero uno, and a downstairs bar and seating. (I don't like the downstairs as much- low ceilings and not nearly as decorated.) It's definitely a fun atmosphere!  Although I'm not a huge rum fan, they have an amazing array of drinks to chose from. I've had the Scorpion punch (yummy, sweet, fruity), Hibiscus punch, and good ol' mojito. The mojito was my favorite- as I feel these are either done right or incredibly wrong. However, 11 bucks? Getttt outtttaaaa here!  Definitely an experience...but it could easily become an expensive habit!

TYX4ItNru66YBeWYhLRB1Q.review_text: Absolutely brilliant. Great ambience, not too crowded on a Tuesday night.  We were there for an hour and a half, tried a few of the concoctions (need a few more nights to get through the whole list. And then I could start on the rums...).  And they have their own custom tiki mug - had to have one of those.  Visiting friend who recently moved here - this is on his way home every night. So jealous!  Tiki enthusiasts - get to it.

fdVCBVz4VWLo2bMbPsco9Q.review_text: One of my current favorite cocktail bars in the city, even if it weren't the closest bar to my condo.  And well... I'm now a disciple of the cove.  They have easily the best rum selection in the city.  several leagues better than the old best, hobson's choice.  This bar has something for everyone.  Not just a good rum selection, but some fine spirits of other sorts as well, including my favorite gin, Old Raj. Martin Cate, the owner, has put together this bar well, including some talented bartenders who take the time to prepare a cocktail as it should be.  OK so some of you might read that as "slow" but Marco (who works the weekends usually) is one of the fastest cocktail craftsmen I have ever seen.  He makes 6 ingredient cocktails in less than 30 secs.  No thinking, just bam bam bam, shake, done.   Marco, self-proclaimed cocktail geek, is sort of a cocktail rock star in this city actually... having designed the bar menu at absinthe, and with some of his drinks featured at various hot spots throughout this coast and even Death and Co in NYC.  He's the smiley guy with the hawaiian shirt you'll see on friday and sat nights.  great guy who knows his craft.  Smuggler's is a welcome improvement on Jade.  and gawd I have now had more different types of rum than ever before.  33 down... 67 more to go (as of 1/6/11) til i get my name on the wall.

85E5J2VAu5vK94TkhnYnFQ.review_text: We got tipped off to this place by our 'tender at Wilson and Wilson, and we are seriously in her debt. After checking out the below deck area - which was cool, but a little...basement-y, we settled in on the first level for the duration. Marko behind the bar seriously knows his rums and never steered us wrong. The kitschy-cool bar is tiny, so you are obliged to make friends with your fellow rum drinkers, which only enhanced our experience. The drinks were top notch, the bartender was friendly, fun and knowledgable and the other guests were entertaining to say the least. What more could you ask for in a bar?

gMny2pRE4bfegfsLjBahMQ.review_text: The space is a little cramped, but Smuggler's Cove serves some great rum cocktails.  The hot buttered rum is a revelation.

EDhkS_96G0yQA2buH2Io1g.review_text: I wish I could give them less than 1 star... The bouncer was extremely mean to us for no reason. We were standing in line and all he could talk about was how shitty his night was. Then he power tripped out on everyone by not letting anyone in, even after many people left the bar. He was extremely confrontational with the boys in our group and at 1:35 (right after his co/workers let us buy $80 worth of drinks he yelled at us and then physically took the drinks away from us. Very much uncalled for to be honest. Made me very uncomfortable and would never in a million years want to go back.

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: Smuggler's Cove "Smuggler Rum Barrel" is featured as #45 on the Alcademics 50 Drinks to Try Before You Die list. I was having dinner in Hayes Valley and had no idea that it was so close (I guess it's SF, I shouldn't be surprised).   The place is tiny and PACKED on a Wednesday night around 8pm. Seriously people?! Wednesday at 8pm?? The drinks are really cute ($13), and they even include a fresh orchid garnish, but the drinks are chock full of random syrups and you can taste it. They won't tell you what is inside it because it's a "secret recipe," it's nothing like the cocktails mixed up at Bourbon or Rickhouse.  I think people come for the fun atmosphere (it looks like you're in a pirate ship!) or perhaps the strength of the drinks, but definitely not for the price or the taste. I don't think I would return, make sure you don't come with a large party!

dpEtyfB2o7MH1Mc_Ygoolg.review_text: Ok, so it gets stupid crowded here on the weekends.. can you really blame them for being popular? Smuggler's Cove has some fantastic cocktails and some fantastic bartenders. One of my friends Julio B. told me that Marco here is the best bartender in San Francisco. And Julio knows what he's talking about (at least when it comes to alcohol.. he's an official ambassador of tequila).  I like Smuggler's Cove. A lot. I'm just going to have to start making calendar entries so I remind myself to come here early on weeknights.

7A5lajj4qvHSDM97Kg-x4g.review_text: ONE DRINK.  I ordered a Zombie. It came in a tall slim glass. Three quarters down that glass and I was re-assessing my mode of transportation home.   The two guys next to me had joined some club the bar offers to encourage people to slobber their way through their pirate's treasure of 200+ distinct rums. Both were larger than me, which is to say, larger than me. One of them was working on a $75 shot of rum that he offered me a sip of. Tasted like single malt. Interesting. I noted the giant anchor on the wall, and waited for it to drop.  It did. Both of my fellow barflies hit some invisible wall not long after, and beat a wobbly retreat out into the light.   I lasted through one more drink, then took their lead. Tremblies the next day. I'd forgotten that rum can be a little unkind on the flip side.  This is a good place. It reminded me of some disreputable joints I've been to in the Florida Panhandle and Salvador da Bahia, dark places with robust character, and drinks that smack you around a bit.

5qgJTus1l35A6bqW2fFk0w.review_text: Came at around 8:30 on a Friday night (pre-dinner drinks with a few friends) and had no problem finding a booth to sit at and quickly got drinks from the bartender upstairs.  I ordered a simple drink with rum, sugar, and freshly grated nutmeg that was delicious.  I am not much of a sweet drink lover, so this option was great.  The place has a great vibe and is a cool place to come for a drink or two to start out the night.

hOwNzTU0g0UzNLNQhhuHEQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I are constantly on the hunt for the best tiki bar and we think we found it (well, as good as you can get when you are NOT in Hawaii): Smugglers Cove! What a great experience. From the decor, to the 10 page menu of drinks complete with the history behind the drinks, to the easy going, cool crowd, to the service - we enjoyed every minute of it. And the drinks are STRONG, you don't ever feel like you are wasting your money. We had also wanted to try out Bamboo Hut, but we never made it there, SC was just too much fun :-)

WPoOtyg505qY3mb3Wn-5Sg.review_text: Absolutely love this place. LOVE.  My friends and I visited this place as part of a tiki/carny themed bar crawl birthday bash. Yes, we showed up in bad Hawaiian print and leis. And interestingly enough, we were NOT out of place at the Cove.  We grabbed a space downstairs for our rather sizeable party. We enjoyed such super tasty drinks as the Parisienne Blonde (I could drink that one all day) and the 4-person Volcano - yes, they bring it out and light it on fire.  Bottom line - love this place. The decorations are amazing and I love the little fountain downstairs. I'm tempted to join my friends in seeing if I can mark off every drink on the list. That's a LOT of rum - wish me luck!

Qz3qWko-7VEaWS2tKuc9Aw.review_text: This place rocks! Has great drinks and great vibe. Got to check this place out. Great place to have a date.

4U6Bns5iuERf5aC3rihAuQ.review_text: me, the bf, my cousin and her bf came here on a tuesday night, and it was not packed as i like. first thing when i stepped into this place was  "OMG what is that smell!!!! it smells hella good!" the fragrance of vanilla, wood, and cinnamon.. man! i could sniff his place all day long. this place also has this ship wreak theme going on. we ordered a painkiller and scorpion.  the scorpion was fun, and if honestly if you don't watch it you'll miss the fact that these will get you pretty messed up. It's an awesome bar to go to during the weekday and i don't mind coming back, again just to sniff the place and for the rum.

VmlShd8k2tq7-O4TVx5R1Q.review_text: A cool place to hang out with your friends.  The place is really small though.  Downstairs is less crowded but still doesnt really help.  I think the only reason why there is a line outside because of the capacity. Our group had a to wait 20 mins which wasnt that bad but it did felt weird to line up for a bar.   Their drinks are cool and there are plenty of alcohol!  Smuggler's Cove is just a nicer version of Trader Sams!

hmavGmZmigwyii6PnPEA4A.review_text: This is my first tiki bar experience, so here goes the story of my maiden voyage into pirate-land...  There are a ton of interesting cocktails, including one served with a flame on top in a large skull-shaped receptacle (awesome to observe, no clue about the experience).  I would list the three drinks my friend and I tried, but I can't remember the names and complicated ingredients. I tried to be a good Yelper and find them on the website, but you can't see the full menu without signing up on the "Tasting Notes" section, meaning that you have to give them your email addy. Boo. I can say this: I'd give my unnamed drink 5 out of 5 stars for taste, 3 for alcohol content per unit price, and 1 for wait time per unit price. I guess the other reviewers' references to Disneyland are correct - high in price, low in adult content, and heavy on anticipation factor.   I like the mysteriously understated black tinted windows that serve as the storefront. It's nice and minimalist, and also belies the kitsch inside. As a soft-spoken person, I also appreciate that instead of allowing 18 kajillion people inside at once they insist on maintaining a line to get in. I like going out to bars and such, but standing around yelling isn't my idea of a good time.  Call it the novelty factor, call it the intriguing, overpriced mystery cocktails, I'm not sure. My carousing here isn't over yet. Ahoy...

vZ0IpI0a-TNbXhQKk9YQ_g.review_text: after being away for months, this is a nice place to come back from travels to.  i've only had one flight (can't remember which) and a bourbon drink both of which i really liked so definately planning on heading back.  they seem to have a thorough selection of rums, you can keep track of what you drink and play an alcoholic game and move up levels to win who knows what: probably more rum but ideally a new liver.  small bar with 3 levels and cute tiki-ish decor.  dont go on douchebag days obviously.  trendy places like this should be avoided on fris/weekends.  although based on others' stories through no fault of the establishment, in my mind i'm calling this drama cove  :)

1oJnXtkMUR6ce4rd65hLEQ.review_text: This place is amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!! Great ambiance! Awesome nice bouncer! Talked to some awesome strangers! Fiance and I shared a Scorpion (supposedly serves 4) but we shared it between us...and he had a couple more drinks...I enjoyed a Painkiller which is much like a better pina colada or sorts. I highly recommend coming here if you get the chance. It's small but the drinks are great and so is the experience.

T_7gdLtmEvQgNGUoo9Wa4A.review_text: Lots of fun and tasty Tiki drinks with history, many rums.  However the atmosphere fell a bit short of my expectation.  Offering a ponderous tome of a menu, complete with history of each drink (over 70!), I was happy with the cocktails.  I found the drinks tasty but just slightly lacking in the entertaining department.  I visited Three Dots & a Dash (another nationally recognized Tiki bar) in Chicago earlier in the year so was consciously comparing the two and found Smuggler's "fun" factor a bit lacking, even if it excelled at the "lore" department.  It was still impressive all things considered.  Rum flight makes me smile, and of course the selection is large and exciting.    The reason I can't give this place 5 stars is because of the atmosphere.    I guess Smuggler's Cove goes for a more cozy and intentionally less fancy interior as far as Tiki bars are concerned.  I also guess, that ideally the effect was to be more piratey this way and less artificially exotic to the point of corny like some Tiki bars can be.  Unfortunately, it did not produce the desired effect for me.  It felt just a bit cramped and dowdy.  The ground level bar where we sat was small and the lone bartender was kind of surly.  Again I consciously compared this to Three Dots, and found that I much prefer the fun atmosphere which Smuggler's Cove just doesn't seem so adapt, or even keen, at providing.  Ultimately this is a matter of personal taste and can change pending future visits.  Based on drinks alone, its national renown is quite well deserved, and is one of San Francisco's best bars a visitor should try to check out.

amz57NX_BDfMhrJnkQhTYw.review_text: Potentially the best bar in the city of San Francisco.  If you like themed and extravagant decorations, this place will blow your mind.  There's an immediate shock as you step inside, the exterior gives pretty much no reference to the decor inside.You teleport to another land, of pirates, sunken ships, gold, and endless bottles of rum.  The drinks. Oh the pages and pages of drinks, and each on with its own paragraph-long description. Look for little symbols that tell you its either a classic, or a bartender's choice-- that will help narrow it down.  Those are great go-to's and I have not been disappointed by any drink I've had here, frozen, shaken, or straight up.  There is fine craftsmenship in each beverage, with techniques you won't see anywhere else (clapping herbs to release oils, layering creams and homemade tinctures).  And if you're serious about rum, join a tasting club and try hundreds of high quality rums from all over.  No cover, but the drinks make up for it.  Be prepared to spend a pretty penny-- but you'll be happy to do so. If I'm going to spend money on drinks at a bar, this is the kind of place I want to do it.  No rum and cokes here, but rather, tantalizing, exquisite, libations that lift any mood.  if you're lucky grab a seat at the bar and watch the bartenders mix magic.

kbE0ZbFEplJWmAtS6kyUKA.review_text: Probably my favorite bar.  Can get crowded on the weekends and there is some competitive musical chairs that happen when a group leaves.  Once you do get a seat, you are required to get a flaming drink.  Order a hot buttered rum.  You will not regret it.

WvfyXE7nj6FaXg5clIvN8w.review_text: If you are coming here for the first time, look for the building number because they don't have a big sign with their name plastered on it. I came here for the first time on Friday night and I have to say, I had a good time. The line was pretty long (and for a good reason). It's extremely tiny inside. Thank goodness when we got there some of our friends were in line for us and we were pretty much the next group. I noticed the bouncer was splitting up people's groups into two's or three's and he split us up into two groups. The total wait was about 30-35 minutes.  Once inside, we were able to squeeze everyone on the top third floor. We didn't get to sit next to the balcony overlooking the bar below and all the over the top decor, but never the less we had a good time. A bar-back brought us a couple of menus to look at and we took two volcano bowls and a couple of well mixed drinks. Getting the drinks were a bit of hassle at the bar on the entrance floor because it was literally like a damn shoe box! I don't know how the bartender maneuvers around in there because its so small. Getting drinks took about a good 15 minutes. It was worth the wait though because we had quite the show when they lit both bowls on fire at once. I didn't expect them to lite the entire thing on fire, but they did. It went up in a pretty big flame which caught all of us off guard. For $36 bucks a bowl, considering the fire show it was worth the price because you don't see that too often at a bar.. I just wish it was a bit larger. We finished them in literally five minutes and it didn't help that there was way more ice than alcohol.  We didn't get to explore the very bottom floor, which I heard has some type of fountain or lagoon, because we came here to pre-party before we hit the clubs. I definitely will be back again to try out more drinks on the menu and just to have a good time with friends. Big group, little group.. It don't matter! You'll find a place to sit everyone because the bouncer helps regulate the crowd flow inside (hence, the wait). He was very friendly and super nice btw. He got really excited when my friend's sister told him  'you look like p. diddy.' Haha. Enough said though, I say come give this place a try if you haven't already!

8wDDyQc7d8Nk-SLpZWXGgQ.review_text: Ahoy!! A pirates life for meeee. If you haven't been to Smugglers Cove you are in for a treat...batten down the hatches and rum away from reality.  This place has an astonishing ambiance, each drink is uniquely crafted to perfection, and the service is impeccable.  There are 3 stories at the bar, you walk up the stairs to a small intimate deck to chat or mingle with friends, the main deck is where the main bar is at and gets extremely crowded so get there early if you want a seat at the bar, shiver me timbers there's a Lower deck as well which also has a bar and a cool lagoon ambiance, great for a large group or mingling.  Walk the plank and experience Smugglers Cove with over 70 cocktail choices made from premium liqueurs, fresh juices, and in-house Ingredients.

XvWiPbXPQqo5gm1YbGdukQ.review_text: Fruity, strong, rum cocktails. This is my kind of place for those. A large selection of rum and a good amount of variety in the cocktail menu. A nice loft for a little quieter discussion and a downstairs good for groups.  The bartenders really know the cocktails they create. Give them an idea and they'll surprise you. There can be a long line on weekends, but it's great during the week. Highly recommended when this is what you're in the mood for.

TSdV_lsddT4F3TJvmdmXag.review_text: Ah, an alcoholic Disneyland.  I half-expected Mickey to jump out from behind a plank and throw back a shot before going back to work.  Picture three levels of nautical-themed kitsch, two of which have a bar, punctuated with the occasional flaming drink going by.  I'd say Jack Sparrow would feel at home, but it's so clean and shiny.  In keeping with the grown-up-disneyland theme, there is a strict capacity limit, and you may encounter a line to get in.  This is nice when you're inside, because it doesn't get nearly as crowded, loud, and hot as Jade used to, but I'm sure it's annoying if you have to wait for someone to finish up their elaborate fruity concoction and get the heck out of there.  Try going early Sunday night - there was no line at 9pm.  Novelty is key here, just like Disneyland.  This will never be your cozy neighborhood hangout, unless you're truly that into rum and pirates, and can afford $8-11 cocktails on a regular basis.  Those are the caveats.  Why'd I give it four stars?  The drinks were made extremely well and had plenty of booze for the buck - I had the El Diablo (tequila) and the Painkiller #3 (rum).  I preferred the El Diablo - slightly fizzy, sweet, and sour.   The bouncer, Justin, was also a sweetheart - as I was waiting for my friends he brought me a drink menu and told me to come inside where it was warmer, and I could have his seat (then cautioned me not to talk to the blonde girl behind me because she was super annoying).  He probably gets a star of his own just for that.  I am rarely in a pirate/tiki mood, and when I want to ogle sailors I wait for Fleet Week, but should I ever find myself wearing a tri-cornered hat and needing a fancy drink, I will go back to Smuggler's Cove.

SJ8Xo458c3E18pBGHicBsA.review_text: Such an awesome cozy place that's WAY more than a tiki bar. They hold a great selection of rum and liquors. They even stock Cachaça, which is considered the Brazilian rum and perfects the caipirinha.  The seating is a bit random but after sitting awkwardly for 15 minutes seats kept opening up for us to have our cozy corner upstairs.  I highly recommend the hibiscus punch because it wasn't too strong to where I couldn't drink us home but it was the punch I was looking for.  Great, great drinks and the awards to prove it!

6pl4HxA6N1eVLf5f3SxnuQ.review_text: Get the Corn and Oil. If you don't like it you suck. Its quick for the bartender to make, its strong, and its delicious.   The reason why its so long for a drink is because all you douchebags are ordering scorpion bowls, and other crazy concoctions. YOU are the reason its so long for a drink!   How about skip a cocktail all together and get some rum. This place has some amazing rum. Rum you're not gonna see at many other places. Take advantage of this place's unique selection and drink it straight. El Dorado (not rare but still good) 12 (or 15?) is a good place to start. Ask for those neat for you and your friends and you're gonna be drinking way before the loser ordering the flaming bowl of drink blasphemy.

uTDxT-lAVI31gBg9Fgz8hQ.review_text: More like Smuggler's Closet!   Who uses Canada Dry in a Dark & Stormy? Shame on you!  Cool decor but super cramped. Fancy cocktails but lousy ingredients. And a club-like entrance. I could maybe, just maybe, see the potential in this place, but I thought it was 100% meh.

7MevC5iKi30qaSXeJOHWqw.review_text: We went on a Thursday night right when they opened, so no lines or crowds for us! The staff was very kind and helpful - the rum we had was dangerously good. Can't wait to go again and will surely be arranging for a ride to and from...  *Delicious drinks *Fun, dark, yet unpretentious atmosphere *Great neighborhood to dine in (afterwards, as to avoid the supposed late night crowds at Smuggler's Cove) *Ask for rum/drink suggestions from helpful staff

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: After a dry spell Smuggler's Cove is turning into a popular happy hour spot recently. By coincidence different groups of friends have been scheduling drinks here and I enjoy myself every time. I really should remember to come here more often.  Most recently we got the volcano - a bowl drink for four that's lit on fire with a pillar of fire created by the bartender with cinnamon and sugar. I'm a sucker for a spectacle and that includes anything lit on fire. And of course the drink was delish - pineapple and passionfruit. Be careful you don't drink it too fast - it's strong!

IFm5fxeP9CCW9A0JX2Cqgw.review_text: I'm not sure what I was expecting in a "pirate bar", but I kind of wanted over-the-top pirate-ness (I mean, go big or go home with a concept like that, right)? But it was kind of disappointing. They have a lot of rum drinks and it's a bit musty/smelly - perhaps that's supposed to be reminiscent of the hull of an actual ship?  Not horrible, but not great. If you're going to commit to a crazy theme like this, go all the way with it, IMHO - you can't half ass a pirate bar.

2Yg3D3xUNNzmn-SicXZOnA.review_text: I would have never notice this place if I were to just drive down the street, but once through the door between those two pinkish light bulbs, wow! It's like a vacation in under moonlight.   Smuggler's Cove is a tiki bar that's super chill-laxing. There's three floors, all pretty small and cozy. The menu is extensively descriptive and the drinks are delicious! Oh yeah, and they're pretty and they're strong.   Can't wait to go back to try more drinks from the menu and the infamous goblet.

eIa4QJXp5ZNmuFORnuPvDA.review_text: Every time I come here, I end up finding a NEW favorite drink on the menu, and I'm really picky about my cocktails! Here's to asking the bartender for a new recommendation every time, and LOVING the result every time!  THE WAIT: About 30-45 minutes at 10pm on a Saturday. We made friends with a group of really fun older people in line. This is what I love about SF - there's no judgement, and plenty of love between people of sorts of people!  Once inside, I made a couple more friends when I saw the amazing tiki mug (think mini totem pole - for your DRINK) they were holding. You can get it with the Expedition. We were sold.  Must-haves:   * The Expedition - 4.5 stars (Jamaican rum, bourbon, fresh lime, cinnamon, honey, vanilla, Bitterman's New Orleans coffee liqueur. $13 cocktail only, $25 to keep the Kuhiko mug) Very refreshing, a good balance of sweet and tart flavors, and it's rather strong as well! We love our tiki mug =).  * Demerara Dry Float - 5 stars (Dry & tart - a vibrant mix of exotic passion fruit, lemon, lime, and demerara rums, served w/ a side of danger. $11) I asked the bartender for a well balanced tart drink and he immediately recommended this, which was perfect for me. The passion fruit is strong, and this tasted like a deliciously tart fruit punch - wasn't too fruity for the boys either!  * Jet Pilot - 3.5 stars (lime, grapefruit, cinnamon, bitters, nerves of steel, falernum, Jamaican & Guyanese rums, and Herbsaint. $13) More on the strong/boozy side - a fairly well-balanced old-fashioned. More a drink for the boys, and they really liked it. I did see a guy who was completely overwhelmed by the menu just ask the bartender to make his own favorite drink, and he made this one!  * Tradewinds - 4 stars (lemon, coconut cream, apricot liqueur, and both dark Jamaican & silver rums. $10) With the coconut cream, this definitely had a thicker consistency and had more of a tropical island punch vibe to it. It was still well balanced and had just enough enough of an alcohol kick to it.  * Rum Barrel - 4 stars Also a great well-balanced, spiced, tart/fruity drink. Well liked by all!

OqTpZMgETc4UB30xQPujzQ.review_text: great place--i was excited to go as i'm a huge fan of forbidden island in alameda. so i wasn't suprised at the excellent rum drinks, the terrific interior.  with 3 levels, it's a lot bigger than forbidden, but i have to say--i think i prefer the island to the cove. forbidden's got this creaky, quiet vibe with works so well with its vintage surf movies & delicious grogs.  smuggler's was fun, but a little over the top. felt like being on the pirates ride at disneyland and was a bit loud for my tastes.

eHbGrWRkDEjJkdRzitQn5A.review_text: Are you kidding?  Amazing.  Please don't go there.

SFCwl4J3Ycgftmt6W9YJ8w.review_text: A pirates life for me...This is a cozy bar.  The decor is top notch.  The theme carried through the entire place including the downstairs bar.  The drink menu (yes I said menu) offers many different types of mixed rum cocktails.  They even offer rum tastings on a seperate menu.   The bar is on the smaller side and it does get busy.  You either have to arrive early or know by 9pm you'll have to wait in line.  It's a pretty fun expirence, I think everyone should visit this place (at least once).

l8Nq0FbZx-KCB5vP5tn5yQ.review_text: The quality of the cocktails at this gem is only overshadowed by the expertise and passion for rum that Martin Cate, the owner, imparts to his patrons.   My poison of choice was a Pupule cocktail. Infused with a wonderful medley of allspice, vanilla, and cinnamon, it was complex, fresh, and great at highlighting the complexity of its base liquor. In addition to my cocktail (which was garnished with a beautiful, fresh orchid that really made me smile), I was able to sit in on a short history lesson with Mr. Cate. As a relative rum-novice, it was fun to learn about the history of rum and tiki bars. I plan on making my way through the menu during subsequent visits - if like me, you've had one pomegranate martini too many, you'll love this place off the beaten path.

kAeDlIhP9Z78pdVTHOcuDQ.review_text: Checked out Smuggler's Cove for the first time on a Monday night, and was pleasantly surprised and impressed.   It looks fairly non-descript and modern on the outside, but go in, and you're surrounded by fishing floats, blowfish lamps and a waterfall wall. On the main floor along the left side wall are little shrines to tiki bars past -- a nice touch. There are three levels -- the bottom being the most dark and intimate and condusive to conversation, the top level with the thatched roof gives you a birds-eye view of the action.   One look at the extensive menu and you know that you're in the "thinkin' guy's tiki bar" -- there are descriptions of the recipes, their history and the ingredients, including rum. Lots and lots of rum.  I tried a Kona cocktail, which was made with fresh pineapple juice, and was pleasantly tangy/sour and not icky-sweet -- finished off with an orchid, of course. My companion had a "three dots and a dash." Now, I grew up in Hawaii and I have never, no, never seen a drink called that at any bar I've ever been to in Honolulu. But he had no complaints, and overall, it was a fun experience.  The attention to detail and the love for tiki culture is evident. The music was soft enough to allow me to have a nice conversation with my friend and a few friendly folks I met at the bar -- again, not a given in bar scenes.  It was a little odd that there were no snacks/nuts or whatever to go with our drinks, but we had just eaten dinner, so we weren't exactly aching for eats. Still, I wouldn't recommend slammin' back a Smugglers' Cove cocktail on an empty stomach.  street parking was easy to find -- but then again, my friend says he has good parking karma, and it was a monday.   I'll definitely check out Smuggler's Cove again. A fun night that's worth repeating.

cNCLxwrchvQTjnIFJf03RQ.review_text: If you love Pirates of the Caribbean -- the ride, stories, movies, THEME -- then you will absolutely LOVE this awesome "Pirates of the Caribbean" style decked out two-story bar!! The drinks at this bar are absolutely DELICIOUS! I'm sure you get all of your vitamin C from some of these tropical fruity rum cocktails! The scorpion bowl is also SUPER strong and really impressive.  The only down side of this bar -- tough for a large group party. The seating is a lil sparse and you end up being like a vulture, waiting to jump on the nearest seat as soon as someone makes any indication that they are leaving. Also it takes a little long to get your delicious drinks. Otherwise, I would have given this place five stars. :)

Vnja4xoPVQ7BLXIsVy_cFw.review_text: As tiki bars go, SC is for sippin'.   It's a world class rum library. They have artfully crafted a menu and a keeping track of what you tried environment for those who are seeking the deeper secrets. Prices are decent, and there are a variety of intimate spaces that lend themselves to paying closer attention to your beverage.

RkeGMI58g7MKq00ww0Fv7A.review_text: This was such a great find off the main drag of the Hayes Valley.  We were meeting friends for dinner at Absinthe and decided to have a pre-cocktail based on a friend's recommendation.    Be prepared to get overwhelmed by the menu.  You can't go wrong with any of the drinks and the prices I felt were reasonable.   Definitely will be going here again the next time we're in the Bay Area.

cCZVyePopvA1nYHkK8f_0A.review_text: Smugglers Cove was on our MUST SEE list while in San Francisco as part of our three state Tiki Extravaganza.  The pros: Anyone who is a fan of neo -cocktail culture experience will appreciate Smugglers Cove: Really delicious drinks, Exhaustive rum menu, A history packed and educational cocktail menu (I LOVED that the menu provided provenance for most of their concoctions), top notch bartenders - WOW!  The Cons: This place is small and even on a Tuesday night PACKED from about 8-10!!!!!! Really, really packed (its tiny) .So yes your personal space will be violated and yes there can be a significant wait to both order your drink and receive it and yes it gets noisy.  So following the same form as for the other bars on my list, I rated Drinks, Décor, Bartender, Price and Overall Experience on a scale of 1-10  DRINKS: (Taste, value, drinking pleasure) Tasty, tasty, tasty drinks. Delicious mixes with fruit and spicy and booze. Pleasantly relaxing, and each unique compared to the other. They do a Trader Vic's style Mai Tai (Don's is my fav but ridiculously complex) perfect balance of fresh lime, curacao, orgeat and rum with fragrant mint garnish! Just the right sour vs sweet with just enough boozy to make it adult. I was there with two friends - whose drinks were also delicious and different from mine.   SCORE: 10  Décor: (Looking for Unusual, evocative, fun, cheese factor.)  Smuggler's Cove décor was cute - nice  touches. BUT they had very little room and really the super stars here are the drinks. As other's have commented they are playing up the pirate theme.  I do love that the front door is practically unidentifiable from outside - works with the hidden cove vibe but nothing particularly extraordinary except the menus. As mentioned above the menus are like a history lesson with booze!!! LOVED reading the cocktail descriptions and where they came from.   SCORE: 6  Bartender and staff:  (Two primary criteria here: Mixology skill and aloha spirit.)   OK - before I wax poetic about the actual bartender couple of additional comments. The doorman was nice, welcoming and informative - what a great way to start a night out. The owner and startender Martin Cate was helping out with some bar back duties the night we were in - also hospitable and warm. When the entire staff makes you feel welcome, any bar gets huge brownie points. An inclusive vibe is of paramount importance to my enjoyment of a bar - I am not looking for status or exclusivity when I go drinking and I had enough of cliques in high school.  So now on to the bartender. The bartender on the main floor the night we were in was Dale. 1. He seemed to keep track of what everyone was drinking -including us so it wasn't limited to regulars. People would come up and ask for "something with lime and a little coconut, but not too sweet" and he would get them queued up and delivered. 2. Despite the fact it was busy, whenever he was on our side of the bar he would pleasantly answer questions about technique or the tools he was using. 3. I think he had the giant menu memorized - no matter what people asked for he seemed to just make without any reference. 4. No matter how many people were lining up he kept his cool and was friendly and efficient. 5. And all of this AND tasty drinks.  SCORE: 10  Price: I evaluated price with the understanding that Tiki drinks ARE pricey and I was in expensive cities. The prices at Smugglers Cove were  maybe slightly above average even  for Tiki drinks BUT they were extremely well crafted and none of them were stingy.   SCORE: 7  Overall: This was the most subjective category and scored solely on how much I enjoyed myself at the bar. I am a dive bar sort of gal, Smuggler's Cove was not really a dive bar and was obviously very popular so while "Good for them" I would have preferred a less populous destination. However, I will make it a point to try and stop by my next trip to San Francisco - I'll just try to go earlier in the night or something.   SCORE: 8  Total Score: 41

mhOoYrIwVtuBZeeVXbhNzg.review_text: Ehh. I thought this place was alright I guess. The drinks kinda sucked but the atmosphere was cool. I saw in a magazine that this place was better than my "go to bar" Noble Experiment in San Diego... No. Not true. The bar tender didn't even talk to me and one of the drinks I had was so horrible I almost threw up... Not from being drunk. Anyway..... If you like "speak easy" type places with authentic and delicious drinks don't go here.

HQQ_yksK_dC8GlP_Yw7lFg.review_text: This bar really goes all out with the pirate theme. The decor makes you feel like you're part of the Pirates of the Caribbean or something. Its a fun bar, a little on the small side but most places in SF are. Drinks are creative. Only got to try the Hawaiian Sunset which was really fruity and girly. It can get crowded so come early if you have a big group.

cTDtVeTdRA-yRPv8HOx2CQ.review_text: amazing drinks and not too crowded

BzP-xGII8xxKfg_CPCO_ig.review_text: So this was the first stop for a friend's 21st birthday.    The wait was definitely a little long, so be prepared to stand outside for a little bit, especially since we were there on a Friday night.  Because of the line, I totally thought there was more room inside.  When we got in, there were no tables or anywhere to sit, so we just stood near the crowded bar.  It took us a really long time to even order a drink.  By the time we wanted to, we found out that the Volcano drink that we wanted to order required us to sit at a table, so that was a huge bummer.  So we ended up with 3 rum drinks which were AMAZING and the bartender put on an awesome show for us.    I'm really willing to give this place another shot just because the drinks and the bartender are really fun.  I just hope it isn't as crowded the next time I go.

MBKDZ9qx8gYrnlmL9SeMXg.review_text: It's not really common for me to walk into a bar (or any establishment, for that matter) and be greeted with a play-by-play of the entire place (extra bonus for pointing out the location of the bathrooms ... which aren't hard to find, but still). It was much appreciated and set the tone for the rest of my experience there.  Not really too sure about the place being pirate-themed, but it was cozy and, er, snazzy (I'd have said it was "cute" by default, but I'm sure no pirate-themed business would accept it as a proper description). As many have said, the place is small and cramped, and its exterior convinces others that they're closed.  I don't know how often they bring drinks to tables and describe all the bowl's bells and whistles, but that was ... okay, it was pretty darn cute. And friendly! For a bar, that itself is a four-star. Ratcheting it up to a five for the overall feel of the place.  (Oh, and the girls' bathroom is clean. Hooray for clean bathrooms! I think real pirates would frown upon this practice ... but don't change it, ever! Beware the mirror that's immediately on the right as you walk in, though; I scared myself spineless when I saw my reflection up close. IDK, maybe that's just me.)  -- Also, I will say that they put a ton of ice into the bowls. I guess if you're a heavy drinker, you may as well forego sharing. But this just tells me I'm going to, like, sneak in a plastic spoon the next time so I can munch on the ice.  -- AND! One of the bouncers was really nice about letting patrons know to move their cars somewhere else because of street cleaning. Pretty sure that isn't part of his job description, so I thought that was really impressive. Whoever runs this place knows how to pick their employees.

5ymDDKzvHqPrGr5EIFyjPw.review_text: Where's my $2 dollar Jade Bar drinks at?  When I found out the Smuggler's Cove took over the old Jade Bar, I was a  little disappointed that my old school Happy Hour bar had closed up shop. I do like the whole Smuggler's Cove renovation, but if I knew that the bartenders were going to hold out on me I would have just gone straight to Trad'r Sam. On a non-busy Friday night, I ordered a Jamaican Milk Punch. For this drink alone I would have given the Smuggler's Cove 5 starts, but my cup was filled to the brim with ice and I could literraly finish the drink in 1gulp. As much as this drink was delicious...$8 dollars for a shot of milk. Come on?! I could have gone to Trad'r  Sam and probably spent the same amount on 2 equally delicious Pina Coladas. OOHHH and I forgot to mention, my friend waited 15 minutes for a Mai Tai after the bartender totally forgot about her order. When there is only two other customers at the bar, I'm not sure how that could have happened. So much for the advertised helpful bartenders...  Oh how I miss my $2 dollar Jade Green drinks...

JOFSFGCUd1veVlWPQZYxpg.review_text: My yelp app is acting up...

N3KcSlDr3WVvO2rQLi7tHA.review_text: Way overpriced drinks!!!   i ordered three drinks....he says"that'll be 56.00 dollars please"  what for? for a vodka pineapple, whiskey diet and a gin? None of which were name brands by the way. They dont even carry cranberry juice here! what kind of a bar doesnt have cranberry juice.  And whats with the super cheesey velet rope outside? As if there were a ton of people in there...they had more employees than customers...bartenders act as if they are doing you a favor buy pouring you a drink...maybe the service would be quicker if they didnt have 3 people standing inside their 9 square foot bar. I give this place 6 months before it tanks

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: Great cozy spot. Not too loud, but not too quiet. Comfy. Excellent, strong, but tasty, drinks menu. Nice bartender. Nice regulars representing the age spectrum. The coconut badia was my fave.

Ri68-rW7igFwAD29m3T06A.review_text: So cool. SO cool.   A pirate themed bar. And they take the theme very seriously. Elaborate decor, and furnishings. A fountain, palm trees, spooky lighting, plenty of barrels and aged wood furnishings, countless classy bottles of rum lining the walls. And the drinks? Mixology gains new meaning here - try the sidewinder.   There are so many delicious rum filled blended conceptions, with all sorts of exotic ingredients, including basil, coconut milk, bamboo shoots.   If you're adventurous, try the scorpion bowl.

ztBsQnHaMRZqZFA_w3Zaig.review_text: Difficult to find, but totally worth it!  As most other reviewers have sad, from the outside, it seems like any other office building, especially if you get there early. We got there around 7 PM and were able to walk straight in. Our friends came about a half an hour later and had to wait in line for about 20 minutes.   The drinks are awesome! The Rum Barrel was suggested by a friend and is delicious and now highly recommended by me too! My wife tried the 'El Presidente' and that had a nice kick to it too. We got a volcano for the table and you get a show along with the drink. This drink is for at least 4 people so don't get it all by yourself. Definitely worth a try.  No food here though, so pre or post dinner type bar, aye!

zl2rE92NEXz6RyKPAD5HDw.review_text: Went here on Saturday night, luckily we were with someone who knew the place, as if you are looking for it, it's really hard to find, as it has no windows and just a small sign on the door. Inside it has a very nautical theme, with lots of cool decorations and a huge anchor hanging from the ceiling. The is a bar on the level you come in on, and a downstairs seating area and a small upstairs seating area, it was busy in both seating areas so we sat at the bar. Between us we ordered 4 different kinds of cocktails, they have a really good cocktail menu and a huge selection of rums. The barman (sorry dont know his name) seemed to be the only one behind the bar - well it was small, but what an awesome job he did. Whilst making cocktails people were placing orders, and he was really quick and didnt forget one single order. There are two drinks on the menu that come in tiki bowls, which are set alight and look really cool, sadly I never noticed this till we were leaving, so will definitely have to go back to try those. A small bar, but much fun and great drinks and exceptional service.

lVyUWqK2ghPzChhT_YsUBw.review_text: Okay, I LOVED this place!  As Tiki bars go, its top notch!  For all you haters out there to note:  This is not the type of bar you come to with large groups, or to pick up, or to do shots and get totally sh!t faced.  Go to North Beach or the Marina for that kids.  This IS the kind of bar to enjoy a super cool ambiance, unique & fantastic drinks and beyond friendly service.  I'm going to break it down for you...  Ambiance: Every Tiki bar needs to be fun and have lots of kitsch... and Smuggler's Cove does that perfectly!  Yes, you feel like you're in a set from Disneyland's Pirates of the Caribbean, but when do you ever get to drink in Disneyland?!  Case in point.  Unique and Fantastic Drinks:  The drink menu reads like a novel with probably 50 or more concoctions I've never heard of with wacky ingredients you don't find in most modern day cocktails.  We sat at the bar and as Melissa, the bartender, kept whipping out strange ingredients I kept asking her, "what's that?!".  She indulged me and always answered with a smile but I'm sure she was probably getting annoyed.  Of the two drinks I ordered the Batida was by far my favorite.  Sweet, creamy... did I mention sweet?!  Probably had something to do with the sweetened condensed milk, mmmm.  My friend got the Puka Punch, which was great as well.  And then there's the Rum Barrel... $20 for the drink WITH the custom mug (the mug alone was something like $35... so its just economically responsible to get it for less WITH the cocktail!).  And the cherry on top of all this... the kick a$$ swizzle sticks!  Seriously, these are the most substantial and intricate swizzles I've seen!   Beyond Friendly Service:  Yes, you may have to wait in line, but Justin the bouncer is so nice!  Again for the haters: you're waiting in line because they strictly limit the number of people inside so you can enjoy yourself without having constantly be bumping into others, spilling your drinks down the front of yourself and yelling about the crowd.  Again, if that's what you want then please go to a bar in the Marina or N. Beach and leave Smuggler's alone!  But I digress, back to the service.  Melissa was a really nice bartender and kept apologizing to us for having to wait in line so long.  She handled the extremely complex drink concoctions with as much ease as you can.  These aren't your typical G&T folks, so be patient... you won't be disappointed.  And so what if she has to look at notes, did I mention that there are probably about 50+ unique cocktails with no less than 5 ingredients each?!  Even the bar back (didn't get his name) was extremely sweet and even seemed sad that we were leaving.  Everyone said goodbye and that they hoped we would return.   And Return I will.  After all, I have to try every last one of those 50+ cocktails!

NdNHNG8Kfk6Zapegb1WNYg.review_text: The puka punch was the best drink I have had in a long time . The mixologist on duty was amazing and everyone was kind. Love , love, love .

J9ZimQR8AIhpk6WShogdGw.review_text: This place is fun! You walk in and are transported into a tiki island hideaway. After a short time you almost forget you are still even in the city. The cocktails are also a huge part of the overall experience. These bartenders know their mixology. Each drink is carefully prepared for you which explains the slightly higher prices. The crowd is usually friendly with a dive bar mentality. Def. worth checking out!

TgCW5tyinPDvZWE5Sqwwgw.review_text: A rum bar in the city? Sweet, let's go!  and it's Pirate themed? what are we waiting for?   This is a great place to go with your small-large group of friends.... smaller the better though, as there is a capacity for the patrons, and it seems to always be filled!   Definitely a fun bar, with a ginormous menu of drinks to choose from... how did i choose my drink? I looked up on the wall and saw an ad for their Libations contest and picked the funnest name.... it was awesome. it was some kind o TIKI DRINK. lol.   there are 3 levels to this establishment... and all seating is like a typical bar, first come, first served! Upstairs there is a cozy loft area... main floor is a bar with some stools to sit on, or stand up near the wall... and downstairs is the best part! It's like you are standing/sitting WITHIN a sunken ship. awesome for fun pictures, and just a fun atmosphere.   Great spot to take visitors and locals alike. Yum Yum for Rum Rum!

CfV_axQI2rK0eHB9FfG_GQ.review_text: It's a love/hate situation with Smugglers Cove. I wouldn't dare come here on a weekend but weekdays around 5:30 work perfectly for me and smaller crowds. The drinks are masterfully imagined and created with finesse in front of you using fresh delicious ingredients. I've never had a bad drink here- all are layered in flavor and intensity. The menu is large but does repeat in flavors. I can't lie that I get slightly bummed when I realize the drink I ordered comes in a small martini glass; I wish they specified what drink receptacle you may be receiving on the menu. Prices are high but the drinks are elevated. The crowds can be obnoxious as this is a 'destination'/celebration bar. My favorite thus far is Captains Grog- grapefruit, maple syrup, falernum, orange liqueur, vanilla, almond, and 3 rums. It would be nice if they had more bowls or offered happy hour.

oo0gy7nuHywgAgpxETiB-g.review_text: Oh man, you want a place where you can find an extensive rum selection?  Look no further, Smuggler's Cove is your stop.  Betty and I absolutely loved the atmosphere of the kitchy tiki bar.  We wandered on downstairs and were in awe of the more than four hundred rums and seventy-plus rum-infused cocktails that were to be had.  All of their drinks are great, not cheap, but great.  They also have HH everyday from 5-6pm for $2 off your cocktails.

med4UArZWlIyJLcioz_UGQ.review_text: I am a tiki-phile, so of course my review is going to be somewhat bias.  However, tiki-phile aside, Smuggler's Cove is a great little place to imbibe. The cocktails, of course, are top notch - I'd expect nothing less from Martin Cate and his staff.   Sure the drinks are a little pricey, but you're getting fresh ingredients and homemade syrups. The drinks are made with intention - they aren't slopped into a glass and thrown to you across the bar. These guys are paying respect to the vintage tiki cocktails of yore. So shelling out a little more for a wonderful cocktail isn't a major hangup for me.  The atmosphere is as moody as you'd expect. Lots of rattan, bamboo and glass floats. The music is FANTASTIC, as I'm a huge space age pop fan. And every few minutes, the gentle sound of a ship bell is rung over the sound system. Nice touch!  If you're a huge rum enthusiast, you need to get yourself here and sign up for their rum program. They even have a locked cabinet behind the bar containing revolving premium rum selections for the program members. If I lived in SF I'd be all over that.  My only negative comment would be their Smuggler's Cove Rum Barrel is extremely disappointing. Way way too sweet. The other drinks I had - Three Dots & A Dash and the Mai Tai, were excellent.

Igd6oC7tfpZ-eGkiYzGJIQ.review_text: Pirate theme to the MAX. Great rum drinks!  Even a water feature in the basement.  Just wish they handed out eye patches at the door.

rDORGCGHV984OBXwqu2FYQ.review_text: hard to find kinda (no sign outside, just a lone bright light) took a $15 lyft from 5th/market but if youre feeling up to it, its a short & easy walk went on a tues night late, around 12 , so it wasnt super packed (we found sitting room at all 3 levels) this is NOT the place to come if youre feeling like raging frat style or raiders baby style  after dinner leisure luxury rum sipping style the menu is big & vast & yes there are chunky descriptions for every cocktail & rum i.e the history of the painkiller & what island it comes from, but that adds to the overall awesome-ness of this place, in other words, for the smart tiki fan 2 cocktails each & yup, we're beyond buzzing not cheap,but hello,who isnt used to $12-$15 cocktails anymore? besides, youre getting super super premium rum/ fresh mixers that bevmo could only dream of.  the drinks take a long time..... duh. youre not gettin a bud or gin tonic here , are you? all in all, the drinks here are THE $HIT ..  the decor is very clean & modern tiki/ pirate bathrooms small but clean we CAN NOT wait to return.... P.s we went a 2nd time on our mini vacay it was that proper...  AND we took ONE bus from market/5th can not remember the bus line # but I downloaded the MUNI bus app ( for free) so  thats how we knew the route... Off topic , but that app is A MUST thank you app developers for making it so easy to use & most importantly THANK YOU MUNI for  your schedules on point!!!! On our way back to the hotel ( midnight-ish) we obviously didnt wanna be at a norteńo bus stop alone at that hour but the bus came on the time the app said listed !!! Shame on you LA MTA !

dB_OoKISAVhSI6FmefomXg.review_text: Whoa - Smuggler's Cove is what I imagined a bar inside Disneyland's Pirates of the Caribbean ride would look like!  I'm a fan of rum so I was excited to check out this new Hayes Valley watering hole that specialized in this amazing elixir. Unfortunately, our visit proved to be a disappointing one as we only stayed for 30 minutes (even though it took 15 minutes just to get drinks!).  The layout hasn't changed from when this space used to be called Jade bar, so the tri-level space is still quite small and narrow, which made it difficult to move around when the bar is crowded. Not only is it hard to maneuver the bar, but also the time it takes to get drinks can be quite long. I'm not bashing the bartenders as I do think they're working hard. It's more of an operations issue for the owners to tackle.
