Pirate themed, you can't go wrong with that! Bad thing is that this place is small and cluttered.  Lastly,  I suggest ordering the Puka Punch! It has 11 different ingredients & it's SOOO GOOD! It has a lovely fruity after taste to it also.

Ve0LUwcrzxL7w0RYgY4Aaw.review_text: If ever a business were worthy of 5 stars Smuggler's Cove is it! In fact, for a number of reasons this bar sets the new standard for what EVERY bar should be like.   First of all, how can I not mention the fact that this bar looks like a friggin' pirate ship! It's incredible. And while some bars look cool, none look as cool as this. There are water features, hanging items like blowfish and glass lamps and multiple levels to check out and explore.  And what's a good bar without good drinks, right? The guys here are slinging the best of the best. Especially for rum and tiki fanatics. With top quality booze and funky glasses, swizzle sticks and drinks lit on fire, there's never an unhappy customer. If you haven't been here yet, hurry up! It's not going anywhere anytime soon but you'll regret not coming here sooner.

VgdboemFqdYrY4mnFiFzEw.review_text: So my friend and I were excited to try out this new pirate bar. We went on a wednesday night. Show up at 10:30pm, there's a line to get in. Really? There's a line on a Wednesday night?? This place better be good! Ok, so we wait the 15 minutes to get in. The crowd in line is mostly white, everyone is dressed down, seems like a young crowd, like freshly 21.   We get in, place is busy, we go downstairs to see that it is packed, so we head back upstairs to get a drink. There are a lot of people that is surrounding the tiny bar, btw, one bartender. So we take our turn, look at a menu, and get cash out so if she looks our way, we can quick order. So the menu is packed with fancy complicated drinks.   20 minutes later. Still no drink, some creepy drunk old man is talking us up.....great. finally he leaves, another old fat man sitting at the bar asks if we want a drink, we tell him we're still working on that, but she's just so busy, he said that we just need to be aggressive. He asks us what we want, we explain we want something smooth but not super strong, it is a wednesday night after all. He says the menu has plenty of smooth, mild drinks. But for $15 a drink, I don't want a fucking mild drink, it better knock me on my ass! So he told us to go somewhere else and that Smugglers Cove isn't meant for the cheap. Well, he can effin bite me.   15 minutes in line, 30 minutes in the bar, we leave, still no drink, and royally pissed off b/c of the customers.

wmBB4i0c-KuA4obI5x5Uxg.review_text: Phenomenal rum bar.  I felt like a pirate when I walked in here--especially after trekking in a bad neighborhood in SF.

XMK6EHt5Y9-oZp5GVinoxQ.review_text: Wait, what?  What is this place?  My girlfriend left her debit card here the night before when she was out with her friends, so we went here to pick it up before going out somewhere else -- but holy hell.  There are light up puffer fish hanging from the rafters.  There is water pouring down the walls into the well area in the basement.  You can get your drink in a $12 souvenir cup that sort of looks like a tiki predator.  There is fire everywhere.  Are you kidding me?  Needless to say, I got sucked in, and our plans of a cosmopolitan wine bar night were instantly thwarted by scorpion bowls and sea shanties, and before you know it, it was last call for rum drinks (and, by default, diabetes as well).  What can I say, I'm a sucker for whimsy.  Since you live in SF, you probably are too.  This is simple math.  Go here.

yW-GBoKnzyduaG86Y1NLzw.review_text: Not sure how much I like this place yet. Have not gotten one of their bowls, though I had plenty of other alcohol.  My friends evidently come here a lot. We met at 8PM for drinks one night, which is evidently early for this place. Got a bunch of seats upstairs, though I'm told the downstairs grotto is cooler. I'm wondering if it just makes people need to pee a lot though.  The environment is nice. A little too dark for me. Umm...someone turn up a light? I don't need glaring, but I can't read the bloody menu!   First drink I had was a painkiller. It comes in 2, 3, or 4 shots. I got 3 because the bartender recommended that...should have gotten 4. *sigh. Oh, well, they get a few more bucks off me.   The drink I liked the most was their dry float. I can't pronounce the first word. I call it a dry float. It comes "with a side of danger" and actually came WITH a side of another alcohol. Not sure if it's actually dangerous, but it was delicious. DELICIOUS.   This place seems like another one for the young drunks. When I sat down, my friends already saved seats from the last group to leave. Young blonde chick comes by multiple times to look for her jacket and bag. She touches ALL OF OUR STUFF digging around. Umm...I don't want your crap. If I saw it, I'd shove it at you. Not once, but THREE TIMES she comes back upstairs to look in our drinking area. The 3rd time, she lifted up my bag and threw my friends' jackets on the other chair...just looking for her shit. Definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over while expecting different results. Insane girl. Her bag?? Yeah, one of her friends had it. Thanks douche, if you just told this chick earlier she wouldn't have her grubby hands all over our stuff!  Supposedly they have the largest selection of rum on this side of the Mississippi. Or...in the USA. No idea. But its a large selection of rum.

h9Zm3RgXax2wOElC-HMe2g.review_text: Just came back from a lovely time at Smuggler's cove.  Since the closure of the Carnelian Room, I had to find my hot buttered rum here instead.  What a cool, little place.  It almost felt like we should know some password to get past the front door bouncer.  This place didn't even have signage that identified it, just the street address.  Prepare for it to be tiny and crowded, but aren't most establishments in San Francisco?  It has fun, kitschy decor that appealed to a prior sailor like me.  And my hot buttered rum did not disappoint.  I also had a cocktail called the Blonde Parisian cocktail that really kicked my carcass!!  Overall preferred the hot buttered rum.  Once we found a seat, my boyfriend and I were happy as clams.  Expect a wait at the bar (both the upstairs and downstairs bars), but the drinks are worth it.  This places feels like a locals' haunt, which I preferred as a tourist!  Would DEFINITELY go again.

jwKsSS7Rl5gvWfnc7XmMaA.review_text: I don't understand this place. I was super excited to go and happily waited the 45 minutes in line to get in, but goodness gracious it was suffocating inside. The place is TINY. There are 3 floors. The bottom floor is miserable because it is hot, crowded, and poorly situated. The bar is at the end of the narrow room and everyone is trying to get to it. There are 2 poor slow bartenders making elaborate drinks that take a very long time, and meanwhile there are barbacks constantly pushing past you with buckets of nasty water. It took at least 30 minutes to order a drink at that bar. The middle floor is also tiny, but more open. There are a few barstools around a bar, and you'll probably have better luck ordering there, even though you'll probably be unable to land a seat. Upstairs there's a little mezzanine area where private parties can sit around tables. If you are planning any type of gathering involving more than 1 other person, try to get up there.

chJyg2b09YQlwZqQrelpaA.review_text: Visited this joint last night and loved the place.  Best selection of rum in the city.  It's like a cool little pirate ship and it feels like you're cruisin' the south seas or the Caribbean.  It's a little small inside but it's rather cozy.  I highly recommend the hot buttered rum and the bambo.

dIQnYbjf-rTxn5dQoRr0bg.review_text: Cute and tropical - with a very extensive drink menu.

7rfBi8WiNHliL-cAqMGNew.review_text: First off, this place is great if you like themed places. Modeled after a pirate's ship everything was decked out in old pirate-y stuff.   Cute place but very unfriendly to noise. Apparently they have douchey neighbors.   I came here with a bunch of friends and ordered the Top Notch Volcano~  It was a fun drink that came in a skull and lit on fire!!!  Other than the noise issue and it being a bit cramped, this is an awesome place if you enjoy rum!   Apparently, they also have the largest selection of rum in the west coast and were featured in GQ magazine. (the bouncer told me)

JFUVjKVwYlmhFRp-g3Er6A.review_text: I came here on a friends recommendation and I do not regret it. I am a ehuge rum connoisseur so I have had this place on my list for a while. The ambience was relaxed, trendy, and casual and the crowd was a mix of people of all walks of life. The pirate ship theme was neat in the context that it wasn't overdone or cheesy. My girlfriend is not much of a rum drinker, but the bartenders were patient and more than willing to help her find a cocktail that would suit her preferences. Having lived in Haiti and spent a solid amount of time in the Dominican Republic, I longed for the simultaneously sweet, smooth, and strong Caribbean rum that is nearly impossible to find in the U.S. I highly recommend a Ron Barcelo Imperial on the rocks to anybody that is coming here to try different types of rum. The bartenders masterfully crafted my girlfriends cocktail, throwing out several garnishes before finding the one that best fit the visual of the drink. Will definitely be returning here!

j50SjbE_uFiuHgWXFjBLwA.review_text: From a tourist's perspective:  Noticing some people slipping into an unmarked door and quickly disappearing under the red light, we decided to check out what turned out to be the pre-game to a very fun night.  The friendly gentleman at the door noticed we were new to the establishment and gave us a quick run down of the bar.  Thanks for making us feel welcome!  The drinks?  Each one sounded more amazing than the next.  The bartenders broke it down in terms of how good we wanted to feel after the drinks.  Enough said!  I wish we had more time to try the Jamaican punch.  It sounded like dessert, but so did everything else on the menu!  We didn't want to spoil dinner so I'd recommend going after a good meal.

QVdqUnz4jpOVeZ5wJoAp2Q.review_text: We walked right by this place on the first pass.  While its unassuming front makes it seem hard to find people know it's there. Dark and tikki themed this hole on the wall fills up, with a small crowd waiting at the door before the doors open.  Why wouldn't they? The drinks are incredible. We tried hibiscus punch (not sure on the name but the hibiscus one) so good, well balanced, none of the drinks were overly sweet, but were all well balanced. Places like this make me sad I left the Bay Area, because nothing else compares.

-mXeKyLof7RicLOkQ2HEWw.review_text: This is one of my favorite places to go have a drink or meet up with some friends.  First thing, it's a tiki bar!  Could be tacky, but the drinks are the real deal so it's awesome.  If you're walking around looking for it you might miss it.  There really isn't much of a sign, just a darkened out door.  Look for that bouncer looking guy randomly on the street, that'll be your sign.  The place isn't really that big so it gets crowded and might be hard to find seating.  They have a bar on the first and lower floors.  The upper floor is just seating.  The lower floor has tables you can grab if you have a bigger group.  I wouldn't suggest having more than 6 people in your party.  2-4 is probably more ideal imho.  Drinks-wise they mostly do rum based drinks, but do have the other stuff.  Pretty much everything is good.  Just read the descriptions and choose what you're in the mood for.  If it says it's got milk or coconut creme, it'll be kinda rich.  If it's got pineapple juice, it'll probably be sweet, etc.  The little Rum Barrel by drinks mean they're deceptively strong (yum).  It's pretty amazing to watch the bartenders at work.  Each drink is a whole process so appreciate it!  The presentation for some of the drinks are also elaborate.  I believe there's one that's to share that actually has fire in it.  You can also get some signature drinks and leave with a little cup souvenir.  It can take a while to get up to the bar and get your next order in when it's busy so plan ahead if you're nearing the end of your drink and might want another.  If you are a true connoisseur I believe they have a separate menu that's just aged rums.  I haven't tried this out, but I'm perfectly happy with the drinks they make.  Overall very fun, chill place.  Love coming here.

iBHyoUQ2WQ6ShFIEcjmR1A.review_text: This place definitely wins points for the cool decor and unique spin on things!  From a bartender's POV:  When you go to an Irish pub, you always know what to expect: Dark atmosphere, some Guinness on tap, and with some luck- a lively and outgoing crowd. When you approach the sign-less building marked with only a red light and a green light surrounding the entrance, you definitely don't know what in the name of Hey-seuss awaits you...It's the freakin Black Pearl! Very cool.  The crowd seems to be sort of a tame, mid-30's group of folks. The bartenders seem really cool, and have passion for their drink-making, which is awesome!  Here's the trouble:  1) You're gonna wait outside in line at least 15-20 minutes even if you get there early (9PM) on a Friday night.  2) When you get inside, you can't believe how small the quarters are. Seriously, I'm not picky, but this is exactly like going to see a Metallica show right when the band gets on stage, and everyone squishes together, making it impossible to move. The band in this case is the bar. The intoxicators pouring all those rum drinks are the super heroes, and for good reason, man! To hang around in this cramped bar, you need some drinks!  3) Although the drinks are really cool-looking and use very creative ingredients, they're not going to impress most people. BUT! Given the fact that you just paid $15 for a cocktail, you almost feel like you have to lie and say it's the most amazing Rum drink you ever had.  4) These are high-end gourmet drinks, and they take time to make. Considering the lines to get into the building, and then to the bar are so long, you sadly will be waiting a long time for a drink. I dragged my friends here, and understandably, they were pretty grumpy by the time our drinks when in our hands. When you have to wait an hour to get your first drink, you're bound to not give a place 5 stars ;-)  Yes, it is a long shopping list of time-related complaints, but the drinks and cool decor help make up for it.  Bottom line: Would probably be awesome on a Tuesday night when the wait for a drink is less than an hour. I personally would go somewhere else on a Friday or Saturday night, so you can party with your crew, rather than wait in lines. Oh, and the Smuggler's Barrel is pretty tasty! (Doh! Awkward ending!)

HRZxaxoIOszCFCZ06EbpZQ.review_text: Love the pirate theme and love, love, love the drinks. Really wonderful handmade cocktails are a special thing, and I do love me some rum. Might have to make this a regular spot.

FRSoGLPQI16pus03avyaSA.review_text: One of the best themed cocktails bars in SF. Granted, I recall when Smuggler's Cove was Jade Bar. Some of you kids probably were too young to remember, eh?  Smuggler's Cove is a pirate fan's dream. The interior decor is straight up like something from The Pirates of the Caribbean set, sans Captain Jack of course.  Anyway, this place on street level is easy to miss as there's no big signage or anything like that. Bar is tiny, despite the 3 levels, so don't be surprised if you have to wait in line outside to imbibe. Locals know what night(s) to come to escape the mad crowds.. ok, I'll say not to come on Friday or Saturday nights.:-0  The bartenders know their stuff here, so TRUST in them! Depending on how crowded it is, you might have to wait a bit for a drink, but they are worth the wait. My favs are the Hibiscus punch and Kona Cocktail....I mean, who doesn't love fruit or flowers in their drink? AND you will see guys drinking with either fruit or flowers in their drink, so props to them for owning it!   Great selections of cocktails here, especially rum, and if you're not game for those kind of drinks, draft beer and wine are here, too.  Ok mateys, see you at Smuggler's Cove! Arrrrghh.....

pv1bhIG4xp1VyDj-Y5TYKA.review_text: Great decor, drinks and atmosphere. A must visit barrrrrrgh if you're in SF!

2bFJ_32zzj7w84-HAwc3lw.review_text: One of the things I absolutely love about San Francisco is those random, tucked away places that are indiscriminate on the outside, but a hidden gem on the inside.  I didn't know what to expect from Smuggler's Cove, and I hate to ruin the surprise for anybody who does go in...but imagine a Disneyland-like themed bar mashup with pirates and a tiki lounge.   Intrigued?  You should be.  There is a ridiculously impressive list of cocktails, most with rum.  It's a RUM bar, people...hence, pirate...grog...you catching the drift (no pun intended)?  Anyway, back to the impressive list of cocktails - yes, there are some with (gasp) no rum in it that are very tasty.  Ingredients include fresh muddled fruit and spices...and it takes about 10 minutes to make a drink.  They are mixologist masters, not simple-minded liquid pour-ers!  Tips?  It gets CROWDED during the weekends...just based on the throng of people waiting to smuggle inside.  For the laid back feeling of having a place to yourself, try it out Monday-Thursday night.    The punch bowl is pretty fantastic, with flames and a skull to boot.  Don't steal the bowl because it's just not nice...oh, and they do take a deposit on your credit card to make sure you don't happen to throw one under your shirt or in your oversized hobo bag purse.  By the way, this is NOT one of those places for those manly men out there who just like ONLY SIMPLE drinks like scotch on the rocks and NOTHING ELSE...though you can get that here.  It's just kind of a waste. These are GOOD cocktails (i.e., mostly on the sweet side i would imagine).  And if you don't drink them, I will judge you.

QQv2tPG5NfQJvQDoZO7ehA.review_text: OK So  was really excited to check this place out!  Pirate bar, YES!!!  I was really surprised to find we had to stand in a line to get in, but i realized why when we were finally let in- not very big.  I DO see why they do this otherwise a million people crammed into a small space fighting to get a drink= SUCKS!  We decided to stick it out.  Generally speaking, I DO NOT stand in lines to get into bars, EVER.   Once in, I thought the decor was cool, reminded me a bit of Pirates of the Caribbean (good thing ) but something was lacking... oh wait, there was NO music playing....for a long time...   Went up to the bar to grab a drink, waited A LONG time for drinks to be made.  I realize that when a bartender has to make fancy rum drinks it takes longer , but shouldn't take FOREVER!  Also, would have been nice if the bartender was more engaging.  0 conversation and friendliness factor= 0!  She was basically a machine slinging drinks behind the bar.  It seems that the bartenders are lacking PERSONALITY overall. There were 2 bartenders, but the other bartender was SORT of taking drink orders and seemed spaced out a bit. Another thing, I don't like the use of the measuring cup thingy to measure out alcohol content  in each drink, it makes me feel like the bartender doesn't know what he/she is doing.  It gives a very amateurish vibe in my opinion.    Um, what's up with the t-shirts as the bartenders' uniform?  Please, a little more effort!   Drinks were mediocre- too much crushed ice in the Mai Tai and the Pupule.  Not bad, but just not GREAT. Crowd was random, not really my scene.  Some obnoxious douche bags (LOUD) at the table next to us= ANNOYING!   I wouldn't come back to this place unfortunately, I was disappointed to say the least.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: Now coming here a second time (totally sober), I felt I needed to write an update to my previous review. I love this place because I have a love for pirates and pirate themed drinks/decor. Before I remembered the place being cool, and it still is, but even cooler now that I really got a chance to admire the interior and features. The drinks are amazing, and super strong. I honestly felt tipsy after my first drink. Cheers to being a cheap date! They are also creative and tropical...yum. Next time I want to come with a group of 4 and try the skull punch bowl, which is lit on fire and comes with 4 super long straws- so cool! However, coming here tired is not a good idea. Downstairs the lighting is so dim, and the drinks so strong, that I was starting to feel super sleepy. They definitely need to be consumed faster to prevent this from happening.

z14ezmDNQDqdE8MXcygyeA.review_text: Great atmosphere, delicious drinks.  Always have a good time when I stop here, and have yet to have a bad drink.  The bartenders here are incredibly knowledgeable about their rum, and if you're not sure what to order, they'll probably give you a good recommendation!

ds80rvQ4OS_LMuyPs1HkFA.review_text: Everything about this place is super interesting. The decor, drinks and people. If you like Rum, I meant if you LOVE Rum, this place is definitely for you. They have a great selection of mix-not-so-girly drinks. Which I love.   I've tried few mix drinks here before but my favorite has always been just plain rum and coke. YUM! They use sugar cane coke for all their drinks which makes this drink super delish!   If you're in town stop by and have few drinks with the other thirsty pirates. Make sure to arrive early (before 10pm) as it could get pretty crowded. Also, service is really slow even the times when it wasn't crowded. So bring some cash and try to flash the bartenders, maybe you'll get better service, who knows?  Have fun and get yo drink on!

ReDoGveUTyzlfC0bZOQ3bA.review_text: I guess I can't really hang with pirates.. even faux kitschy pirates in the tenderloin because I don't remember anything after the volcano. The mark of a good night?

A3uxz-5umsjoiiIPMdK6Qw.review_text: Once you finally find Smuggler's Cove, walk in, and wait for your eyes to transition to this super-dark bar, you'll feel like you found secret buried treasure.  Sit back in any of the three intimate bar areas sipping your expertly poured festive rum drink, enjoy the tiki-themed atmosphere, and chat up the wonderful bar staff and patrons.    It shivered me timbers or some sort of pirate speak.

3icpLdSpwYS9a03U4AFL8A.review_text: DAMN.  Who ever designed this place has quite the eye for detail. It puts Pirates of the Caribean to shame.  Even if you are not into the tropical/nautical look, you have to go and see this bar. The decor is outstanding. I myself am a hard core tikiphile although SC is not a "tiki" bar, per se, there is enough throughout  to compare to one (glass floats, puffer fish, tiki mugs, etc.)  The  bar is tri-level, main floor with bar, a larger basement with bar and a small loft overlooking the main floor.  You have to go downstairs to order your drink.  Let's get to the drinks, AWESOME. They don't taste strong but they can pack a punch.  The only downside, the wait to get a drink handcrafted for you.  That's right, this is no rum, orange juice and pineapple juice bar.  Your drink will have several shots of different rums, juices, bitters and other mixes in it.   This is one of my favorites, right up there with Frankie's Tiki Room & Forbidden Island.

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: I'm not sure we would have gotten in to Smuggler's Cove if it wasn't my friends birthday and we didn't have a girl in our group but it all worked out and we were able to get in in front of the line.  I was glad we were able to too because we had a really fun time here.  The decor is exactly what you think it's be like and very similar to the Tonga Room but without the floating stage and band.  The bartenders there were super friendly and willing to make drinks based on your preference since it was hard to read through the entire menu.  My first drink I had had the "hot" sauce in it and it had a bit of a bite but was really tasty.  For my finale I had the smuggler's cove which was really good and am sure had a lot of alcohol in it.  All in all we had a really good time here and if there wasn't a line I'm sure we'd be back more often.

6pfzQZnO_t1IPGd942V3Ng.review_text: This place is so cool! My friend heard about this spot and we almost drove past it! But we made it inside and fell in love with the pirate decor. So many rums! Haha and the drink menu is killer. Bartenders are great!! As i was unfamiliar with the drinks, he knew excatly what I was in the mood for with a few simple questions. Would have gotten 5 stars but the drinks are pretty pricey. Regardless, I will be back for more

BXI-AkV2HN9qa2dauWqFtA.review_text: The night we came, it was very crowded with very young people. I had my doubts, but luckily we found seats easily. The menu is huge; there are mostly rum cocktails ranging from the historical  to the classic, along with a variety of new creations and the typical tiki- tropical fruit and sugar-syrup drinks. Wanting to avoid the latter, I read the ingredients carefully and ordered the "corn and oil " cocktail from Barbados . There wasn't any corn or oil in it, and there was no added sugar or chemically-tasting mixers in it . It was just pure dark rum and some kind of Caribbean liquor.  It wasn't cheap, because the rum used wasn't cheap. It was EXTREMELY strong.  We were able to get our drinks quickly, which was surprising considering how packed it was. The crowd was actually very friendly and nice. No attitude or rudeness here. Definately not like similar bars catering to the same age group in LA or Santa Barbara.  It was fun, and we'll be back.  PS: There is no.sign.  Look for the light, the line, and the big ol' bouncer.

VVtaIyZH1Mpq7swC5lwWnQ.review_text: Fun place but too much attitude at the door. The place isn't even busy and yet a bouncer outside slowly lets people in. I was there with a group and after waiting for a while, about 10 of us decided to leave. It was only 6pm!  The bouncer quickly tried to save us by giving us the honor of entering. But we were already decided. There are plenty of places with good (better?) drinks without the line.

mHjb1Kx94tL08Sv2BxhBuQ.review_text: Really good drinks. The biggest downfall is that they don't have any good music. A lot of silent awkwardness. Play some good music and this place would be a gem

g9OnleEFs-uWjx9OrXhW1Q.review_text: If you're idea of a good time involves waiting in a line only to get into a hot, steamy,  pirate bar with tropical drinks then you should definitely go here. If not, I'd skip it.

rKkpHJkJ27xOwnhy_bMkvA.review_text: Great atmosphere and the bar staff is VERY friendly.  The menu is a bit overwhelming, so I just told the bartender what type of drinks I liked and he whipped something up for me.

NgkGNXVnCaRiv0xzvStMmA.review_text: This is a true gem in San Francisco.  A friend recently told me about Smuggler's Cove and I couldn't wait to pay a visit.    I almost passed it up on the street.  I love feeling like I am going to a secret club and being transported to another world.  I was greeted by a really nice door man who complimented me immediately and gave us the rundown on the menu and location.    At the bar we were greeted by a really nice bartender (sorry I didn't get his name).  My friend and I asked him to just make us whatever he felt like making.  He picked the perfect drinks for us.  Next we shared the Top Shelf Volcano which was set on fire.  FUN!  But also the best tropical rum drink I have EVER had.  I love the decor and the staff.  Everyone there was happy and fun-loving.  I read the menu for about a half hour.  Great menu.   I can't wait to return with more friends.

gBfSPasNour2afLmiDdOkg.review_text: Smuggler's Cove is definitely one of the better tiki bars I have been to.  And definitely worth a visit or two if you're in the Bay Area.  All of the tiki drinks I was able to sample, were well crafted and perfectly balanced.  I can't recall the name of the drink I had, but it was divine and very refreshing.  Basically it was a mix of light rum, coconut water, lime, and mint.  So very tasty.  And I have been able to somewhat recreate it at home, whenever I'm in the tiki mood.

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: Is this really  "Woohoo! As good as it gets!?" Eff yes it is, if you do it properly! I think you have a to have a lot of "bar" street smarts/common sense to go here.   I mean... if you french fry when you're supposed to pizza, you're gonna to have a bad time. Don't be dumb:  1. Don't come here with a group. Especially a large group. Srsly.  2. Don't come here on a weekend night. 3. Don't plan your evening around this bar. Have 1 drink here. Not 10. Why? 4. Realize you're going to pay $10 for a drink. That is why you have ONE.  5. It's a pirate bar. Don't try to make it something its not- i.e., a regular bar, a dive bar, a gathering place.  6. Don't come here at happy hour. Either get here extremely early, or extremely late.  7. Don't tell all your friends about it- especially ones prone to doing 1-6. Telling more people increases your wait time.   On the other hand, it's a pirate themed bar. It's like you get to drink while on the Pirates of the Caribbean ride at Disneyland- without Disneyland! (I'm actually not sure if that is a good thing or not for several reasons, but it would take too long to explain.)

hFCUoOVs1rA4FX9Vps9fsg.review_text: The pirate theme and tiki lounge decor makes the Smuggler's Cove even more fun and inviting. The bartenders know their stuff. One was providing a couple of gentlemen on a rum lesson and he definitely knew what he was talking about! I came just to have a flaming drink. Literally. 4 of us ordered the Volcano and cheered when our bartender lit the sugar cubes on fire for a mini show. The drink itself was not too sweet and had a nice kick to it. They warn that good drinks take time to make. Let them take their time because it's worth it!

y24s5qgDbBCGSF7yqApFtw.review_text: I personally didn't love it here, but I can see how some people would. It has a very different atmosphere than most bars, which is cool. The bar area downstairs makes you feel like you are in a cabin of a boat. There is a cool water stream with rocks and maybe fish (I don't remember). When we first came in, there was no music playing. By the time we left, music was playing very softly, but you really had to put your ear up to the speakers to hear it. Kind of weird to be in a bar with no music.  As for drinks, they do have a lot of cool options. I don't like really sugary drinks so I got a mojito, which was good and strong, but not too strong. The other people I was with got sugary drinks, which were extremely strong, which is good if you want to get drunk, but they tasted terrible.  I would probably come back just because it's fun and different, but It's not my typical favorite bar.

82rc1P7_dhUVggF5gWlMTw.review_text: This place is super rad. If you like Pirates of the Caribbean at Disneyland imagine alcoholic Pirates of the Caribbean. WOAH. The menu is awesome, there are so many good drinks to choose from and some come in cool little tiki cups or barrels. Not to mention the ones on fire that you can share with friends. Bartenders are super friendly. And very generous with Le Alcohol.   For all you youngins reading this review don't try bringing a fake because I'm 21 and he barely believed my real id. I also look like a 12 year old though.   P.s the front of the bar is very basic and normal looking so don't expect to pull up to a pirate ship.   Cheers.

VgyW1zOcOYzjpicHcAG3dQ.review_text: To add to all the other positive reviews, this place is fantastic! They have a great menu for cocktails whether you're feeling the Havana inspired rum drinks, old classics, or something new. I personally really enjoyed the Blonde Parisian. You ask for rum here? They'll give it to you! Strong drinks and an atmospheric vibe calls for a fun evening out. Arrived around 9:30pm on a Saturday night and there was no wait to get in, but the bar starts getting busy around 10pm.   Anyways, great service! According to my boyfriend who patiently waited for our drinks, Christopher was great! Even after my glass accidentally slipped out of my hands due to flamboyant hand gestures he got right to it and couldn't have been cooler about it. Thanks!

T0LjZ4CqV2oXZqjjfY4oAw.review_text: Loved the look and feel of the bar! Went late on a Tuesday night and it was still fairly crowded. Good menu selection - rum drinks! Tried the kona and loved it. Given this place 4 stars bc of temperature control- seemed really warm inside and wasn't super crowded or warm outside.

002slNgnEtAvsNYFLw7rGA.review_text: I wanted to hate this place, if for nothing else that all my douchey hipster friends love it. I also generally don't like rum, or fruity drinks.  Went here for the first time the other day and have to admit, it was awesome. Bartenders make really fascinating rum-based drinks that weren't cloyingly sweet, electric-blue, or festooned with little umbrellas.  In a random office building on a dead block in Hayes Valley - will definitely take out of towners here to make them feel like I know what's up.  Particularly good for a lower-key weekday drink - this is not a place that would be good if it were packed.

3vwYSQlR22JKfXYSaktq0Q.review_text: We went here based on the "Top 50 bars" designation and I thought it was a mixed bag.  The theme is obviously pretty fun, the crowd was hip/foodie and the staff were all very cool but the experience all up didn't make me want to come back any time soon.  The first obvious comparisons to this place are those throwbacks of tiki yesteryear like the nearby Tonga Room and Trader Vics, the key difference being that his place is pretty tiny compared to those venerable bastions of giant electric blue libations.  I suppose this place feels a little more nautical and YARRR!! appointed compared to those two, and theme is generally a lot more evident on a moment-to-moment basis because of the size of the space.  The drinks are also very comparable: scorpions, zombies and rum punches are all well-prepared, giant, sugary and ineffective - one double of your favorite hard stuff will wreck you a lot quicker than anything you'll consume in here (your size depending!)  I'd recommend trying the Puka Punch as it has about a billion different rums mixed in and tastes pretty good.  If you've got a big group of people then proceed straight to the Scorpion because other wise I think you're missing the whole point of coming to a place like this (plus lots of really long straws, flames, awkward angles to sip and sugary booze is a guaranteed recipe to fun!)

JGnqasIkGMLfSejt7mw9qQ.review_text: It can't get any better than premium rum, sassy pirates, nautical decor, and outstanding bartenders. I gave Smuggler's Cove 5 stars in my initial review; after visiting a few more times, it deserves plenty more stars than that. This is one of the best bars in the Bay, let alone one of the the best tiki lounges!  I came with my bestie and our night unfortunately started on a sour note. We drove ALL the way to SF and snatched a nearby parking spot only to find out as we approached the line that my friend forgot her ID. Womp womp. The bouncer, Carlos, was super cool and awesome. Nah, he didn't let us in anyway (that's illegal, y'all!). He told us if we came back (with her ID), we can skip to the front and he'll let us in. So that's what we did. Yup, we drove ALL the way back to the East Bay and then ALL the way back to the city because that is how mesmerizing Smuggler's Cove is. We walked to the front of the line, Carlos was surprised we actually did return but as promised, he let us in, handed us a menu and directed us to the bottom floor (there are 3 floors) to order our drinks because the bar down there was not as crowded. Totally helpful and charming! When we returned to the ground floor with our drinks, he informed us a big party just left on the top floor (mezzanine) so we walked up the stairs and found lots of sitting room. He also suggested some great drinks!   Smuggler's Cove is cozy and hip with a dash of Caribbean magic. The bartenders and drinks are excellent--full of character, delight and spirit! Yes, it's tiny and packed but that just adds to the fun and lively atmosphere.   Here are a few tips/highlights for y'all:  - Parking is relatively easy to find along McAllister. However, the area is somewhat shady. - Be prepared for a long line. The venue is small (maximum capacity of 50ish people). There was a line at 8:30pm on a Friday night. What?!  - Tantalizing drinks with fruity and exotic flavors like the Batida and Painkiller (for the coconut lovers), and enough alcohol to give you a nice buzz. I also recommend the hibiscus rum punch.  - Chat with the bartenders; they are quite entertaining and hilarious.  - Enjoy being transported to a tropical paradise! (Sometimes with real pirates!...OK, there was a birthday party where everyone dressed up in pirate costumes. Legit.)   Argh matey!

jhPAC7UyPiRFNPlNQYMMXg.review_text: hooooly schmoorrrrkes Bartmawwwwnnn *slurred speech*  Behind this unmarked, unassuming door is a bar has some STRONG drinks! When I hear "tiki bar", I think of a tourist-trap bar with watered-down, sugary and nasty drinks. Definitely not this place. Not only do they have some amazing knowledge of rum, but they really know how to put the kick in their deceivingly-fruity drinks.  The barrel icon next to the drink name in the menu means that it's REALLY strong. Just two of those and I was completely drunk. Those of you who know me that I'm usually a tank, so that just goes to show how strong those drinks are. Oh, by the way, one of them had an umbrella in my drink. Did anyone ever tell you to never judge a book by its cover, or a drink by its decorations?  Pro tip: $2 off a drink at happy hour (first hour after opening). Also, their drinks do take a long time to make, so just be prepared for that.

rajqPKsA2IXctM0nI-xHOA.review_text: This place is cool! It's kind of in the middle of nowhere for me, but I've gone a couple times now. I haven't managed to find a drink that I love.. but the menu is pretty extensive, so I'll keep trying things, and the atmosphere is cool, kind of like a 60's tiki bar. I've definitely met some interesting people every time I've been here.. in a good and bad way. Will definitely be back.

FCHVn7Z7PgHJqiL7gEb7Ow.review_text: MMM. RUM.  Excellent cocktails, fun and cheesy tiki decor. Friendly and welcoming staff. Great date spot.   If your looking for a mini vaca in the city, head to the cove for a nice Caribbean getaway. Seriously one of the best bars in San Francisco. The painkiller #2 is fantastic! Like a grown up piña colada. We also really enjoyed the Puka Punch and the Kona Cocktail.  After the 3rd cocktail I think I started to speak pirate. Arrgh. ;D

oll1HXY5AKFZebo_KBZ7xw.review_text: I've been here three times and really, really wanted to like it. The pirate decor, the stiff cocktails, the waterfall - whats not to love!? I could only be blinded by these cheap frills for so long.   The deal breakers for Smugglers Cove. 1) Bad Bouncer 2) Sausage Fest 3) Stinks  4) Poor Acoustics   The bouncer here is a total amateur. This is a Hayes Valley Bar, with 20-somethings/ post grads, wrapped up in Banana Republic gear. There really isn't any need to have an asshole bouncer "maintain order" with these kids. I can't believe I went back three times and let this guy boss me around.   The ratio here must be 5:1. Dudes everywhere! Single ladies beware, these men aren't afraid to laugh about a smelly belch or fart with their buddies. It is seriously a fart show! Leading to #3 -   Whatever goes on in the bathroom, is sure to be known in the bar. It's a small bar and turns to Fart Boy's Cove, real quick! On a positive note, after one stiff cocktail you wont notice this stink. Drink up!   The downstairs has poor acoustics causing it to be loud and echoy.   With all of that said, the bartenders and drinks here are amazing! And of course, I love that pirate decor. Best of luck Smugglers ~

mX6gX6CZtOSQQbMy2zK1Cg.review_text: The hot buttered rum is a like liquid dessert.

QMvKdCyjwCzqQey1Y32nKQ.review_text: Hot buttered rum!  This gem is hidden just steps away from Hayes Valley (or in Hayes Valley) and has no signage I could spot.  Watch your street numbers...  Inside is an oasis of tiki cocktail culture, with multiple levels and bars to meet your flaming booze needs.  Craft cocktails in this amazing setting?  Yes, this place is not your typical tiki spot.

FX8LA_6o9DqaFIZ5fXkM4Q.review_text: Went here on a Friday night. Fantastic rum cocktails (I had a mojito and tried a few others). Generally the ambience was nice and the decoration was cool, but we found it to be way too crowded and loud for us, so we left quite quickly.

PVVJ7UCIDJLChswlpW1owQ.review_text: Great drinks, not too too pricey considering the designer venue. Last time I was there the bartender was really rude though- Sometimes I like to TALK TO YOU LIKE A HUMAN so eeeexcuuuuuse me! I'm only taking one star off for that though, because I'm there for my friends and the cool venue not the bartender, anyways.  I definitely want to don a mermaid costume and sit on the rock in the little pond! :D

JtVxBYcJohBtyR-MmbMFHw.review_text: Hot buttered rum + suffering bastards and you are set.  Yeah, it's small.  Yeah, it's tough to get in.  Yeah, it's tough to find parking.  But after 5 minutes with a Zombie or Fog Cutter in hand, you won't care one bit.  Best bar in downtown SF hands down.

YHffUoAgMM4KIqYC755tnA.review_text: Waited in line. Not too bad of a wait. Want a seat? Get there early. Otherwise, good luck! On to the drinks: The bolas... Ehhh Pricey and mediocre at it's best. The painkiller was probably the best drink of the night. But let's get to the root of this review: THE BOUNCER. He has a SERIOUS problem with women. I completely 100% agree and understand you should check IDs and be sure it's the person but the way he talked to us was so uncalled for. He might have mommy issues. This would explain why he degrades women and treats us like crap.

SRoXqp2N36a0-M-NBRM5Vw.review_text: I'd say go to this bar if you are in SF for a drink, but not for a night of drinking. The atmosphere is really cool and the drinks are awesome. We arrived slightly before five and had to wait 15 minutes to get up to the bar to order, then we waited 40 minutes for our drinks. And yes, they were awesome. But not sure I would go again.

9WHv9CipQpF-lxrpm4WP8g.review_text: So I've been yelping for a while now, but have NEVER given a 1 star review.  This is my first, and sad to say, it goes to Smuggler's Cove.  I've heard a lot of things about this place, mostly good - about how it truly resembles a pirate ship, the drinks, etc., and so when a friend suggested heading over here after a birthday dinner, I readily agreed.  We had a pretty large group (about 12 of us), and got to the bar at about 10:30 pm. There were maybe 10-15 (def no more than that) in front of us. I was thinking ok, we shouldn't be in line for longer than 30 mins max. Well, I was VERY wrong. It took us ONE hour to get in (more than I've ever waited in line at a club/bar in my LIFE.) It wasn't so bad if the bouncer was nice or reasonable, but he threw a bunch of F-bombs at us because my friend said "wow, really?" when he tried to split our group into 3 when he originally said it would be 2 groups (5 and 7) of us.   When we FINALLY got into the bar (a little after 11:30 pm), we tried to order our drinks. One of my friends ordered the Scorpion, and the bouncer kept asking us sarcastically if we had a PHYSICAL table - I'm not kidding, he must've asked us FIVE times. OF COURSE we had a table - why would we order such a huge drink if we didn't? We even had to get our friend to wave at the bartender downstairs to PROVE that we had a table.   I left shortly after, but I heard they were even more rude to my friends after that. Sure, some places have bad service, but how can you swear and threaten your customers?   WILL NEVER GO BACK.

CpTcmQAdYuYo9Y5Ck18dow.review_text: If you want to get drunk, this is the place to get drunk. Strong drinks and there's a drink to satisfy everyone's taste, sweet, bitter, whatever it will get you wasted. Come early, cuz it can be difficult to find a table especially if you want to try one of those bowls you drink out with a really long straw with your friends. Parking is plenty in this residential neighborhood. Just be careful and lock your stuff because it's close to the projects. Bouncer can be a bit rude, just cooperate. Ambience is loud and dark, decorated like a ship with a water fountain in the lower level. Great place to come with friends.

alwpfhvEkiNuwxNa29O7og.review_text: From the street, you'd never know it this was here.  But wait until you walk inside.  The pirate/ship theme decor was really well done and it was a great novelty.  They have a variety of rum concoctions and an extensive list of aged rums.  We met friends there and it was a fun evening. We ordered the Volcano drink meant to be shared.  It comes in a large skull and has a flaming tower of ice in the center.  Great fun, and a good drink too!  Good place to stop with friends after dinner.

YdbvKA27AazwRdIY-FRbWw.review_text: Went here on Sunday for Domindo de Pina! WOW! Exquisite cocktails served in Pineapples? No wai? Ya wai!!!  We had a chance to sample five drinks this day:  In no particular order:  England's Dreaming (By Christine England): A fantastic combination of Passion fruit, cinnamon, rum and chocolate mole bitters! I love their use of mole bitters, and the drink was "off the chain"! Everyone in our group agreed it was fantastic, and I personally thought it was great.  Apocalypse (By Alex Smith): The name suits the potency, and this drink is not to be taken lightly. It's power is surpassed only by it's deliciousness; a deadly combination. Using Orgeat, Licor43, campari, rum and gin, Alex has created a delicious island combination worthy of being served in Martin's exquisitely prepared vessals. Hands down AMAZING.  Polynesian Paralysis (Circa 1960): A very spiritous cocktail, containing bourbon, orgeat, demerara sugar, and bourbon. Yummy, and it definitely tasted better once you got halfway done with it.  Mastodon (By Alex Smith): This drink is not on the menu, we were lucky enough to have tablemates who were well versed in the capabilities of our bartender. It's a combination of bourbon, marashino liqueur, rum, and a bit of pixie dust, made whole on the canvas of our Pineapple. Yummy, but very spiritous. I liked it, but as our companions said "it'll put some hair on your chest".  Batida de maracuja e coco: Yummy! :D. Cachaca, condensed milk, and coconut milk, and maracuja (passion fruit) and we had the privilege of having it served in a pineapple!  All in all a great day at the cove, I STRONGLY suggest attending the next Domingo de Pina, it's a great time out.  TL;DR: Cool spot, potent drinks, sundays of the pineapple rock, check it out.

AVSylpAISyFs1cDryDpskQ.review_text: Great ambience.  Saw some tables having the Volcano, which involved live flames and was quite a show.  I had the Dead Reckoning, which was good but not quite as fresh / refreshing as I had expected with a drink with pineapple & lemon.  Not quite enough zing to elevate the sweetness for me, but props for it not being overpoweringly sweet.

s_ZW27rAqH0T32WnfoWbDg.review_text: Great execution of a pirate period tortuga-esque setting, however kitschy it may be. Inside smelled a lot like waiting inline at Pirates of the Caribbean, probably because of the water fountain and plastic wooden planks and decor. Lighting and ambience is charming. I noticed I was able to hear my conversations very clear despite the bar being completely packed. The drink menu was well designed to match the setting and featured tons of gimmicky and pricey rum drinks. Service was a bit slow and the drinks were not mixed well, but I'm gonna give this place the benefit of the doubt considering it was opening weekend and the volume was unforeseen.

mjh59ub7cCjvR2rBzjEaFg.review_text: Thoroughly enjoyed flaming tiki drinks here last night.  Also liked the fact that it's not so loud that all conversation involves shouting, and the drinks were tasty and interesting.  I didn't actually order any drinks, so I can't really comment on the service, but it seemed friendly enough.  It does take a little while for them to make drinks, they brought them out after they were ordered at the bar.  They also had no problem with me stashing my folding bike next to where we were sitting.  It does seem to get busy later in the evening, there was a line when we left.  I actually appreciated this as the place wasn't ridiculous packed.

lU-uq3hfVzGEZfYYon9fwA.review_text: Refused service to my mother who has a service dog. They do not allow animals regardless of what the law allows. Horrible place. Who does that?

mnQGJ5HZOeVobfCzVKqYkg.review_text: By far my favorite bar on the planet.   Every bartender is absolutely phenomenal and manages to make long series of ridiculously complex cocktails for twenty different people and they'll still manage to call you by your first name when they finish your drink. If that weren't enough, the drinks themselves are the best I have had anywhere, and this coming from a guy that travels to a different state every week and spends unreasonable amounts of money on alcohol in each of them. I'm not just talking about the taste either... I have walked out of this place completely bombed on several occasions and have yet to wake up with a hangover. The ingredients are all such high quality and the recipes so wonderfully put together that you can drink and drink and drink and never worry about waking up near death the next day.   This place is perpetually crowded (and deservedly so) but the vibe remains completely chill and the drinks remain accessible. The pirate theme is done to the extreme and perfectly so, and even when there is a line out there the door, it never gets too hard to find a spot for you and your friends to enjoy the best drinks in San Francisco... And probably anywhere else, for that matter.   I visit this place every chance I get and drag anyone uninitiated through its (incredibly low-key, borderline sketchy-looking) door several times a week if I can help it. You can expect to pay a bit more than you might at a less special bar, but It is so completely worth it. Five out of five hardly seems sufficient to express my love for the place,  but that is all Yelp will let me give it.

NgESq2zSYZEkHIojIJtIkw.review_text: The place is a pirates bar.  Entering is like visiting the Pirates of the Caribbean ride at Disneyland.  There's a water fountain two or three levels high, the interior looks like a boat, and the bartenders look like pirates.  The menu is extensive and creative, I believe one of the best bar menus in the SF scene to date.  I love coming there after dinner for my after-dinner dessert drink.  My buddy is trying to drink every drink on the menu.  It's a great place to have a conversation as they've figured out the acoustics and don't try to squeeze too many people in.  The place is awesome!

3v1fuM42pNdrxuO-3fvCNQ.review_text: As Jack Sparrow says, 'But why is the rum gone !?' It all went to Smuggler's Cove and mixed in some of the best drinks I have ever tried. Drinks are strong and taste like treasure. Money money. I tried the Caribeno, Three Dots and a Dash, Kona Cocktail, and I don't remember the rest... Came here with a group of friends and took over the entire top floor. Just chilling with great company in one of the best piratey ambience. Bartender is knowledgeable and competes internationally in mixology. Arrive early, this place can get packed!   Check out the list of drinks...http://smugglerscovesf.com/trapdoor/­tasting-notes/drink-menu/ Username: asdf@go.com Password: asdf Enjoy!

K7-zOceF1slgqJTZSKe7YQ.review_text: Arrrrr! Who doesn't like a pirate-themed bar?! Great drinks and great decor!

8ZoaA2L0vMcA3HhsR601IA.review_text: Opened December 8th Smuggler's Cove features a huge range of rum-based cocktails ranging from tiki style to classic creations from times past. The ambiance is  tropical with waterfalls and vintage memorabilia. As its not too far from our house I love it!   Get the Zombie level 3, its flooring!

jsxNHAaLcHkkd3QYG5xSzg.review_text: We went there on a saturday night, knew it was going to be crowded, but as we stood in line, we were warned by the super cool door guy that the line moves very slowly, cause they have a limited capacity of like 39 people. So indeed, even though there were only a few people in front of us, it still took about 30 minutes to get in.   The interior is really neat, totally pirate cove. The place is really small, hence the limited capacity. The drink menu is impressive, as is the assortment of fun rums to be had.   Drinks are made very carefully, and cost about $12 each. They tasted great, HOWEVER....I did notice that most if not all the drinks that were being made were topped off with crushed ice. So like, after they shake the drink and pour into the glass, the glass was not filled up, so it is topped off with crushed ice to give the illusion that the cup is full. The skull bowl party drink was practically all ice. filled with ice cubes, some booze thrown in there, and then topped off with a mountain of crushed ice. Maybe this would be cool if drinks were like $9 or $10, but when I am paying $12 plus tip for these things, I would like more booze and less ice.   Anyways, enough of that, this place is cool, fun to go with friends, but not really a good intimate date spot.   I will go back in a couple weeks to see if they have ironed out the wrinkles...

P27aSCwfgpQKcaqNuwUn9w.review_text: Perfectly executed exotic drinks made with the same care and attention to detail as the guys who started it all. Great decor too. If only they served food, one could remain ere for hours.

WClnjIhd-XBViy6OlsdV7A.review_text: This is a good place for a date or to meet a group of friends.  Since I always avoid beer, I'm instantly attracted to a bar that caters to connoisseurs of expertly mixed drinks.  The atmosphere had plenty of energy, and the background noise never rose above a moderate din.  So conversations are easy and relaxed; shouting into my mates' ears was unnecessary.  I agree that the place can improve by employing either more bartenders or several cocktail waitresses (maybe they've done this by now; I was there Mar 2010).  Apart from the long wait for drinks, this is a great bar.

JRMLZpQ9jd4qzu63no6bsg.review_text: this place is amazing. the only complaint is that it is very small and you might have to wait in line to get in. totally worth a wait though. awesome nautical decor and amazing drinks.

-xT-klabhsCeIjrZogcEkA.review_text: There are many great fancy cocktails you can get, but if you just want a drink that doesn't have a fancy name, stick with a mojito! They are made just like this place in Mexico and it is the best mojito I have had!  Real mojito snob here

KXSzTO-bi6_Fcysm0mEHpg.review_text: absolutely love this place! it's really tiny so not really a place for large groups but it's definitely the place to visit once at least! i love the pirates theme, from the room decor to the variety of drinks! (mostly rum of course!) but the drinks are so delicious that id definitely try all of them if i live any closer!

3HHLpfU7q4HoREEOXtt7pw.review_text: ...Ello poppet...I mean, Smuggler's Cove!  This is like the Disneyland of tiki bars. It looks like a scene right out of Pirates of the Caribbean, except the rum is never gone ;) I was so SERIOUSLY impressed with this place when I walked in, pretty much deafened by the 'oohs' and 'ahhs' of my group as soon as we walked in.  What's equally as impressive, is the cocktail menu! First of all, it looks like a treasure map and it gives you a brief history about the drinks that they offer. After reading the menu from cover to cover, we decided to get a scorpion bowl - if you've been to Trad'r Sams or other tiki bars, you're familiar with this, but if you're not, it's a bowl filled with rum, gin, orange and lime - and it was tasty! But beware, it'll get ya.   This is such a fun place to go with friends. They have an upstairs area perfect for lounging and talking, and the main floor and downstairs area have bars and seating. It's a really fun place, and even though the projects are pretty much across the street, I would come here again.  The attentive bartenders, amazing drinks, and pirate theme (I LOVE pirates!!!) give this place an A+ in my book.

K1lkv1Zpnzsl3n08Zv04kg.review_text: Ahoy mateys! Where can thou gets a pint of rum served in a skull head bowl with sparkly gems flashing at you from beneath the dry ice induced mist?  Smuggler's Cove of course!  The drinks here were good. We had wandered over after a birthday party to continue on the festivities. The place is decorated fairly well, with nets on the ceiling and the whole nautical theme going on. I was particularly mesmerized with the multicolored blowfish that seemed to just float from the ceiling after a drink or two.   Cute intimate space. Probably would take folks visiting here just to scope it out.

5V1azKNKRbnmxu2bXDy95g.review_text: Meh.  The cocktails are are fancy and well presented but *severely* lacking in booze.  Like, watch the bartender put one measured shot in your beautiful $10 cocktail.  It's a great date spot, stop in after dinner for a night cap.  The vibe is upscale but casual, low sexy lighting with great nautical smuggler-y decor.  I just want more bang for my buck.

uMlX0xIG4pgp2xIQlY9PlQ.review_text: yes, it's tiny, and packed (with fans) and the bar tenders are extremely busy (and talented).... go expecting to wait, to enjoy the scenery and company, and eventually...  your perfect drink. Don't pass on the buttered rum, it's amazing. The decor is truly well done... a perfect cove of a wrecked pirate ship! Look for the green and red lights on Gough. No food is served, so eat up before or after at one of the MANY great restaurants nearby... if you want to stick with a bayou theme (think cajun) try the boxing room around the corner

KS7K4C8Gt8hTtFm46IJrvg.review_text: Awesome spot with a pirate theme (and not in a cheesy way). 3 story waterfall, really good cocktails, fun bartenders and the patrons are fairly laid back. I'd recommend to anyone to try at least once just for the experience.

J4sv-OKmwoCE1YmMLdhKog.review_text: I love a hidden bar. Especially when you visit a new city and get whisked away to a weird empty looking street and get marched into a nondescript door that leads you to a tiki bar.   Inside it's dark, with people huddled in corners everywhere they can fit, enjoying huge and crazy looking cocktails.   I came here with a group of new co-workers that ordered two enormous rum cocktails, both served in big wooden bowls and lit on fire before placing a good 8 straws in there. My kind of team bonding.   Decked out a bit like a pirate ship, the bar is split over a few levels and real estate is a premium at this vibey little spot. Given the brilliant rummy concoctions they specialse in, you would probably be fairly legless if you spent the evening here, but it's a great spot to stop in early at the start or end of a night for a fun nightcap.

dOi4DOAqncsohAOULkq7yg.review_text: Came here with a couple friends on a Tuesday after dinner and it was surprisingly packed. Small space, but do-able if you're able to snag one of their seating areas. Cool "pirate's cove" theme...but would not come here with any group larger than 4. Loved the extensive rum drink menu. I had the Aku-Aku (fresh pineapple, silver rum, and peach liqueur), wish it was served down...but otherwise no complaints! Fun if you're looking for a super casual place to chill.

g7oAzEuTFFOTFKBKEuNPWw.review_text: Such a  cool spot !! So damn hard to find they need to bedazzle that damn door LOL Love then downstairs area where it looks like ur below the deck of a ship. Its totally worth upgrading the drink to get the commemorative tiki cup. My hubby is a tiki fanatic and the other highest tiki bar is ALWAYS closed on my days off so happy to have found this place! Unheard of but uniquely tasty cocktails my bartender was awesome!

R4DVayqiW63jHle7AG_NXQ.review_text: This place is amazing. I keep expecting Jack Sparrow to come walking out of that place, so I can slap him.... "I deserved that!"  LOL. Anyway, it doesn't look like anything on the outside but go indoors and you will be transformed into a Pirates of the Caribbean movie. Three levels, great rum, stylish cool clientele... However come early or you will not be able to sit anywhere. I made the mistake of having my graduation party there, while we had a wonderful time we had to stand up for the most part as the place gets too packed.  Rum drinks are strong,  but to understand how many you should have, here is a little rhyme for you:  One's all right, Two's the most, Three under the table, & Four under the host!  Nuff said.

K4N1IULpV3ASPObZq3O2Cw.review_text: Yummy drinks, plenty of selection, and some faves to get you started. Small and dark contributed to the pirate feel, and the bartender was very attentive. We were there early, which was nice for a first time. Also plenty of non-rum drinks if you're not a huge fan being taken by a friend.

yi8CCJgoWPxKL75N-93RGg.review_text: me and my friends just came back from this bar tonight. When we got there, it was extremely packed, and there was nowhere to sit. That was unfortunate since we wanted to get one of the big drinks, but the bartender wouldn't let us without a table. We eventually just got a couple drinks. They were pretty good for the price. Even though the drinks were good, I am giving this place one star because of the bouncer. No matter how good the drinks are; nothing makes up for a bad attitude. He insulted me and cussed at me. I think that was extremely rude and I will for sure not come back.

x6dvCeJxJt4g6-1Zh57ZYQ.review_text: Aye!  If ye be looking for rum, this be the place!   haha!  ok, enough Pirate talk.  This is my favorite place to go rum drinking with friends.  If not for the guy checking id's and counting the number of people walking in, I'd probably forget it was there.   Lucky for us, we time it right so we don't wait in line outside.  I really like it for the atmosphere, and the drinks (duh!).  When you first enter from the street, it will take a minute for your eyes to adjust to the dark.  We always head down the stairs to order a drink and try and snag any spot to sit.  The menu is extensive, so if you are unsure, just tell the bartender what you like and they will make a cocktail you are sure to love!  Mine is the Batida, which may be light on alcohol, but delicious in flavor.  Don't worry though, there are plenty of other drinks that will knock your socks off in alcohol content, for example, Painkiller has options of strength.  And the hot buttered rum is such a warm and cozy drink, you will wish you were curled up by a crackling fireplace. (Oh sorry, fireplace is not included!)  Last time we went, the bouncer was explaining to the random chick outside that this is not a place where you go to get hit on.  I wholeheartedly agree!  Come with a couple of friends, and make new friends with whomever you end up next too.  There may be a wait for your drink, especially on a busy night, but it is worth it.  It can get loud, alcohol usually has that effect.  Cheers!

uzJv1TmioVGXwuwUeII1dw.review_text: Other Yelpers were not lying when they said this place is easy to miss. The inconspicuous black door gives no hint as to what's inside, which is something Luke the set of Pirates of the Carribbean.  The drinks are pricey but if you watch the bartender mix it, it's worth every penny. The bartenders are indeed mixologists! We sat at the bar and ordered a few drinks, one we each picked and the others were suggestions from the bartender.  Try them all.

ULyn4pVMHJqgMbulj86EEQ.review_text: Love this place, and still giving it 5 stars.  But I'm writing this review about the guy who works the door on Saturday night, Rodrigo.   I get it, it's Saturday, and there's a little bit of a line. But this guy is on a serious power trip and goes very far out of his way to be a dick. AND, he's hitting on the girls I came with, pretty aggressively. I'm writing this in the hope that the owners see it and fire this dbag. He should be working the door of a strip club, not a classy cocktail lounge.   Anyway, to the Yelpers, don't let this review stop you from going here - it's a GREAT spot, I always describe it to friends as "rainforest cafe for adults". The Presidente is my go-to cocktail.

hFuYtKcJKVLXLURJLx6DoQ.review_text: LOVE Smugglers!!  If you want a change from the standard bar drinks and you want to spice up your knowledge and pallet of rum based drinks then head to Smugglers! Get yourself an amazing selection of drinks you have never heard of!!! Caribbean inspired, the drink menu is complex but also extremely informative. The bartenders are skilled in making the 70 some odd "specialty drinks" and they make it with speed and precision.   Here are the drinks I tried, so far... - Trade Winds, loved it! - Banana Daiquiri, love, loved it - its' so far from the standard and that is why I love it. Smooth, lime kick and elegant (not your little smoothie cocktail) - Pain Killer, loved it! - Mai Tai, good but I love the fun one's I have never heard of now... - Mojito, again, good but if you come here try something NEW! - Port Au Prince, FUN - Puka Punch - great bang for your buck and tasty - Mary Pickford, taste kinda like it sounds - sour  - Aku Aku, yummy! - Pupule, ah, I know I tried this but I can't remember - Zombie, this is a strong one...as the name indicates  It's easy to just come here, close your eyes, and point at any item on the drink list and be impressed and surprised.  I've been to Smugglers 6 times and I still like going. Even with the wait outside the bar, once you are in it's a great time!!

B5NtgFHL0VNnfOFa3pirvg.review_text: Loved this place. The drinks were great. Loved the Scorpian Bowl and Hibiscus Rum Punch. The place is small, but fun. The island theme was really cool.

V9I-TUdXUWtKJkJ3u22gpQ.review_text: This is a great bar! The Bartenders have definatly mastered their craft. The prices are good. Because we know that Tiki drinks can be pricey. The Bartenders know what they are doing and what they are talking about.   The staff and this also includes the door guy are really friendly.    Which also brings me to what I didn't like about the place. Now I'm a guy who loves his dives over his trendy spots. (Offenders you know who you are)  The place is just too small. but the place tries to accommodate everyone. Hence the friendly door guy.   And this place might be a trendy spot....but certainly not one to become just a trend. It's a Tiki bar but it fits great with the neighborhood. And there's always great crowd to drink with. They aren't a Trader Vic's but the Bartenders and the staff hold it down well enough to provide good drink and a great atmosphere.  Try the Zombie it'll get you effed up!  I would really love to give this place 5 stars or more but the size of the place can be a downer if you go with a large crowd. On the upside if you like the Pirates of the Caribbean you're in luck. This place is like that.

0E7L58EyWJV5mOC4qxvjXg.review_text: This is not the first Rum bar in town, but it certainly has atmosphere.   One of my favorite spots in SF (Jade) used to be here. Glad it's reopened, since the underground section of this small bar is very charming and boasts a large fountain which cascades behind the stairs as you walk down.   The upstairs men's bathroom used to have a two-way mirror, which let you see through the bar (is my girlfriend flirting with that guy or is she blowing him off???). Terrible shame on the new owners for removing this fun accent.   Upstairs mezzanine is also very nice, a bit more private.   Nonetheless, Smuggler's Cove resembles Disney's Pirate's of The Caribbean ride, and though the decor is a bit cartooney the selection is very decent (they even offer a program similar to Tommy's Restaurant where you can sample Rum --will update on the quality of the education and selection once I finish it)   So check it out. Totally worth it.

OFi92Xc2QyIr787GNKtgZA.review_text: It's always a good time at Smuggler's Cove, whether you like rum or not. It's a small space filled with lots of people during peak hours, but what it lacks in space, Smuggler's Cove makes up in pirate atmosphere & drinks. The bartenders here really know how to make rum cocktails, punch bowls, and quickly too, a stark contrast to their speakeasy counterparts.  Since I tend to drink vodka & gin, I don't know my rum besides Captain Mo' so to my amusement when some naive patron asked what rum they used in their cocktails, "Pusser's Rum of course!" was chimed. Drinks here are strong and the selection is a bit overwhelming since your range of options come in a large binder (75 drinks!!).   To keep it short, if you're in a group you should definitely try one of their scorpion bowls or preferably any drink that gets lit up on fire as they're served. The Top Notch Volcano is a pretty popular one to get.   If you want something for yourself, try the Painkiller instead, it's an easy drink to chill on.  Best time to come by is after work before 8pm, there's lines even on Wednesday nights due to their increasing popularity.

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Came for happy hour on a Thursday, and it was pretty packed.  The bar is small, it is a Pirate themed bar, and it does kinda resemble Disney Land (but for adults).    I honestly can't remember what drink I had.  The bartneders were so nice.  I told them I wanted a Hawaiian-ish drink, and with rum, and *whallah*!  It appeared.  Cold, tasty, strong, and a bit spicy.    When SC first opened, I was supposed to go with friends, but there was a huge line outside (it was a Saturday night).  I don't really do lines, unless it's to see RPatz or something frivilous like that.  So we moseyed on.  I think the key is to go on a weeknight.  And... Thursday is the new Friday/Saturday, right?

Z9PfLcQRpzTg3jD3ccLmQA.review_text: a few years ago and writing as a (retired) avid drinker :P  I'd have adopted this as a second home!... they've got it right! their drinks are elaborate, balanced, tasty and the atmosphere is kinda "cuddly" ... great little hidden spot! but for now Giselle will "behave" and won't visit you... as often :P

0Cvgx6MKrSOTUxGoUpdaTg.review_text: Been here twice on random nights and both times this place was quite crowded.  Luckily both times I was able to snag a seat so that I didn't have to stand all night.  Drinks are very good and the bar keep definitely knows his stuff!  Can't wait to come back again...with more friends the next time!

EV4thH_tCKXz3DfNiRiH9g.review_text: I went with a friend to meet up with some friends of my friend late on Tuesday evening, 10 December.  One thing is that it is quite difficult to find; it could define 'hole in the wall.'  We only knew it was the place by the bouncer sitting on a stool outside.  Smuggler's Cove is divided into an upstairs bar and a downstairs bar -- the latter of which is better for groups.  The themes of this place are Caribbean mixed drinks and fine liquors; there is an extensive menu of drinks.  A bit skeptical, because I am much more a beer guy than a mixed-drink one, I ordered a batida, which is a Brazilian drink containing coconut milk served on the rocks.  It was, hands down, the best mixed drink that I have ever had!  These drinks are prepared with a considerable amount of care, so there is a wait, which should be found to be worth it.  Prices are high (but probably necessarily so); expect to spend $10-12 per drink.  Definitely one of the coolest places I went in my first trip to SF!

7tEUgFoRzy_TkOgzPQzCkA.review_text: Came here before dinner on Monday.  An interesting tiki bar tavern.  It's a lot smaller than I thought it was going to be, but still very cute.  They have an extensive rum menu and because I like rum, I had issues choosing a drink. All are priced from $8-$14, unless you get the scorpion for 4, which was around $25 (I think).  I ordered the Kona Cocktail, it was delish, just wish it wasn't served in a tiny martini glass, so I could have had a little more of it.  The bar was clean and the bartenders were friendly.  There isn't much seating so go early or be prepared to stand.    I'll be back if I'm in the area.

IIurtwGhcPMxHd3VSKmeJw.review_text: quirky fun place, not a place to go on a regular basis but its fun if youre new to the area or if you have friends visiting. the bartenders are fun to watch and the drinks are pretty good. I got the smugglers rum barrell, amazing.

Kr2Of3kgiUyNz74OyXnWnw.review_text: I've been hearing about this place for months and months now, and finally got to try it last night.  Very cool atmosphere!  I love the puffer fish lamps on the ceiling, and the netting and water features.  It was cozy, so my friends and I had to wait about 20 minutes to get a seat.  Once we were settled, though, all the drinks we had were fabulous.  I tried the puka punch, volcano (wow, fire!), Queen's park swizzle, and the Painkiller.  All were good in their unique way, and they were all different.  Among the best mixed drinks I've had in SF, if not the best.  I can see why my friends have been raving about it for so long.

PXEzQzh_LPasirXCesaCsQ.review_text: Thank you for Tiki Done really well. Often an era of cocktails overlooked.  Wonderful to have classic Tiki Cocktails replicated as they were originally designed. Also,  thank you for showing me the beauty of Passion Fruit and Bourbon together. Terrific setting I cant think of another place in the city that makes me feel so removed from my natural surroundings.

Szg--2wonu3BEdIav_vbCw.review_text: The waits are quite long But the drinks are delicious Love Hot butter rum

DlIk70y6gzCJZNNwekyHgw.review_text: Ugh smells of chlorine and hipsters. This place was weird and kind of grimy. It was dark and dank. The prices were def too high, it was clear we were subsidizing their tiki fetish. The downstairs bartenderess, kind of a goth older woman, was rude and seemed just bent in general. Just skip this place and go to rackhouse or some speakeasy. Tiki is tang anyways.

BKd9G83k_rO9ho6g2bqnTQ.review_text: Without a doubt the best drink I've had on my SF trip. Highly recommend the Puka Punch and the Tradewind. If you're a hot buttered rum person, that is not to be missed either. The downstairs bar was really neat, enjoyed the bubbling water on the staircase. This place is a must.

NMgMutTLuSShNGQYt9NRJQ.review_text: Great place, great cocktails.  But only 3 stars because the "getting in" experience SUCKS. The bouncer is awful. Really bad. He has such an attitude, making patrons feel very unwelcome. I understand that there may be capacity restrictions due to fire code, but this guy uses this as an excuse to be a jerk. He won't let people in, even if the bar if not even close to full; 6 people leave, but he won't let anyone in... But the worse is that he openly asks for BRIBES, yes cash to allow patrons in. Really?  Seriously, Management needs to do something about this guy. Get someone honest and respectful/respectable.

vSPL6XLwkOcZhGF6u4xDYg.review_text: This place is (*using high pitch voice*) AWESOME.  Not only is it a rum bar, but it's a pirate themed rum bar, oh yea! Cocktails are unique and better yet, strong! I got a Jamaican Milk Punch, and it tasted just like eggnog, the only problem I have with it is that it was a partial blended drink, why partial!? Or was the bartender just being a lazy ass? Either way, the drink had waaay too much ice, ice in small enough chunks to fit through your straw, which got pretty annoying, it needs less ice, or blended all the way.  They also brew a couple beers themselves, which were (*insert high pitch voice again*) awesome! If you're in a group, you should definitely try some of the drinks that serve for people, they come in a giant specialized cups that have fire on the outside!! FIRE!! If I'm ever in the SF area, I'll be sure to stop by again.  Maybe then I'll be able to check out the downstairs, when I went there was a private party and I was too much of a wuss to try to sneak in.

Xr8-dvZy7AnJwh3WQIJX4w.review_text: The drinks are so delicious and strong...watch out!

TDnoRfgfdcCMxiIQDsH04Q.review_text: Smuggler's Cove is the new bar that replaced Jade, and already they're getting used to the rowdy elderly woman neighbor Jade had to deal with and all sorts of good stuff.   Maximum capacity is only 49 and the bouncer has been keeping that strictly enforced, so that means, you guessed it, a waiting line. Not that I minded, it wasn't uber long. And I've had one too many experiences where Jade was a drunken clusterf---- that I'm happy for the breathing room. Ask to go over the drink menu while waiting in line because trust me, it'll take a long time to decide what to order (each drink includes details on its origin, what version recipe they're using, as well as what's in it), and even longer to actually get it.   They've blacked out the glass with really dark tint to keep the light out, the waterfall is gone, one-way glass is gone in favor of more bar shelving, and it's all about rock formations along the walls and huge primary colored globe-lights bound in rope netting. As a girl I felt like I ought to have come with a large white flower tucked in my hair.   The bartenders are friendly but distracted. They are still trying to learn the labor-intensive recipes and it's a huge elbow-bumping fest behind their small bar counter. Hopefully their turnaround time improves with experience.   The drinks are gorgeous and average $10 each. The owner really put a lot of effort into everything from decor, fresh juice squeezed daily, an exclusive rum from St. George's, frothy egg whites, to the individually hand-blown glasses that the punch is served in (a credit card deposit is required for the bowl).   Now, I'm not a person that was ever a particular fan of tiki bars, but this one brings the experience to a whole new level of fun without the cheesy campiness.   FANNED.

VO8tak4IGn2f3OBGqdIgxg.review_text: Love this bar! The interior is awesome, the drinks are DELICIOUS, and tho it's cozy (small) it's comfy. The staff make you feel welcome and even when the bartenders are knee deep in drink orders they remain cool, calm and collected. My drinks were all equally tasty no matter what the wait was like. I've only been twice, but already have plans to bring all my out of town friends and meet my in town friends as well. I'll be back!!! Plus I have to work my way thru the drink menu, I'm in it to win it!  A welcome edition to SF for sure.

Avt9zIF9QHgwzDnKzG_JQQ.review_text: Great decor and strong drinks for the pirate at heart. A little packed but worth the wait Arrrrrrrgh.

A_oFqwm2IEMBIv0YCp5y7Q.review_text: If you're looking for a trendy bar with flair bartenders, loud music and dirt cheap, sloppy drinks please go elsewhere.
